Bei KI-Fraktionen ist diese Einschränkung aufgehoben. Grundsätzlich ausgenommen sind alle Berufe, die außerhalb des Stadtbildschirms ausgeübt werden, mit Ausnahme des Pioniers. Bei Experten, die regulär eine Akademie oder sogar eine Universität zur Ausbildung brauchen, sind die Aufstiegs-Wahrscheinlichkeiten reduziert bzw. sehr reduziert. Zudem sind die Aufstiegs-Wahrscheinlichkeiten an die Spielgeschwindigkeit angepasst.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Aufstieg zu Freien Kolonisten[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Schuldknechte[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Kleinkriminelle[\LINK] können durch Arbeit in einem LbD-Beruf zu Freien Kolonisten werden. Unterbrechungen der Arbeit sind folgenlos, solange kein anderer Beruf als ein beliebiger LbD-Beruf für eine komplette Spielrunde ausgeübt wird. Je höher der LbD-Lernlevel des aktuellen Berufes ist, desto größer ist die Aufstiegswahrscheinlichkeit zum Freien Kolonisten. Bei Schuldknechten ist der Aufstieg doppelt so wahrscheinlich als bei einem Kleinkriminellen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Flucht[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Schuldknechte und Kleinkriminelle können fliehen und dadurch verschwinden. Nicht möglich ist das, wenn diese Einheiten einen Beruf außerhalb des Stadtbildschirms wahrnehmen oder wenn eine Stadt nur einen einzigen Bevölkerungspunkt hat. Bei KI-Fraktionen ist dieses Feature grundsätzlich deaktiviert. Bei Kleinkriminellen ist der Aufstieg anderthalbmal so wahrscheinlich als bei einem Schuldknecht.[PARAGRAPH:1]Im Spiel gibt es auch Einheiten, die man als [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Super Spezialisten[COLOR_REVERT] bezeichnen kann: der [LINK=UNIT_NOBLE]Berühmte Edelmann[\LINK] und der [LINK=UNIT_BISHOP]Bischof[\LINK]. Diese sind für Freiheitsglocken bzw. Kreuze mit Abstand die effektivsten Einheiten. Sie können weder ausgebildet noch gekauft werden. Man kann sie nur durch seltene [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatie-Events[\LINK] oder [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Gründerväter[\LINK] erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]SPECIALISTI[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Gli specialisti sono unita altamente addestrate, in grado di produrre incredibili quantità di materie prime e di beni con lo stesso costo in [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]cibo[\LINK] di un normale colono. L'impiego degli specialisti è il segreto per rendere la tua colonia il più produttiva possibile. Assegnando uno specialista alla [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professione[\LINK] che trovi nel suo nome, otterrai diversi tipi di bonus per la tua colonia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ottenere specialisti[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Puoi ottenere gli specialisti in quattro modi: reclutandoli dall'[LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] (a un prezzo molto caro), sperando che lo [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]specialista[\LINK] che ti serve appaia come immigrante, costruendo una [LINK=BUILDING_SCHOOLHOUSE]scuola[\LINK], un [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]college[\LINK] o un'[LINK=BUILDING_UNIVERSITY]università[\LINK] e addestrandoli per conto tuo, oppure inviando un'unità a vivere in mezzo ai [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK] per imparare un mestiere.[PARAGRAPH:2]Puoi anche rimuovere la specializzazione di unità se vuoi. Selezionando "Rimuovi specializzazione" tra gli ordini di uno specialista, puoi trasformarlo permanentemente in un libero colono.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Categorie di specialisti[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ci sono diverse varietà di specialisti, ma si dividono in quattro categorie principali:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Esperti di materie prime[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Tutte le unità con la parola "esperto" (tranne lo scout) nel nome sono specializzate nella produzione di materie prime. Questi specialisti, quando vengono assegnati alla [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professione[\LINK] che permette loro di produrre la materia prima preferita, ne produrranno nella maggior parte dei casi in quantità doppia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mastri artigiani[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Tutte le unità con la parola "mastro" nel nome sono specializzate nella creazione di enormi quantità di beni. Questi specialisti, quando vengono assegnati alla [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professione[\LINK] che permette loro di fabbricare i beni che preferiscono, ne produrranno in quantità doppia. Per poter fabbricare i beni in più, però, dovranno poter accedere a una maggiore quantità di materie prime.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Statisti anziani e predicatori fanatici[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Statisti anziani[\LINK] e [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]predicatori fanatici[\LINK] sono due singolari unità che si trovano a cavallo tra i produttori di materie prime e i fabbricanti di beni. Gli [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]statisti anziani[\LINK] e i [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]predicatori fanatici[\LINK] sono produttori di materie prime, dato che producono rispettivamente [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]campane della libertà[\LINK] e croci. Ma per farlo devono poter accedere a edifici speciali: un [LINK=BUILDING_TOWNHALL]municipio[\LINK] nel caso dello [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]statista[\LINK] e una [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]chiesa[\LINK] o una [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]cattedrale[\LINK] nel caso del [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]predicatore[\LINK]. I bonus vengono applicati solo quando questi specialisti operano all'interno dei rispettivi edifici.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Specialisti esterni[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]Robusti pionieri[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]scout esperti[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]soldati veterani[\LINK] e [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]missionari gesuiti[\LINK] praticano le proprie abilità all'esterno dell'[LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamento[\LINK]. Una volta assegnati alla [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professione[\LINK] appropriata (cosa che puoi fare dalla schermata dell'insediamento o usando l'ordine "Cambia professione" quando lo specialista e al di fuori dell'insediamento), possono apportare una serie di bonus speciali. Nota bene che, di questi specialisti, solo il [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]missionario gesuita[\LINK] non ha bisogno di qualche tipo di bene per assumere la propria [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]professione[\LINK].[H1]LEARNING BY DOING[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Hard working citizens may rise in society and become experts in their professions. Indentured Servants and Petty Criminals however might also become fed up working for the free citizens and flee from your colonies, if they do not become free citizens through their hard work. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Getting Experts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The longer a citizen is working in one and the same profession the higher his chances are to become an expert. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Getting Experts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The longer an Indentured Servant or Petty Criminal work in a city or as pioneer, the higher their chances are to be accepted into society as free citizen. Indentured Servants have higher chances than Petty Criminals. The higher renowned the profession they are working in, the faster this process. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fleeing[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] Unhappy Indentured Servants and Petty Criminals might flee. With Petty Criminals, this is twice as likely as with Indentured Servants.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]ESPECIALISTAS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Los especialistas son unidades muy entrenadas, capaces de producir tanto cantidades impresionantes de materias primas como mercancías, al mismo coste en [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK] que un Colono normal. La clave para hacer a tu colonia lo más productiva posible es emplear a especialistas. Al asignar a un especialista la [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] que corresponde a su nombre, éste aportará a la colonia todo tipo de bonificaciones.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Adquisición de especialistas[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Puedes adquirir especialistas de una de estas cuatro maneras: contratándolos en la pantalla de [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] (a un costoso precio); esperando que el especialista que necesitas llegue como [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]inmigrante[\LINK]; construyendo una [LINK=BUILDING_SCHOOLHOUSE]Escuela[\LINK], un [LINK=BUILDING_COLLEGE]Colegio universitario[\LINK] o una [LINK=BUILDING_UNIVERSITY]Universidad[\LINK] y entrenándoles tú mismo; o enviando a una unidad a vivir entre los [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Nativos[\LINK] para que aprenda un oficio.[PARAGRAPH:2]También puedes eliminar una especialidad de la unidad si así lo deseas. Si seleccionas "Borrar especialidad" de las órdenes de un especialista, puedes convertir a ese especialista en Colono libre permanentemente.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tipos de especialistas[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Hay varios tipos diferentes de especialistas, aunque se dividen en cuatro categorías principales:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Expertos en materias primas[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Toda unidad con la palabra "experto" al final de su nombre es especialista en la producción de materias primas. Dar una [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] a estos especialistas les permite producir el material que les es propio, con lo que generarán, en la mayoría de casos, el doble de lo normal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Maestros de mercancías manufacturadas[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Toda unidad con la palabra "Maestro" al principio de su nombre se compone de especialistas hábiles en crear enormes cantidades de mercancías manufacturadas. Asignarlos a una [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] que les permita crear las mercancías que les son propias hará que los Maestros creen el doble de lo normal. Sin embargo, para crear más mercancías deben tener acceso a una mayor cantidad de materias primas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Estadistas mayores y Predicadores exaltados[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Los [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Estadistas mayores[\LINK] y los [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Predicadores exaltados[\LINK] son los dos únicos productores que comparten características de la producción de materias primas y de la producción de las manufacturadas. Los [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Estadistas mayores[\LINK] y los [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Predicadores exaltados[\LINK] son productores de materias primas, pues fabrican [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Campanas de la libertad[\LINK] y Cruces respectivamente. Pero, para ello, deben tener acceso a edificios especiales: un [LINK=BUILDING_TOWNHALL]Ayuntamiento[\LINK] en el caso del [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Estadista[\LINK] y una [LINK=BUILDING_CHURCH]Iglesia[\LINK] o [LINK=BUILDING_CATHEDRAL]Catedral[\LINK] en el caso del [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Predicador[\LINK], como ocurre con otros Maestros. Solo se aplicarán sus bonificaciones cuando trabajen en sus respectivos edificios.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Especialistas externos[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Tanto los [LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]Pioneros avezados[\LINK], como los [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Batidores curtidos[\LINK], los [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Soldados veteranos[\LINK] y los [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Misioneros jesuitas[\LINK] ejercen su especialidad fuera del [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamiento[\LINK]. Una vez que se les asigna una [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] adecuada _cosa que puedes hacer desde la pantalla del asentamiento o bien usando la orden "Cambiar de profesión", siempre que el especialista se encuentre fuera del asentamiento_, pueden proporcionar varios tipos de bonificaciones especiales. Ten en cuenta que, de estos especialistas, solo el [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Misionero jesuita[\LINK] no necesita ninguna cantidad de mercancías para iniciar la [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]profesión[\LINK] que se le ha destinado.[H1]LEARNING BY DOING[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Hard working citizens may rise in society and become experts in their professions. Indentured Servants and Petty Criminals however might also become fed up working for the free citizens and flee from your colonies, if they do not become free citizens through their hard work. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Getting Experts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The longer a citizen is working in one and the same profession the higher his chances are to become an expert. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Getting Experts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The longer an Indentured Servant or Petty Criminal work in a city or as pioneer, the higher their chances are to be accepted into society as free citizen. Indentured Servants have higher chances than Petty Criminals. The higher renowned the profession they are working in, the faster this process. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fleeing[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] Unhappy Indentured Servants and Petty Criminals might flee. With Petty Criminals, this is twice as likely as with Indentured Servants.

TEXT.English: [H1]PIONEERS AND IMPROVEMENTS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To tame the wilderness of the New World, you can build [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Improvements[COLOR_REVERT] that further increase your colony's output. Building improvements is an excellent way to cheaply increase your production of different kinds of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raw Materials[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]How to Build Improvements[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To build Improvements, first you need a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pioneer[COLOR_REVERT]. You may assign one of your colonists to the [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneer[\LINK] profession from the Settlement Screen, but only if your [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlement[\LINK] has enough tools available. The number of Tools that is required for equipping Pioneers depends on the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Game Speed[COLOR_REVERT] on which you play the game.[PARAGRAPH:2]Once you have a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pioneer[COLOR_REVERT], you may move him onto a Plot and begin building Improvements. The Pioneer can continue to build indefinitely.[PARAGRAPH:2]Most improvements can only be constructed inside your [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK]. Improvements that can be built outside your Borders provide no yield bonuses of Raw Materials.[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Production Speed[COLOR_REVERT] of Pioneers is dependent on the type of action he is assigned to perform, the kind of terrain he finds himself on and certain bonuses of Leaders. The speed can also be doubled by employing [LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]Hardy Pioneers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1] Actions of Pioneers almost always require a small sum of gold to be paid. A few of them, like Draining Marshes, require more than 100 gold.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT][BOLD]Types of Improvements[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Roads[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT] help speed transport of your units across open land. Moving across a Road tile costs 1/2 the normal amount of movement points. Roads can be built on any non-water plot. There are two other types of Roads, that can be built on plots with Roads already present: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plastered Roads[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Railroads[COLOR_REVERT]. These allow a unit to move respectively 3 times and 4 times faster.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lodges[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Lodges and Lumbermills[\LINK] can only be built on tiles with vegetation. They increase the [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Lumber[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_VALUABLE_WOOD]Valuable Wood[\LINK] output of those tiles. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LUMBERJACK_CAMP]Lumberjack Camps[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mines[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]Mines[\LINK] can be built on all Hill and Mountain tiles, as well as on all [LINK=TERRAIN_DESERT]Desert[\LINK] Terrain. Mines increase the amount of [LINK=YIELD_ORE]Ore[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_RAW_SALT]Rock Salt[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SILVER]Silver[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_GEMS]Gems[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_GOLD]Gold[\LINK] those tiles produce, although in some of those cases a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bonus Resource[COLOR_REVERT] needs to be present to be able to produce that yield at all. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_DEEP_MINE]Large Mines[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Farms[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]Farms[\LINK] can be built on nearly any flat, unforested tile (Tundra and Snow tiles cannot support Farms). Building a Fram will greatly increase a tile's [LINK=VIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_BARLEY]Barley[\LINK] Output, and gives smaller boosts to other resources as well. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_FARM]Large Farms[\LINK] if your colonists work them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Plantations[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_PLANTATION]Plantations[\LINK] can also be built on nearly any flat, unforested tile (Tundra and Snow tiles cannot support Plantations). Building a Plantation will greatly increase a tile's output of various resources other than Food or Barley, although these receive minor boosts as well. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_PLANTATION]Large Plantations[\LINK] if your colonists work on them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cocoa Plantations[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COCOA_PLANTATION]Cocoa Plantations[\LINK] can be built only in [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK], and they increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_COCOA_FRUITS]Cocoa Pods[\LINK] and, in a smaller degree, the production of [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] as well. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_COCOA_PLANTATION]Large Cocoa Plantations[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Vineyards[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_VINEYARD]Vineyards[\LINK] can be built exclusively on Hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grass[\LINK] Terrain. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_GRAPES]Grapes[\LINK], and to a smaller degree the production of [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] as well. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_VINEYARDS]Old Vineyards[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Pastures[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_PASTURE]Pastures[\LINK] can be built both on flat and hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grass[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] Terrain. They increase the production of all three kinds of [LINK=CONCEPT_CATTLE_OR_SHEEP_BREEDING]Livestock[\LINK] They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_PASTURE]Large Pastures[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Collectors Posts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_POST]Collectors Posts[\LINK] can be built only on hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK] Terrain. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_RED_PEPPER]Red Pepper[\LINK] on these tiles, and also give a minor boost to the production of [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK]. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_DEPOT]Collectors Depots[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Trapper Huts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_HUT]Trapper Huts[\LINK] can be built in all kinds of forests except for Jungles, as well as on [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]Tundra[\LINK] Terrain and on plots with the [LINK=BONUS_BISON]Bisons[\LINK] Bonus. They increase the amount of [LINK=YIELD_FUR]Fur[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_PREMIUM_FUR]Premium Fur[\LINK] that is produced on such tiles. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_CAMP]Trapper Camps[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Quarries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_QUARRY]Quarries[\LINK] can be built only on [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Peaks[COLOR_REVERT]. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_STONE]Stone[\LINK]. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_QUARRY]Large Quarries[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Coca Posts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_POST2]Coca Posts[\LINK] can be built only on Hills of [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] Terrain. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_COCA_LEAVES]Coca Leaves[\LINK], and they also give a minor bonus for [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] production. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COLLECTORS_DEPOT2]Coca Depots[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Forts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FORT]Forts[\LINK] can be built on all tiles, and they can also be built outside your borders, but not inside the borders of another nation. They provide no bonuses for the production of Raw Materials, but they provide a large [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] to units fortified inside. They also discourage Native Braves in the vicinity from [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVE_RAIDS]Raiding[\LINK] your settlements. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_FORT]Large Forts[\LINK] if military troops are stationed in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Monasteries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MONASTERY]Monasteries[\LINK] can be built on any land plot, and they can also be built outside your borders, but not inside the borders of another nation. They do not give bonuses in Raw Material yields. They work once a [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK] is stationed inside them. They can then generate several positive events, specified in the Game Concept page for [LINK=CONCEPT_MONASTERIES]Monasteries[\LINK]. They automatically become [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_MONASTERY]Large Monasteries[\LINK] if your colonists work in them long enough.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT][BOLD]Other Pioneer Actions[\BOLD][COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Clearing Forests[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pioneer units can also cut down any kind of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Vegetation[COLOR_REVERT]. This will permanently remove this feature from a tile, and it will also generate a small amount of [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Lumber[\LINK] in a nearby colony.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Plant Forest[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pioneers can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plant Vegetation[COLOR_REVERT]. [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Forests[\LINK] can be planted on [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grass[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK] can be planted on [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]Marsh[\LINK] and [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST_TUNDRA]Taigas[\LINK] can be planted on [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]Tundra[\LINK]. This is an expensive project in terms of money, and it will also take quite some time to be completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Drain Marsh[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Marshes[COLOR_REVERT] can be drained by Pioneers as well. This will turn it into [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Savannah[COLOR_REVERT]. Like planting Forests, this is an expensive project in terms of money, and it will also take quite some time to be completed.
TEXT.French: [H1]AMÉLIORATIONS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pour dompter la nature sauvage du Nouveau Monde, vous pouvez construire des améliorations qui augmenteront la production de votre colonie. Construire des améliorations est une excellente façon d'augmenter à moindre coût votre production de matières premières. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Faire des améliorations[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pour faire des améliorations, il vous faut avant tout un [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK]. Vous pouvez attribuer la profession de [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK] à un de vos colons à partir de l'écran de village, mais uniquement si votre [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colonie[\LINK] dispose de 50 outils.[PARAGRAPH:2]Lorsque vous disposez d'un [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK], vous pouvez l'envoyer dans n'importe quelle case que vous contrôlez et commencer à construire des améliorations. Le [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK] peut continuer à construire indéfiniment.[PARAGRAPH:2]Vous ne pouvez construire des améliorations qu'à l'intérieur de vos [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]frontières[\LINK]. Les améliorations hors de vos [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]frontières[\LINK] ne vous procurent pas de bonus. Les routes sont la seule exception, car elles peuvent aussi être construites et utilisées en territoire neutre. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Types d'améliorations[NEWLINE]Routes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les routes permettent à vos unités de se déplacer plus rapidement en terrain découvert. Traverser une case de route coûte moitié moins de points de mouvement. Une route peut être construite dans n'importe quelle case, à l'exception des cases maritimes ou montagneuses.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cabane[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]cabanes[\LINK] peuvent être construites uniquement sur les cases de forêt ou de jungle, où elles augmentent la production de bois et de fourrures. Leur construction prend quelques tours et coûte une petite quantité d'or.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mine[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]mines[\LINK] peuvent être construites uniquement dans les cases de collines, où elles augmentent la production de minerai et d'argent. Leur construction prend plusieurs tours et coûte une petite quantité d'or.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ferme[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]fermes[\LINK] peuvent être construites sur toute case plane et non boisée (les cases de toundra et de neige ne sont pas compatibles avec ce type de construction), où elles augmentent considérablement la production de [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]nourriture[\LINK], de tabac, de sucre ou de coton. Leur construction prend également plusieurs tours et coûte une petite quantité d'or.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Abattage des forêts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Le [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionnier[\LINK] peut aussi abattre les forêts et les jungles sur les cases où cette végétation est présente et la faire disparaître définitivement.
TEXT.German: [H1]Modernisierungen[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Die Verbesserung von Geländefeldern durch [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]Bauernhöfe[\LINK], [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Holzfällerhütten[\LINK], [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LUMBERMILL]Sägemühlen[\LINK], [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]Minen[\LINK] und anderen Geländeverbesserungen erhöht den Ertrag der jeweiligen Rohstoffe. Die neue Geländemodernisierung [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_PLANTATION]Plantage[\LINK] liefert zwar nur eine zusätzliche Nahrungseinheit, aber gleich drei zusätzliche Kolonialrohstoffe. Ohne den Einsatz von [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionieren[\LINK] ist es also kaum noch möglich, große Siedlungen effektiv wirtschaften zu lassen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Sie können jedem ihrer Bürger, der sich in einer Siedlung aufhält, den Beruf Pionier zuweisen. Dafür muss die Einheit einmalig mit 50 Eisenwaren aus dem Lager ausgestattet werden. Alternativ dazu kann man einem beliebigen Bürger, der im europäischen Heimathafen auf die Überfahrt in die Neue Welt wartet, per Doppelklick den Beruf Pionier zuweisen. Die dafür notwendigen Eisenwaren werden dabei automatisch in Europa gekauft.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Der Pionier kann bestimmte Geländefelder durch die Errichtung einer passenden Modernisierung aufwerten. Minen fördern dann mehr Erz und Silber, Lagerstätten mehr Holz und Pelze, Bauernhöfe und Plantagen mehr Nahrung, Tabak, Zucker und Baumwolle. Es dauert einige Runden, diese Modernisierungen zu bauen. Die Aufwertung eines Geländefeldes ist nicht gratis, sondern kostet jeweils 20 Gold (Plantage: 40 Gold). Nur Rodungsarbeiten sind kostenlos.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Straßen[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Landstraßen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]gepflasterte Straßen[COLOR_REVERT] reduzieren die Fortbewegungskosten für dieses Geländefeld. Das Roden von Wald oder Dschungel entfernt die Bäume dauerhaft von einem Geländefeld und liefert einer benachbarten Siedlung einmalig eine kleine Menge Holz.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_PIONEER][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kühne Pioniere[COLOR_REVERT][\LINK] sind die Spezialisten für diesen Beruf, sie arbeiten doppelt so schnell. Man bekommt sie in Europa, durch die Ausbildung in Siedlungen mit einer Schule oder manchen Indianerdörfern.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]MIGLIORAMENTI[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Per sottomettere i territori selvaggi del Nuovo Mondo, puoi costruire miglioramenti atti a potenziare la produzione della tua colonia. Costruire miglioramenti è un modo eccellente per aumentare la produzione di materiali spendendo poco. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Come costruire miglioramenti[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Per costruire i miglioramenti hai bisogno di un[LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioniere[\LINK]. Puoi assegnare uno dei tuoi coloni alla professione di [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioniere[\LINK] dalla schermata dell'insediamento, ma solo se il tuo [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamento[\LINK] ha a disposizione 50 attrezzi.[PARAGRAPH:2]Dopo aver creato un [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioniere[\LINK], puoi spostarlo su qualsiasi casella controlli e cominciare a costruire miglioramenti. Il [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pioniere[\LINK] può continuare a costruire per un tempo indefinito.[PARAGRAPH:2]Puoi costruire miglioramenti solamente all'interno dei tuoi [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]confini[\LINK]. I miglioramenti al di fuori dei tuoi [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]confini[\LINK] non danno alcun bonus. Le strade sono l'unica eccezione a questa regola, dato che possono essere costruite e utilizzate anche in territorio neutrale. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tipi di miglioramenti[NEWLINE]Strade[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Le strade aiutano a velocizzare il trasporto delle tue unità in terreno aperto. Spostarsi su una strada costa la metà dei normali punti movimento. Le strade possono essere costruite su qualsiasi casella che non sia d'acqua o di montagna.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Capanno[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Il miglioramento [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]capanno[\LINK] può essere costruito esclusivamente su caselle con foresta o giungla. Aumenta la produzione di pellicce e legname di quelle caselle. Per costruirlo ci vogliono un po' di turni e costa una piccola quantità d'oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Miniere [\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Le [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]miniere[\LINK] possono essere costruite solo sulle caselle di collina, ma aumentano la quantità di minerale e argento prodotta. La loro costruzione richiede diversi turni e costano una piccola quantità d'oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fattoria[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Puoi costruire una [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]fattoria[\LINK] su qualsiasi casella piatta e senza foresta (le caselle innevate e di tundra non posso supportare le fattorie). Costruire una [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]fattoria[\LINK] potenzierà notevolmente la produzione di [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]cibo[\LINK], tabacco, zucchero o cotone di una casella. Anche la costruzione di questo miglioramento richiede diversi turni e costa una piccola quantità d'oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Abbattere le foreste[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]I [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionieri[\LINK] possono anche abbattere foreste e giungle, rimuovendole permanentemente dalla casella interessata.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Mejoras[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Para dominar la naturaleza salvaje del Nuevo Mundo puedes construir mejoras, que aumentan aún más el rendimiento de tu colonia. La construcción de mejoras es una manera excelente de aumentar a bajo coste la producción de materiales. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cómo realizar mejoras[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Para ello, primero has de tener a un [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionero[\LINK]. Puedes asignar a uno de tus Colonos a la profesión de [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionero[\LINK] en la pantalla del asentamiento, pero solo si el [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamiento[\LINK] tiene 50 Herramientas disponibles.[PARAGRAPH:2]Cuando tengas un [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionero[\LINK], podrás llevarlo a cualquier casilla que controles y empezar a construir mejoras. El [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionero[\LINK] puede seguir construyendo indefinidamente.[PARAGRAPH:2]Solo puedes construir mejoras dentro de tus [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]fronteras[\LINK]. Las mejoras que haya fuera de éstas no proporcionan bonificaciones. Las carreteras son la única excepción a esta regla, ya que también pueden construirse en territorio neutral. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Tipos de mejoras[NEWLINE]Carreteras[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Las carreteras ayudan a acelerar el transporte de las unidades por tierra. Moverse por una casilla de carretera cuesta la mitad de los puntos de movimiento normales. Las carreteras se pueden construir en cualquier casilla que no tenga agua ni montaña.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Pabellón[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Las mejoras de los [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]pabellones[\LINK] solo pueden construirse en casillas con bosques o selva. Aumentan el rendimiento de Pieles y Madera de esas casillas. Construir estas mejoras tarda unos cuantos turnos y cuesta una pequeña cantidad de Oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mina [\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Las [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]Minas[\LINK] solo se pueden construir en casillas de colina, pero aumentan la cantidad de Mineral y Plata que éstas producen. Construirlas tarda varios turnos y cuesta una pequeña cantidad de Oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Granja[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Se pueden construir [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]Granjas[\LINK] en casi cualquier casilla llana y sin bosque (las casillas de tundra y de nieve no pueden albergarlas). Construir una [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FARM]granja[\LINK] aumentará mucho el rendimiento de [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Alimentos[\LINK], Tabaco, Azúcar o Algodón de la casilla. Construirlas también tarda varios turnos y cuesta una pequeña cantidad de Oro.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Despejar bosques[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Los [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneros[\LINK] también pueden despejar bosques y selvas. Esto eliminará para siempre el accidente de bosque o selva de la casilla.

TEXT.English: [H1]NATIVES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]At the start of the game, the New World belongs to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Natives[COLOR_REVERT]. Major parts of the New World are settled by them, so if you want to come out on top of the colonial heap, you will have to barter, bribe and battle the Natives to ensure your own supremacy.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Encountering Natives[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Thirty[COLOR_REVERT] different Native Peoples in the New World that you can encounter. Each has their own culture, mentality and sentiments towards outsiders. For an overview of all nations that are part of the game, see the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Colonies and Natives[COLOR_REVERT] Section of the Colopedia.[NEWLINE]You automatically begin the game at peace with the natives and are able to travel through their territory without consequence, as they ignore all [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK]. This means that they travel freely through your territory as well. A wise colonial leader will make friends with the natives early, as many native groups will provide your colony with gifts as a sign of friendship.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Visiting Native Settlements[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]When one of your units enters a Native [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlement[\LINK] where none of your units has been before, you can select the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]"Speak with Chief"[COLOR_REVERT] button on the bottom of your screen. If that unit is the first European unit to ever speak to that settlement's chief, he may receive several points of Experience, maps that reveal previously unexplored lands, a gift of gold, a [LINK=UNIT_TREASURE]Treasure[\LINK] unit or, if the unit is a [LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scout[\LINK] that hasn't learned a specialism yet, he might instantaneously be converted to a [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Seasoned Scout[\LINK]. Seasoned Scouts are vital to your early contacts with Natives, as they get much greater gifts of gold from them.[PARAGRAPH:1]Once you have contacted the Chief, you will also be able to see what [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Profession[COLOR_REVERT] that Settlement can teach to colonists, as well its [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Preferred Good[\LINK], which is a good Natives will pay extra high prices for when you sell it to them in that Settlement. You can see both these things by viewing the Information Panel widget below the settlement on the Main Map.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Training[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If you are on good terms with the Natives, you can march any [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Free Colonist[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Indentured Servant[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Native[\LINK] into a Native Settlement and have that unit be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Trained[COLOR_REVERT] in that village's area of expertise. This means that a [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Free Colonist[\LINK] can be transformed into an [LINK=UNIT_FISHERMAN]Expert Fisherman[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_COTTON_PLANTER]Expert Cotton Planter[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_MINER]Expert Miner[\LINK] and so on. Each village has only one area of expertise, which never changes.[NEWLINE]Once a colonist is accepted into a Native Settlement to be trained, the unit disappears for a few turns, after which it emerges again in that settlement as a trained expert.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Missions[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Convert[COLOR_REVERT] natives to your religion, and have them join your colonies. There are two ways to do this.[PARAGRAPH:1]The first way is by establishing [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]Missions[\LINK] in Native Settlements. By assigning a colonist to the [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK] profession, which you can only do in one of your own Settlements or on the docks in Europe, you can march your newly-created Missionary into a native settlement and create a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mission[COLOR_REVERT]. Over time, missions will generate [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Natives[\LINK] interested in joining your newly formed colony. Converted Natives are exceptional producers of raw materials and horses (although they cannot take up military professions), so if you are looking for a boost of raw materials production, a Mission is an excellent investment.[PARAGRAPH:1]The other way of convincing Natives to join your colonies is by building [LINK=CONCEPT_MONASTERY]Monasteries[\LINK]. These improvements can be built by [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK] on any plot that lies either within your borders, or in the Wilderness that is not claimed by any nation. Moving a Missionary into the Monastery and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fortifying[COLOR_REVERT] him on that plot will make him work the Monastery. If they are worked, Monasteries will occasionally convert Native Braves wandering by, and generate other small bonuses as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Trading with Natives[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Natives can be valuable [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Trading Partners[COLOR_REVERT] in the New World. While they are adept in manufacturing all kinds of raw materials, they are especially good in hunting and trapping and gathering [LINK=YIELD_FUR]Fur[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_PREMIUM_FUR]Premium Fur[\LINK], while they are also quite good in mining valuable earth resources like [LINK=YIELD_SILVER]Silver[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_GOLD]Gold[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_GEMS]Gems[\LINK]. They will offer these resources for low prices, after which you can sell them again in Europe for significantly higher prices.[PARAGRAPH:1]Natives are also very interested in buying goods they cannot make themselves. This includes manufactured goods like [LINK=YIELD_RUM]Rum[\LINK] or [LINK=YIELD_LEATHER]Leather[\LINK], but also [LINK=CONCEPT_CATTLE_OR_SHEEP_BREEDING]Livestock[\LINK], especially [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK], which they need to make [LINK=PROFESSION_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Mounted Braves[\LINK]. Once they get their hands on a specific kind of Liverstock, they will be able to start breeding with it.[NEWLINE]The goods that Natives value highest are [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK]. They pay high prices for them, much higher even than the prices for which you buy them in Europe. Once they have Muskets, the Natives are able to make [LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_BRAVE]Armed Braves[\LINK] and [LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Armed Mounted Braves[\LINK], their strongest soldiers, so be careful to which Natives you sell your Guns, or you will see them pointed against you at some point![PARAGRAPH:1]You can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bargain[COLOR_REVERT] with Natives to attempt to get better deals out of it. However, don't push your luck to far, for this can ruin your relationship with them! In addition to this, settlements get angry if you insulted them to much with your bargaining, and will refuse to trade with you for a few turns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Purchasing Land[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]When you build a new settlement near a native settlement, you will be given the option to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Purchase[COLOR_REVERT] the land your Settlement uses from the natives or simply [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Steal[COLOR_REVERT] the land. If you buy the land, the gold will instantly be removed from your treasury, and the Natives will renounce any claims they previously made on that territory. But if you decide to steal the land, your gold will remain the same, but your relations with the Natives will worsen for every tile you take.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Raids[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If your relations with the natives are less than stellar, they may on Occasionally [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raid[COLOR_REVERT] your settlements or attack unprotected [LINK=UNIT_TREASURE]Treasure[\LINK] units you own. While you can attack them right back, you will need to declare [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK] on them first, while Native Raids are an act of aggression that does not require a war to be declared.[PARAGRAPH:1]Raids can happen to your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cities[COLOR_REVERT] and to unprotected [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Treasures[COLOR_REVERT]. While the willingness to raid European colonies differs vastly among different native tribes, Native Raids usually are a clear sign that your relations to a Native Nation are dangerously low. An exception would be the case in which the natives were incited to raid by [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]Missionaries[\LINK] of rival Colonial Powers.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you defend your colonies properly, Native Raids will often be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Unsuccessful[COLOR_REVERT], and sometimes, the raiding party might even be captured and forced to work on the land as [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slaves[\LINK]. But when a raid is completely or even partially [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Successful[COLOR_REVERT], they can inflict multiple kinds of damage, like goods being stolen, money being stolen from your treasury, Buildings being destroyed or even colonists being killed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Wars with Natives[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If your relations with a native nation deteriorate badly enough, this may result in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]War[COLOR_REVERT]. Natives may declare War if you steal too much of their land at once, if a unit other than a Seasoned Scout explores [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT]Burial Grounds[\LINK] or [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK] near their Settlements, if a third nation bribes them to declare War on you, or if they simply feel strong enough to attack you without any of these direct causes. You can declare War on them as well, of course.[PARAGRAPH:2]By marching [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Troops[COLOR_REVERT] into a native settlement, you can attack that settlement, and once you've killed every [LINK=PROFESSION_BRAVE]Brave[\LINK] unit defending the settlement, destroy it and ransack it for gold. Usually, a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Treasure[COLOR_REVERT] Unit will be generated which can be converted into money by [LINK=CONCEPT_CHANGES_TO_TREASURES]Transporting the Treasure to Europe[\LINK]. Sometimes, part of the native population will be left alive, and you will receive a [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slave[\LINK] Unit.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you are at war with a Native Tribe, it could be wise to look at the specialties of the Native [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leader[COLOR_REVERT]. These specialties determine the strong and weak points of each native tribe. You will see, for example, that some natives are good in fighting in [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Forests[\LINK], while others are good at defending Cities. All natives get a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Combat Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] when attacking units in Forests, Jungles and Taigas, so you usually would want to stay out of those places, and attempt to draw them out in the open.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Keeping Natives happy, or making them Angry[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are multiple factors that influence the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attitude[COLOR_REVERT] of a native nation towards you. These are:[PARAGRAPH:2]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Character[COLOR_REVERT] of an individual Native Tribe. Each tribe starts with a certain base attitude towards Europeans, and the influence of other factors is also different for the various native nations.[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Overall Size[COLOR_REVERT] of your colonies. If your population grows, and your colonies grow larger, natives are going to perceive you as a threat to their way of life.[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Proximity[COLOR_REVERT] of your colonies to theirs. If your borders lie close to their villages, and your nearby colonies are very large, they feel threatened as well.[PARAGRAPH:1]The amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stolen Land[COLOR_REVERT]. If you choose to Steal native land instead of paying them for it, they will remain angry for each plot you stole from them, until your Cultural Influence on that plot exceeds theirs.[NEWLINE]NOTE: They regard any plot where their Cultural Influence is stronger than yours, but which falls inside your borders, as "Stolen," no matter how you obtained it. See [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders and Culture[\LINK] for an overview of ways in which this can happen.[PARAGRAPH:1]The number of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Missions[COLOR_REVERT] your Missionaries have established in their Settlements also increases your relationship with them, as well as decreasing the degree in which they feel threatened by your growing colonies.[PARAGRAPH:1]Certain [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] also improve your relationship with Natives, while others decrease the amount in which natives feel threatened by you.[NEWLINE]On the other hand, if you attempt to establish a Mission in a native Settlement, but fail, this can worsen your relations with that tribe.[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leaders[COLOR_REVERT] of the [LINK=CIVILIZATION_FRANCE]French Colonies[\LINK] automatically receive a bonus in their relationship with natives.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Trading[COLOR_REVERT] with Natives also improves your friendship with their nations. The best way to win the natives' sympathy is by offering them money or goods for free.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Declining[COLOR_REVERT] trade proposals Natives make when they visit your colony also can harm your relations with them.[PARAGRAPH:1]Certain [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatic Choices[COLOR_REVERT] you make affect their attitude as well. If you are both at war with a common enemy, or if you declared war on that enemy when that native tribe asked you to, your relations will improve, but if you refused to start a war on their request, if you trade with their enemies, or if you declared war on a nation they consider to be their friends, your relations will suffer. If you have declared war on an native nation in the past, or if you have razed their settlements, they will remain angry about that as well.[PARAGRAPH:1]The period of time during which you've been at [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Peace[COLOR_REVERT] with them also influences the attitude of the natives towards you.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are also some [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK] where you can make choices that influence your relations with them for better or worse.
TEXT.French: [H1]INDIGÈNES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Au début de la partie, le Nouveau Monde appartient aux indigènes. La majeure partie du monde dépend d'eux. Ainsi, si vous désirez sortir en tête de la course à la colonisation, il faudra les soudoyer, négocier avec eux, voire les affronter, afin d'asseoir sur ces terres nouvelles votre propre suprématie.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Interagir avec les indigènes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Le Nouveau Monde est habité par huit peuples indigènes qu'il vous sera possible de rencontrer. Tous possèdent une culture et une mentalité propres, ainsi qu'un ressenti particulier vis-à-vis des étrangers. En début de partie, vous êtes automatiquement en paix avec les indigènes et pouvez circuler librement au sein de leurs territoires. Un sage dirigeant saura très tôt fraterniser avec les indigènes, sachant que nombre d'entre eux honoreront sa colonie de présents précieux en gage d'amitié. [PARAGRAPH:2]Vous pouvez également recevoir des présents de la part des indigènes en envoyant une unité dans l'une de leurs colonies, puis en sélectionnant l'ordre "Parler au chef". La première unité à s'entretenir avec le chef d'une colonie peut éventuellement se voir offrir de l'or, voire un [LINK=UNIT_TREASURE]trésor[\LINK]. Une fois que le contact avec le chef a été établi, vous avez également la possibilité de visualiser le domaine d'expertise de la colonie, ainsi que sa [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]marchandise favorite[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Formation indigène[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Si vous êtes en bons termes avec les indigènes, vous pouvez envoyer n'importe quel [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]colon libre[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]engagé[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]indigène converti[\LINK] ou [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]délinquant[\LINK] séjourner au sein de l'une de leurs colonies afin qu'ils les forment à leur spécialité. Ainsi, un [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]colon libre[\LINK] peut être transformé en [LINK=UNIT_FISHERMAN]pêcheur professionnel[\LINK], en [LINK=UNIT_COTTON_PLANTER]planteur de coton professionnel[\LINK], en [LINK=UNIT_MINER]mineur de fer professionnel[\LINK], etc. Chaque colonie ne possède qu'un seul et unique domaine d'expertise et ce dernier ne change jamais.[PARAGRAPH:2]Une fois que vous avez visité une colonie indigène et parlé à son chef, vous pourrez connaître le domaine d'expertise qu'elle sera à même d'enseigner à vos unités en consultant la fenêtre d'informations située sous la colonie, sur la carte principale. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Missions[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Il vous est également possible d'installer des [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]missions[\LINK] au sein des colonies indigènes. Si vous attribuez à un colon la profession de "[LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]missionnaire[\LINK]", vous pouvez envoyer ce dernier dans une colonie indigène et y établir une [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]mission[\LINK]. Au fil du temps, les missions engendreront des [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]indigènes convertis[\LINK] désireux de rejoindre votre nouvelle colonie. Les [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]indigènes convertis[\LINK] font d'exceptionnels producteurs de matières premières et de chevaux (bien qu'ils ne puissent embrasser les professions de soldat et de dragon). Si vous recherchez à stimuler votre production de matières premières, une [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]mission[\LINK] s'avère donc être un excellent investissement. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Achat de territoire[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Lorsque vous établissez une nouvelle colonie près d'un peuplement natif, l'option vous sera offerte d'acheter le territoire indigène utilisé par votre colonie ou de l'annexer, purement et simplement. Si vous optez pour l'achat, votre trésor sera immédiatement ponctionné de la somme d'or idoine. Si, en revanche, vous décidez d'annexer le territoire, aucune somme ne sera retirée de votre trésor, mais vos relations avec les indigènes en souffriront proportionnellement au nombre de cases de terrain que vous aurez saisies. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Raids et pillages[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Si vos rapports avec les indigènes ne sont pas au beau fixe, il est possible qu'ils lancent occasionnellement des raids contre vos colonies, repartant les bras chargés de quelques-unes de vos précieuses marchandises.[PARAGRAPH:2]Vous pourrez riposter sur-le-champ. Si vous déplacez des troupes au sein d'une colonie indigène, vous pouvez la mettre à sac et y piller de l'or. Pour ce faire, vous devez au préalable déclarer la [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]guerre[\LINK] à la civilisation indigène concernée (ce que vous pouvez faire à partir de l'écran [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatie[\LINK]), puis détruire toutes les unités présentes dans la colonie en question.[PARAGRAPH:2]D'ailleurs, sachez que vous ne pouvez pas vous emparer des colonies indigènes. Soit vous les laissez en paix, soit vous les détruisez en les mettant à sac. Bienvenue dans le Nouveau Monde ! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Raids Indigenes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][H1]RAIDS INDIGÈNES[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2] Les raids constituent un acte d'’agression de la part des indiens. De tels raids peuvent survenir en temps de paix. Les indiens attaquent soit une colonie soit un trésor non protégé. Subir un raid signifie probablementque vos relations avec les indiens sont tendues. Parfois les raids sont repoussés. Dans le cas contraire, des biens peuvent être volés ou alors des colons peuvent périr.
TEXT.German: [H1]Ureinwohner[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Zu Beginn des Spiels gehört die Neue Welt den Ureinwohnern. Der Großteil der Welt liegt in ihren Händen. Wenn Sie sich also von den anderen Kolonisten absetzen wollen, müssen Sie mit den Ureinwohnern tauschen und verhandeln, sie bestechen und bekämpfen, um Ihre Vorherrschaft zu sichern.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Interaktion mit Ureinwohnern[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Es gibt in der neuen Welt [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]30[COLOR_REVERT] verschiedene Ureinwohnerstämme und jeder hat seine eigene Kultur, Mentalität und Einstellung gegenüber Fremden. Sie beginnen das Spiel automatisch im Frieden mit den Ureinwohnern und können ihr Gebiet ohne weiteres durchqueren. Wenn Sie schlau sind, freunden Sie sich schnell mit den Ureinwohnern an, denn viele Stämme machen Ihrer Kolonie Geschenke als Zeichen ihrer Freundschaft.[PARAGRAPH:2]Geschenke können Sie auch erhalten, wenn Sie eine Einheit in eine Ureinwohner-Siedlung schicken und dort den Befehl "Mit dem Häuptling sprechen" wählen. Die erste Einheit, die mit dem Häuptling einer Siedlung spricht, erhält möglicherweise Gold oder sogar eine [LINK=UNIT_TREASURE]Schatzeinheit[\LINK]. Nachdem Sie den Häuptling aufgesucht haben, können Sie auch sehen, welche Spezialisierungen diese Siedlung ermöglicht und welches [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Handelsgut[\LINK] sie bevorzugt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Von Ureinwohnern lernen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Wenn Sie gute Beziehungen zu den Ureinwohnern haben, können Sie einen beliebigen [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Freien Kolonisten[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Schuldknecht[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Konvertierten Ureinwohner[\LINK] oder [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Kleinkriminellen[\LINK] in eine Ureinwohner-Siedlung senden und dort in der jeweiligen Spezialisierung des Dorfes "ausbilden" lassen. So kann ein [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Freier Kolonist[\LINK] beispielsweise [LINK=UNIT_FISHERMAN]Erfahrener Fischer[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_COTTON_PLANTER]Erfahrener Baumwollpflanzer[\LINK] oder [LINK=UNIT_MINER]Erfahrener Minenarbeiter[\LINK] usw. werden. Jedes Dorf besitzt nur eine Spezialisierung, die sich auch nicht mehr ändert.[PARAGRAPH:2]Nachdem Sie eine Ureinwohner-Siedlung besucht und mit dem Häuptling gesprochen haben, können Sie im Infomenü unter der jeweiligen Siedlung auf der Hauptkarte sehen, welche Spezialisierung diese Siedlung ermöglicht.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Missionen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In Ureinwohner-Siedlungen können Sie auch [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]Missionen[\LINK] errichten. Indem Sie einem Ihrer Kolonisten den Beruf "[LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionar[\LINK]" zuweisen und ihn in eine Ureinwohner-Siedlung ziehen, errichten Sie eine [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]Mission[\LINK]. Missionen bringen nach und nach [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Konvertierte Ureinwohner[\LINK] hervor, die daran interessiert sind, sich Ihrer neuen Kolonie anzuschließen. [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Konvertierte Ureinwohner[\LINK] sind außergewöhnlich geschickt in der Produktion von Rohmaterial und Pferden (obwohl sie Waffen tragen und damit z.B. keine Kolonialmilizen werden können), also sollte eine [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]Mission[\LINK] eine recht gute Investition sein, wenn Sie Ihre Rohstoffproduktion ankurbeln wollen. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Land erwerben[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Wenn Sie in der Nähe einer Ureinwohner-Siedlung eine neue Siedlung errichten, erhalten Sie automatisch die Möglichkeit, das Land dafür von den Ureinwohnern zu kaufen. Die andere Möglichkeit ist, sich das Land einfach zu nehmen. Kaufen Sie das Land, wird Ihnen der entsprechende Betrag sofort abgezogen. Nehmen Sie das Land, behalten Sie Ihr Gold, doch mit jedem Geländefeld, das Sie einnehmen, verschlechtern sich Ihre Beziehungen zu den Ureinwohnern. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Überfälle und Plünderungen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Sollten Ihre Beziehungen zu den Ureinwohnern unter keinem guten Stern stehen, kann es vorkommen, dass die Ureinwohner Sie gelegentlich überfallen und sich mit wertvollen Gütern im Gepäck wieder aus dem Staub machen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Allerdings können Sie natürlich sofort zurückschlagen. Marschieren Sie mit Ihren Truppen in eine Ureinwohner-Siedlung und plündern Sie sie, um Gold zu erhalten. Dazu müssen Sie dem Ureinwohnervolk zunächst den [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Krieg[\LINK] erklären (dies können Sie im [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatie[\LINK]-Bildschirm tun) und dann alle Einheiten in der angegriffenen Siedlung besiegen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ureinwohner-Siedlungen können Sie übrigens nicht einnehmen. Sie haben nur zwei Möglichkeiten: Lassen Sie sie in Frieden oder zerstören und plündern Sie sie. Willkommen in der Neuen Welt! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ureinwohnerüberfälle[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ureinwohnerüberfälle sind Akte der Aggression, die jedoch keine Kriegserklärung benötigen. Sowohl ungeschütze Schätze auf der Karte, wie auch Städte können überfallen werden. Einige Ureinwohnerstämme haben eine höhere Tendenz für überfälle als andere. Solche überfälle sind ein deutliches Zeichen, dass die Beziehungen zu den Ureinwohner einen bedenklich niedrigen Wert erreicht haben. [PARAGRAPH:2] Ureinwohnerüberfälle auf eine Stadt können erfolgreich abgewehrt werden. Falls dies nicht gelingt können verschiedenste Ereignisse eintreten, die vom einfach Diebstahl von Waren über Zerstörung von Gebäuden, bis zum Tod von Siedlern reichen.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]NATIVI[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All'inizio della partita, il Nuovo Mondo appartiene ai nativi. Gran parte del mondo sta nelle loro mani quindi, se vuoi arrivare primo tra i coloni, dovrai mercanteggiare, corrompere e combattere i nativi per assicurare la tua supremazia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Interagire con i nativi[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Nel Nuovo Mondo ci sono otto diverse popolazioni native da incontrare. Ognuna con la propria cultura, mentalità e sentimenti verso gli estranei. Cominci la partita automaticamente in pace con i nativi e puoi attraversare il loro territorio senza conseguenze. Un saggio capo coloniale farà ben presto amicizia con i nativi, dato che molti di questi faranno dei regali alla tua colonia in segno di amicizia. [PARAGRAPH:2]Puoi ottenere regali anche inviando un'unità in un insediamento di attivi e selezionando l'ordine "Parla col capo". La prima unità che parla con il capo di un insediamento può ottenere in regalo dell'oro o addirittura un [LINK=UNIT_TREASURE]tesoro[\LINK]. Dopo aver parlato con il capo potrai vedere anche la specializzazione in cui è possibile addestrarsi in quell'insediamento così come il [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]bene preferito[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Addestramento presso i nativi[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Se hai un buon rapporto con i nativi, puoi inviare qualsiasi [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]libero colono[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]servo per contratto[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]nativo convertito[\LINK] o [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]piccolo criminale [\LINK] in un insediamento di nativi e farlo "addestrare" nella specializzazione di quel villaggio. Ciò significa che un [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]libero colono[\LINK] può essere trasformato in un [LINK=UNIT_FISHERMAN]pescatore esperto[\LINK], o un [LINK=UNIT_COTTON_PLANTER]coltivatore esperto di cotone[\LINK] o un [LINK=UNIT_MINER]minatore esperto[\LINK] e così via. Ogni villaggio ha una sola specializzazione, che non cambia mai.[PARAGRAPH:2]Dopo aver visitato un insediamento e aver parlato con il capo potrai vedere la specializzazione disponibile in quel villaggio visualizzando il pannello informazioni, cliccando sulla relativa icona sotto l'insediamento sulla mappa principale. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Missioni[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Puoi anche fondare [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]missioni[\LINK] negli insediamenti nativi. Assegnando a un colono la professione di "[LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]missionario[\LINK]", puoi inviarlo in un insediamento di nativi e creare una [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]missione[\LINK]. Col tempo le missioni generano [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]nativi convertiti[\LINK], che vorranno entrare a far parte della tua nuova colonia. I [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]nativi convertiti[\LINK] sono eccezionali produttori di materie prime e cavalli (anche se non possono intraprendere la professione di soldato o dragone), quindi stesse cercando di aumentare la produzione di materie prime una [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]missione[\LINK] rappresenta un ottimo investimento. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquistare la terra[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Quando costruisci un insediamento vicino a un insediamento dei nativi, potrai scegliere se acquistare dai nativi la terra utilizzata dal tuo insediamento oppure se prenderla e basta. Se la comperi, l'oro verrà istantaneamente tolto dal tuo tesoro. Se decidi di appropriartene, potrai tenere il tuo oro ma le relazioni con i nativi peggioreranno a ogni casella che prenderai. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Incursioni e saccheggi[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Se le tue relazioni con i nativi non sono buone, di quando in quando potrebbero fare delle incursioni nei tuoi insediamenti, appropriandosi di beni preziosi.[PARAGRAPH:2] Tu puoi naturalmente attaccarli subito a tua volta. Entrando con delle truppe in un insediamento di nativi puoi saccheggiare l'oro. Per farlo dovrai però prima dichiarare [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]guerra[\LINK] alla civiltà dei nativi (puoi farlo dalla schermata della [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomazia[\LINK]) e poi distruggere tutte le unità nell'insediamento attaccato.[PARAGRAPH:2]Tra l'altro non puoi proprio conquistare un insediamento nativo. Puoi o lasciarlo in pace, oppure distruggerlo e saccheggiarlo. Benvenuto nel Nuovo Mondo! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Raids[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Native Raids are an act of aggression that does not require a war to be declared. Raids can happen to your cities and to unprotected treasures. Some Native Nations are more likely to go on raids and some are less. Native Raids are a clear sign, that your relations to a Native Nation are dangerously low. Native Raids can be fought of successfully. If not, many different things can happen, like goods being stolen or even settlers being killed.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]NATIVOS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cuando empieza la partida, el Nuevo Mundo pertenece a los nativos. La mayor parte del mundo está en sus manos. Por lo que, si deseas estar en la cima del club colonialista, tendrás que negociar, sobornar y luchar con ellos para asegurar tu propia supremacía.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Interacción con los Nativos[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]En el Nuevo Mundo hay ocho tipos de pueblos indígenas. Cada uno de ellos cuenta con su propia cultura, mentalidad y sentimientos hacia los forasteros. De forma automática, empiezas la partida en paz con los Nativos, por lo que puedes moverte por su territorio sin ninguna consecuencia. Un líder colonial sabio simpatizará pronto con ellos, de modo que muchos grupos ofrecerán a tu colonia regalos como muestra de amistad. [PARAGRAPH:2]También puedes recibir regalos si envías una unidad al asentamiento indígena y escoges la orden "Hablar con el jefe". La primera unidad que hable con el jefe de un asentamiento puede recibir un regalo de Oro o incluso una unidad de [LINK=UNIT_TREASURE]Tesoro[\LINK]. Una vez que hayas contactado con el jefe, podrás ver en qué área de especialización entrena dicho asentamiento y cuál es su [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]mercancía favorita[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Entrenamiento de Nativos[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Si estás en buenas relaciones con los Nativos, puedes enviar a cualquier [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Colono libre[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Siervo por deudas[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Nativo converso[\LINK] o [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Convicto[\LINK] a un asentamiento nativo para que dicha unidad se "entrene" en el área de especialización de esa aldea. Esto significa que un [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Colono libre[\LINK] se puede convertir en un [LINK=UNIT_FISHERMAN]Pescador experto[\LINK], un [LINK=UNIT_COTTON_PLANTER]Plantador de algodón experto[\LINK], un [LINK=UNIT_MINER]Minero experto[\LINK], etcétera. A cada aldea le corresponde una única área de especialización, que nunca cambia.[PARAGRAPH:2]Una vez que hayas visitado el asentamiento y hablado con su jefe, verás en qué área de especialización puede formarte si consultas en el dispositivo del panel de información, debajo del asentamiento, en el mapa principal. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Misiones[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]También puedes fundar [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]misiones[\LINK] en los asentamientos indígenas. Si asignas a un Colono la profesión de [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Misionero[\LINK], podrás llevar al misionero recién creado a un asentamiento indígena y crear allí una [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]misión[\LINK]. Con el tiempo, las misiones generarán [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Nativos conversos[\LINK], interesados en formar parte de tu nueva colonia. Los [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Nativos conversos[\LINK] son productores excepcionales de materias primas y Caballos (a pesar de que no pueden tener las profesiones de Soldado ni de Dragón) por lo que, si lo que buscas es aumentar la producción de materias primas, una [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]misión[\LINK] es una inversión excelente. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Compra de tierras[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Cuando construyas un nuevo asentamiento cerca de uno indígena, se te dará la opción de comprar la tierra de los Nativos en la que está tu asentamiento o, simplemente, ocuparla. Si compras la tierra, el Oro se eliminará automáticamente de tu tesoro. Si decides ocuparla, la cantidad de Oro no variará, pero tus relaciones con los Nativos irán empeorando a medida que ocupes nuevas casillas. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Incursiones y saqueos[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Si tus relaciones con los Nativos son todo menos buenas, es posible que de vez en cuando realicen incursiones en tus asentamientos y se hagan con los bienes valiosos.[PARAGRAPH:2] Por supuesto, puedes atacarlos como represalia. Si envías tropas a un asentamiento indígena, podrás saquearles Oro. Para ello, primero deberás declarar la [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]guerra[\LINK] a la civilización indígena (puedes hacerlo mediante la pantalla de [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacia[\LINK]) y luego destruir todas las unidades dentro del asentamiento objetivo.[PARAGRAPH:2]Por cierto, no puedes tomar el asentamiento indígena. Puedes dejarlos en paz o destruirlos y saquearlos, nada más. ¡Bienvenido al Nuevo Mundo! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Raids[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Native Raids are an act of aggression that does not require a war to be declared. Raids can happen to your cities and to unprotected treasures. Some Native Nations are more likely to go on raids and some are less. Native Raids are a clear sign, that your relations to a Native Nation are dangerously low. Native Raids can be fought of successfully. If not, many different things can happen, like goods being stolen or even settlers being killed.

TEXT.English: [H1]GREAT GENERALS AND ADMIRALS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]Great Generals[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_ADMIRAL]Great Admirals[\LINK] are military leaders that emerge as [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]soldiers[\LINK] of your nation gain [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Combat Experience[\LINK]. When you have won enough [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Battles[\LINK] to reach a certain threshold of total experience, a [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]Great General[\LINK] or [LINK=GREAT_ADMIRAL]Great Admiral[\LINK] appears in one of your settlements. Generals will appear when your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT] gather a certain amount of Experience, while Admirals appear when [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sea Units[COLOR_REVERT] do.[NEWLINE]Each successive General or Admiral requires twice the amount of Combat Experience that was needed to generate the previous one. How much experience you need before your next General or Admiral appears can be viewed on the Military Advisor screen [F5], where for both units a Bar is displayed, showing how much Experience you've gained since your last Leader, and how many Experience you have to gain until the next one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Using Generals and Admirals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Once generated, you can turn your General or Admiral into a Warlord by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]joining[COLOR_REVERT] him with another unit in the field. That action also distributes a one-time experience bonus to all units in the same tile. The unit receiving this Leader gains the [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADER]Led by Great General[\LINK] or [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADER2]Led by Great Admiral[\LINK] promotion, which gives certain Combat Bonuses, as well as access to some special [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Promotions[\LINK] not normally available, such as [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN6]Veteran VI[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_SURGEON3]Surgeon III[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Leadership[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_NAVIGATION3]Navigation III[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [H1]GÉNÉRAUX ILLUSTRES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Les généraux illustres sont des chefs militaires qui apparaissent quand votre civilisation gagne de l'expérience au combat. Quand vous avez gagné assez de batailles et atteint le seuil d'expérience requis, un premier [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]général illustre[\LINK] apparaît dans une de vos colonies. Pour générer les généraux illustres suivants, il vous faut à chaque fois doubler votre expérience totale au combat. L'expérience qu'il vous reste à acquérir pour générer un nouveau général illustre est indiquée sur l'écran du conseiller militaire [F5].[PARAGRAPH:2]Lorsque vous avez généré un grand général, vous pouvez en faire un seigneur de guerre en lui faisant rejoindre une autre unité sur le champ de bataille. Cette action conférera par ailleurs un bonus d'expérience unique aux unités de la case. L'unité recevant le seigneur de guerre peut être améliorée gratuitement et sans perte d'expérience. Elle accède également à des [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]promotions[\LINK] spéciales, qui ne sont pas disponibles normalement, comme [LINK=PROMOTION_COMBAT6]Vétéran VI[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_MEDIC3]Chirurgien III[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Commandement[\LINK] et [LINK=PROMOTION_MORALE]Patriote III[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [H1]Große Generäle und Admiräle[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Durch eine gewisse Zahl siegreicher Kämpfe kann man - je nachdem die Siege an Land oder Wasser errugnen wurden - einen [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]Großen General[\LINK] oder [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_ADMIRAL]Großen Admiral[\LINK] erhalten. Im Militärberater-Bildschirm [F5] gibt es am unteren Rand eine Punkteleiste, auf der man ablesen kann, wie weit man von diesem Ziel entfernt ist. Hat man den ersten Großen General oder Admiral gewonnen, kann man auch noch weitere erhalten; allerdings muss man von Mal zu Mal mehr Kämpfe dafür gewinnen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Man kann den Großen General über einen Befehlsbutton mit Einheiten "verschmelzen" lassen, die dadurch eine hohe Zahl von Erfahrungspunkten erhalten. Der Große General bzw. Admiral schaltet zudem einzigartige Beförderungen frei (zum Beispiel [LINK=PROMOTION_SURGEON3]Wundarzt III[\LINK]), die im Unabhängigkeitskrieg spielentscheidend sein können. Die Ureinwohner können auf dieselbe Weise einen [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_CHIEF]Großen Krieger[\LINK] gewinnen.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]GRANDI GENERALI[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I Grandi Generali sono condottieri militari che emergono dalle file del tuo esercito man mano che vinci degli scontri e superi certe soglie di esperienza: a quel punto in uno dei tuoi insediamenti verrà generato un [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]Grande Generale[\LINK]. I punti esperienza necessari per generare il Grande Generale successivo si raddoppiano di volta in volta. Puoi visualizzare l'esperienza che ti manca al prossimo Grande Generale nella schermata del consigliere militare [F5].[PARAGRAPH:2]Una volta che hai a disposizione un Grande Generale, puoi trasformarlo in un Condottiero unendolo a un'altra unità sul campo. Così agendo distribuirai un bonus una tantum di esperienza alle unità presenti nella stessa casella. L'unità che riceve il Condottiero può essere aggiornata gratuitamente e mantenendo al contempo la propria esperienza. L'unità dà inoltre accesso a una serie di [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]promozioni[\LINK] normalmente non disponibili, quali [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN6]Veterano VI[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_SURGEON3]Chirurgo III[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Comando[\III] e [LINK=PROMOTION_MINUTEMAN3]Volontario rapido III[\LINK].
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]GRANDES GENERALES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Los Grandes generales son líderes militares que aparecen a medida que la civilización gana experiencia en combate. Cuando hayas ganado suficientes batallas para superar un umbral determinado de experiencia, aparecerá un [LINK=UNIT_GREAT_GENERAL]Gran general[\LINK] en uno de tus asentamientos. Cada Gran general requiere el doble de experiencia en combate de la que fuera necesaria para generar al anterior. Para ver cuánta experiencia necesitas para que aparezca el próximo Gran general, consulta la pantalla del consejero militar [F5].[PARAGRAPH:2]Una vez generado, puedes convertir al gran general en un caudillo si lo unes a otra unidad en el campo. Esta acción también otorga una bonificación única en puntos de experiencia a las unidades que estén en la misma casilla. La unidad que reciba al Caudillo no podrá modernizarse a ningún coste y conservará toda su experiencia. La unidad también ganará acceso a algunos [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]ascensos[\LINK] especiales que no están disponibles normalmente, como [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN6]Veterana VI[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_SURGEON3]Cirujana III[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Liderazgo[\III] y [LINK=PROMOTION_MINUTEMAN3]Miliciana III[\LINK].

TEXT.English: [H1]MOVEMENT[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In Colonization, a significant portion of your time is spent moving your [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Units[\LINK] around on the map - you send them out to [LINK=CONCEPT_VISIBILITY]Explore[\LINK] new territory; you march them off to [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Battle[\LINK]; and so forth. The basic rules of movement are simple: each unit in the game has a certain number of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]"movement points"[COLOR_REVERT] (MPs) which they can expend each turn.[NEWLINE]Units spend MPs entering a new square. Some [LINK=CONCEPT_NEW_WORLD]Terrain[\LINK] is more difficult to move through (and thus costs more MPs to enter), some less so, and some Terrain is even [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]impassable[COLOR_REVERT] to some or all units.[NEWLINE]Certain [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]Improvements[\LINK] cut down the cost of entering certain spaces, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT] in particular.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are two basic unit types in the game: Land Units and [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Sea Units[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Land Movement[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT] can move only on Land Terrain. They may not move onto Water (unless [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]Carried[\LINK] aboard a sea transport unit). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Water Movement[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Water Units[COLOR_REVERT] can enter only [LINK=TERRAIN_OCEAN]Ocean[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_COAST]Coastal[\LINK], and Coastal [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlement[\LINK] squares. They cannot move onto land spaces.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Movement Speed[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Generally, [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Foot Soldiers[\LINK], non-military units and Siege Units have 1 MP, while [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mounted Units[COLOR_REVERT] have 2 MPs or more. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Transport Units[COLOR_REVERT] have anywhere between 1 and 3 MPs. See [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Military Units[\LINK] and [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]Transport[\LINK] for details.[PARAGRAPH:2]Water Units can have a movement speed between 3 and 6, but certain promotions such as [LINK=PROMOTION_NAVIGATION1]Navigation I[\LINK] can increase a ship's movement points.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Terrain Cost[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Open terrain - Terrain without any features such as [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Forest[\LINK] present- cost 1 MP to enter. Hills, Peaks, Taigas, Light Forests, Jungles, and Forests cost 2 MPs. Plots that contain both Hills and another feature, such as Jungle, cost 3 MPs.[NEWLINE]This penalty can be negated if units gain certain [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Promotions[\LINK]. Mounted units can get the [LINK=PROMOTION_EXPLORER1]Explorer I[\LINK] promotion, reducing the movement cost of all plots with a natural movement cost of 2 or more by 1. For Melee and Gunpowder units, there are certain specialized promotions, such as [LINK=PROMOTION_MOUNTAINEER1]Mountaineer II[\LINK], that not only remove all movement penalties for a plot with a certain type of Terrain Feature, but even doubles the unit's movement in such tiles.[PARAGRAPH:2]For most Ocean tiles, the movement cost is 1. However, your ships can get movement bonuses or penalties by certain Weather Systems. For an overview of these, see, [LINK=CONCEPT_WINDS_AND_STORMS]Winds and Storms[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:2]Note: A unit can [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]always[COLOR_REVERT] enter a space if it has any MPs left. Thus, a 1 MP unit could enter a forest space, but its movement points would be spent at that point.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Roads[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT] reduce the movement costs of terrain; all spaces cost 1/2 MP to enter. This benefit occurs only when a unit is moving from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]one road square to another[COLOR_REVERT], and only when the square the unit is entering is not within the [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK] of a nation that unit's leader is at [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK] with.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effects of Borders on Movement[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Your units can move freely within your [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Territory[\LINK] and unclaimed territory, as well as through territory of civilizations with whom you have an [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Open Borders[\LINK] treaty, or Borders of [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] nations you are not at War with.[NEWLINE]If you enter territory of a non-native civilization without such a treaty, you declare [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK] on that civilization. You do not get the benefits of roads when moving into [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]enemy territory[COLOR_REVERT], which can grant your enemy a huge logistical advantage, if you attack him inside his own borders.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effects of Other Units on Movement[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Other [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]friendly or neutral units[\LINK] do not affect your units' movement at all; in other words, your units can move onto the same space as a foreign unit without attacking it.
