This way, you can make contact with your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK], who then offers to arrange the transport to Europe. He demands a hefty fee of 50% of its contents, though, in addition to the Tax Rate.[NEWLINE]This is [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Only Possible[COLOR_REVERT] in a colony that borders the Ocean that has a building like the [LINK=BUILDING_DOCK]Dock[\LINK] or one of its upgrades present.[PARAGRAPH:2]Treasures cannot cross mountains or move on plots with Ancient Ruins or Burial Grounds themselves.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]TREASURES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Treasures[COLOR_REVERT] are carts that are filled with gold, gems or other precious materials.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Obtaining Treasures[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_TREASURE]Treasures[\LINK] can be obtained in multiple ways:[NEWLINE]They can be found in [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT]Burial Grounds[\LINK] or [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK].[NEWLINE]They can be given to a player by [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK] on the first European visit to a particular Native [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTs]Settlement[\LINK].[NEWLINE]They can also be created by razing Native Cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Transporting and Selling Treasures[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Their purpose is to be transported to [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK], and for its contents to be sold there. Usually they are found in uncivilized or hostile territory, and transporting them over land to the nearest seaport can be a challenge. Some native nations occasionally [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVE_RAIDS]Raid[\LINK] undefended treasures, and [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Wild Animals[\LINK] can attack them as well. Though Treasures are not completely defenseless, they are very weak.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are two ways to sell treasures to Europe.[NEWLINE]You can load them in [LINK=UNIT_GALLEON]Galleons[\LINK] and sell them in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]European Docks[COLOR_REVERT] in the same way you sell goods.[NEWLINE]The other way is to transport them to a colony, select them, and click on the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]"Sell to Europe"-button[COLOR_REVERT] on the bottom of the screen. This way, you can make contact with your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK], who then offers to arrange the transport to Europe. He demands a hefty fee of 50% of its contents, though, in addition to the Tax Rate.[NEWLINE]This is [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Only Possible[COLOR_REVERT] in a colony that borders the Ocean that has a building like the [LINK=BUILDING_DOCK]Dock[\LINK] or one of its upgrades present.[PARAGRAPH:2]Treasures cannot cross mountains or move on plots with Ancient Ruins or Burial Grounds themselves.

TEXT.English: [H1]AFRICA[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You can order your ships to sail to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Africa[COLOR_REVERT] the same way you can order them to sail to [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. You can do this by selecting the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sail to Africa[COLOR_REVERT] order on the bottom of your screen. Africa is your earliest source of [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]African Slaves[\LINK], very cheap [LINK=CONCEPT_SLAVES]Forced Labor Units[\LINK] that perform very well when ordered to do outside work. Africa is also a market for your processed and European Goods. Some Raw Materials are available in Africa at low price.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pre-colonial Africa possessed perhaps as many as 10,000 different states and polities characterised by many different sorts of political organisation and rule.[NEWLINE][TAB]Slavery has been practiced in Africa, as well as other places, throughout recorded history. Between the seventh and twentieth centuries, Arab slave trade (also known as slavery in the East) took 18 million slaves from Africa via trans-Saharan and Indian Ocean routes. Between the fifteenth and the nineteenth centuries, the Atlantic slave trade took 7-12 million slaves to the New World.[NEWLINE]
TEXT.French: [H1]AFRIQUE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Les sociétés installées en Afrique de l'Ouest sont d'origines très diverses. Au sud, du Sénégal au golfe de Guinée, la forêt équatoriale fut colonisée par des populations parlant des langues nigéro-congolaises, à l'instar de la totalité des langues parlées au sud d'une ligne reliant le nord du Sénégal au sud de la Somalie. Plus au nord, les régions de savane virent s'installer de petits groupes parlant des langues nilo-sahariennes, probablement en quête de terres plus fertiles suite à l'avancée du désert. L'Afrique noire eut ses premiers contacts avec les Européens au XVe siècle. Ils établirent des comptoirs concurrents de la traite orientale ; d'abord pour commercer, ensuite aussi pour la traite des noirs à l'origine de la diaspora africaine.
TEXT.German: [H1]Afrika[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Strategie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Schiffe können auf die selbe Art und Weise nach [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Afrika[COLOR_REVERT] geschickt werden, wie man sie nach [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] schicken würde. Hierfür gibt es den Befehl bzw. Button [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nach Afrika Segeln[COLOR_REVERT], wenn man ein Schiff ausgewählt hat. Dort kann man sehr günstig [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]Afrikanische Sklaven[\LINK] als [LINK=CONCEPT_SLAVES]Arbeitskräfte[\LINK] erwerben, welche sich besonders für Arbeiten auf Feldern eignen. In Afrika kann man auch Fertigwaren zu guten Preisen verkaufen. Eine Rohstoffe sind dort auch vergleichsweise günstig erhältlich.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Das prä-kolonial Afrika hatte wahrscheinlich mehr als 10.000 unterschiedliche Staaten mit vielfältigen Organisationen und Gesetzen.[NEWLINE][TAB]Sklaverei wurde in Afrika, wie auch anderenortes, während der gesamten aufgezeichneten Geschichtsschreibung praktiziert. Zwischen dem 17ten und den 20ten Jahrhundert waren ungefähr 18 Millionen Sklaven von Afrika über Routen durch die Sahare oder den Indischen Ozean in andere Länder entführt worden. Zwischen dem 15ten und 19ten Jahrhundert brachte der Sklavenhandel über den Atlantik zwischen 7 und 12 Millionen Sklaven in die Neue Welt.[NEWLINE][TAB]Afrika ist eine Quelle günstiger Arbeitskraft in Form von [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]Sklaven[\LINK]. Desweiteren ist Afrika ein Marktplatz um Fertigwaren teuer zu verkaufen und Rohwaren billig einzukaufen.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]AFRICA[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Pre-colonial Africa possessed perhaps as many as 10,000 different states and polities characterised by many different sorts of political organisation and rule.[NEWLINE][TAB]Slavery has been practiced in Africa, as well as other places, throughout recorded history. Between the seventh and twentieth centuries, Arab slave trade (also known as slavery in the East) took 18 million slaves from Africa via trans-Saharan and Indian Ocean routes. Between the fifteenth and the nineteenth centuries, the Atlantic slave trade took 7-12 million slaves to the New World.[NEWLINE][TAB]Africa is your earliest source of [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]Slaves[\LINK]. Africa is also a market for your processed and European Goods. Some raw materials are available in Africa at low price.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]AFRICA[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Pre-colonial Africa possessed perhaps as many as 10,000 different states and polities characterised by many different sorts of political organisation and rule.[NEWLINE][TAB]Slavery has been practiced in Africa, as well as other places, throughout recorded history. Between the seventh and twentieth centuries, Arab slave trade (also known as slavery in the East) took 18 million slaves from Africa via trans-Saharan and Indian Ocean routes. Between the fifteenth and the nineteenth centuries, the Atlantic slave trade took 7-12 million slaves to the New World.[NEWLINE][TAB]Africa is your earliest source of [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]Slaves[\LINK]. Africa is also a market for your processed and European Goods. Some raw materials are available in Africa at low price.

TEXT.English: [H1]PORT ROYAL[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Port Royal[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Port Royal[COLOR_REVERT] was one of the richest cities of early colonial times and a well known harbour for Pirates and Smugglers. As a port city, it was notorious for its gaudy displays of wealth and loose morals.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Pirates and Smugglers[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Port Royal is your earliest source of [LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]Smuggling Ships[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK]. Port Royal is also a market to buy and sell goods which is not affected by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boycotts[COLOR_REVERT] or the [LINK=CONCEPT_TAX_RATE]Tax Rate[\LINK] enforced by European [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]Kings[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Though your King's Tax Rate does not apply in Port Royal, there is a fixed 20% fee you have to pay over all goods you sell.[NEWLINE]All goods can be bought and sold in Port Royal, and some prices there can be quite favourable in comparison with [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] or [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Accessing Port Royal[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Since Port Royal is a haven for cut-throats and outlaws, so only ships that bear no National Flag can trade with it's residing swashbucklers: [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]Smuggling Ships[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK]. This means that you need to possess one of these before you can access Port Royal. Usually, this means that you have to buy a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Privateer[COLOR_REVERT] in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT], or build one in your colonies, to be able to open this new market.[PARAGRAPH:2]For more information on how to use these units, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Piracy and Smuggling[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [H1]PORT ROYAL[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Port Royal était l'une des villes les plus riches de la première époque coloniale et un port connu pour ses pirates et contrebandiers. En tant que ville portuaire, elle était réputée pour sa débauche et son avidité.[NEWLINE][TAB]Port Royal est votre première source pour acquérir [LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]navires de contrebande[\LINK] et des [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]frégates pirates[\LINK]. Port Royal est également un marché permettant d'acheter et de vendre les marchandises soumis à embargo auprès des Rois européens. [NEWLINE][TAB]En tant que lieu de concentration de brigands et hors-la-loi, seuls les navires n'arborant aucun pavillon national peuvent entrer dans le port et commercer avec ses corsaires.
TEXT.German: [H1]Port Royal[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Port Royal[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Port Royal[COLOR_REVERT]war eine der reichsten Städte der frühen Kolonialzeit. Ebenfalls ein wohlbekannter Hafen für Piraten und Schmuggler.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Piraten und Schmuggler[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In Port Royal können [LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]Schmugglerschiffe[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Piraten Fregaten[\LINK] angeworben werden. Port Royal is natürlich auch ein Marktplatz um Waren zu kaufen und zu verkaufen. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boykotte[COLOR_REVERT] des Königs sind in Port Royal ohne Belang. [NEWLINE]Auch die [LINK=CONCEPT_TAX_RATE]Steuerrate[\LINK], die der König in Europa oder Afrika durchsetzt spielt hier keine Rolle. Allerdings wird hier eine fixe Bestechungssumme an die Herrscher der Stadt fällig. [NEWLINE]Alle Waren lassen sich in Port Royal erwerben. Allerdings sind nur bein einigen die Preise für den Verkauf bzw. Kauf im Vergleich zu [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] oder [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Afrika[\LINK] interessant.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Zugang zu Port Royal[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Port Royal ist ein Hort der Halsabschneider und Gesetzlosen. Daher können nur Schiffe ohne Nationalität dort hin segeln: [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Kaperfahrer[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]Schmugglerschiffe[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Piraten Fregatten[\LINK]. Vor erhalt dieser Einheiten ist ein Zugang zu Port Royal nicht möglich.[PARAGRAPH:2]Für weitere Informationen siehe auch [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Piraterie und Schmuggel[\LINK].
TEXT.Italian: [H1]PORT ROYAL[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Port Royal was one of the richest cities of early colonial times and a well known harbour for pirates and smugglers. As a port city, it was notorious for its gaudy displays of wealth and loose morals.[NEWLINE][TAB]Port Royal is your earliest source of [LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]Smuggling Ships[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK]. Port Royal is also a market to buy and sell goods and is not affected by boycotts enforced by European Kings. [NEWLINE][TAB]Since it is a haven for cut-throats and outlaws, only ships that bear no national flag can trade with it's residing privateers.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]PORT ROYAL[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Port Royal fue una de las ciudades más ricas de la época colonial y un puerto bien conocido por los piratas y contrabandistas. Como ciudad portuaria, era notorio por sus exhibiciones llamativas de riqueza y de moral relajada. [NEWLINE] [TAB] Port Royal es su primera fuente de [LINK = UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]Contrabando buques[\ link] y [link = UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Fragatas[\ LINK]. Port Royal es también un mercado para comprar y vender bienes y no se ve afectada por los boicots impuestos por los reyes europeos. [NEWLINE][TAB]Ya que es un paraíso para los degolladores y forajidos, sólo los buques que no tienen ninguna bandera nacional puede comerciar con ella es que reside corsarios.

TEXT.English: [H1]HEALTH AND MEDICAL CARE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]City Health[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A large [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]City Population[COLOR_REVERT] will cause Diseases to spread, simply because epidemics need large concentrations of people to proliferate. This will cause the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Health Rate[COLOR_REVERT] of the [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]City[\LINK] to drop.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Health Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The Health Rate is given on the upper right part of the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Settlement Screen[COLOR_REVERT]. The Health rate has an effect on production of all yields in the Settlement, and if it is negative, it will decrease the production of each yield by a percentage equal to the Negative Health.[NEWLINE]Negative Health never causes the production of yields to drop with more than 25%, and [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Units[\LINK] stationed within the Settlement heal slower than they normally would.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Increasing Health[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] It is possible though to counter this effect by building the appropriate Facilities and employing [LINK=PROFESSION_HEALER]Healers[\LINK]. Healers can produce [LINK=YIELD_HEALTH]Health[\LINK] when placed in a [LINK=BUILDING_MEDICAL_OFFICE]Medical Office[\LINK] or one of its upgrades, the [LINK=BUILDING_TOWN_HOSPITAL]Town Hospital[\LINK] or the [LINK=BUILDING_CITY_HOSPITAL]City Hospital[\LINK]. [LINK=UNIT_DOCTOR]Renowned Medics[\LINK] are master healers, and generate twice as much Health as a regular colonist would. The production of Health can further be increased by building a [LINK=BUILDING_VILLAGE_WELL]Village Well[\LINK], which generates 1 Health per turn.[NEWLINE]These actions can lead to a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Health Rate[COLOR_REVERT] above average, which results in a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Production Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] equal to the amount of positive Health. Positive Health can never be higher than 10%.
TEXT.French: [H1]SANTÉ ET MÉDECINE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Les villes en grandissant peuvent poser des problèmes d'hygiène et de maladie. Ainsi, la croissance de la population conduit à une baisse de son taux de santé. Il est possible de contrer cet effet en construisant des infrastructures appropriées qui emploient des soignants, pouvant même conduire votre taux de santé au-dessus de la moyenne. Le taux de santé d'une ville aura une conséquence sur votre taux de natalié, votre productivité et la guérison des troupes en garnison.
TEXT.German: [H1]Gesundheit und Medizinische Versorgung[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gesundheit einer Stadt[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Eine grosse Stadtbevölkerung führt dazu, dass die Gesundheitsrate der Stadt sinkt. Dies resultiert aus schlechten hygienischen Verhtälttnissen und dem Fakt, dass sich bei grossen, dicht zusammenlebenden Menschenmengen Krankheiten einfacher ausbreiten können. Durch eine medizinische Versorgung kann, mit den entsprechenden Einrichtungen und Heilern, diesem Effekt aber entgegen gewirkt werden, ja sogar die Gesundheitsrate auf ein überdurchschnittliches Niveau angehoben werden. Die Gesundheitsrate wiederum beeinflusst die Geburtenrate, die Produktivittät und sogar die Heilungsrate von stationierten Truppen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Anzeige[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Im Stadtbildschirm wird oben die aktuelle Gesundheitsrate und die erwartetet änderung in der nächsten Runde in Klammern angezeigt. Wie bereits erwähnt führt eine negative Gesundheitsrate zur Verminderung der Produktivität, jedoch nie um mehr als -25%. Auch eine Steigerung durch eine sehr hohe Gesundheitsrate ist möglich, allerdings auch nie um mehr als 10%. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Anhebung der Gesundheit[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Durch den Einsatz von [LINK=PROFESSION_HEALER]Heilern[\LINK] wird die Gesundheitsrate angehoben, indem diese [LINK=YIELD_HEALTH]Gesundheit[\LINK] erzeugen. Sie arbeiten in der [LINK=BUILDING_MEDICAL_OFFICE]Arztpraxis[\LINK], dem [LINK=BUILDING_TOWN_HOSPITAL]Stadtkrankenhaus[\LINK] oder dem [LINK=BUILDING_CITY_HOSPITAL]Bezirkskrankenhaus[\LINK]. Ein [LINK=UNIT_DOCTOR]Ausgebildeter Arzt[\LINK] ist der Spezialist für diesen Beruf. Es gibt auch einige wenige Gebäude, wie den [LINK=BUILDING_VILLAGE_WELL]Dorfbrunnen[\LINK], die ebenfalls der Gesundheit der Stadt förderlich sind.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]HEALTH AND MEDICAL CARE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Large City Population will cause diseases to spread. Simply due to dirt and diseases spreading more easily. This will cause the Health Rate of the City to drop. It is possible though to counter that effect by building the appropriate Facilities and employing Healers, which could even lead to a Health Rate above average. Health Rate of the City will affect birth rates, productivity and healing of stationed troops.

This will cause the Health Rate of the City to drop. It is possible though to counter that effect by building the appropriate Facilities and employing Healers, which could even lead to a Health Rate above average. Health Rate of the City will affect birth rates, productivity and healing of stationed troops.

TEXT.English: [H1]MONASTERIES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Constructing Monasteries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Monasteries[COLOR_REVERT] are improvements that can be built by [LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK] that serve multiple functions, most of which have to do with [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK]. There are two types of Monasteries: The regular [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MONASTERY]Monastery[\LINK], which is the one that can be constructed by Pioneers, and the [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_MONASTERY]Large Monastery[\LINK], the upgrade of the Monastery which replaces it if the Monastery is worked for a certain period of time.[NEWLINE]Monasteries can be built on any land plot except for Peaks, unless that plot lies inside the [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK] of another Native or European nation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Working Monasteries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Work[COLOR_REVERT] a Monastery, assign a colonist to the [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK] profession (which needs to be done in Europe or one of your colonies), and then move the Missionary to the plot of the Monastery and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fortify[COLOR_REVERT] him on that plot. [NEWLINE]Once a Monastery is being worked, you can hover your mouse over it to view how many turns it will need be worked until it is upgraded to a Large Monastery.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effects of Monasteries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are multiple [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Effects[COLOR_REVERT] that Monasteries can have when Native Braves are wandering by. The Braves can bring small amounts of gold to the Monastery as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gifts[COLOR_REVERT], the Braves can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Converted[COLOR_REVERT] and join your nation as [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Natives[\LINK] and Braves with the intention to raid nearby [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlements[\LINK] can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Appeased[COLOR_REVERT] and return to their villages.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Increasing the Effectiveness[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The chances for any of the positive events listed above to happen will be doubled when [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Jesuit Missionaries[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY_PROT]Evangelists[\LINK] are employed. Its success is also quite dependent on how many Braves walk by, so try to build Monasteries on locations where you often see them wander around.[NEWLINE]Putting multiple Missionaries in a single Monastery provides no additional bonus.
TEXT.French: [H1]MONASTÈRES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Construire des monastères[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Monastères[COLOR_REVERT] sont des améliorations qui peuvent être construites par des [LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]pionniers[\LINK] pour remplir de nombreuses fonctions, en particulier vis-à-vis des [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indigènes[\LINK]. Il y a deux types de monastères : les [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MONASTERY]Monastères[\LINK] normaux, qui peuvent être construit par les pionniers, et les [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_MONASTERY]grands monastères[\LINK], qui sont une amélioration remplaçant les monastères normaux au bout d'une certaine période d'activité.[NEWLINE]Les monastères peuvent être construits sur n'importe quel type de terrain à l'esception des montagnes, à moins que la case soit inclue à l'intérieur des [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]frontières[\LINK] d'une civilisation indigène ou d'une autre nation européenne.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Travailler dans un monastère[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pour [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]travailler[COLOR_REVERT] dans un monastère, assignez à un colon la profession de [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionaire[\LINK], puis placer le missionnaire sur la case du monastère en lui donnant l'ordre de se [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]fortifier[COLOR_REVERT]. [NEWLINE]Une fois qu'un missionnaire travaille, vous pouvez survoler votre souris sur lui pour voir le nombre de tours nécessaires pour que le monastère soit amélioré en grand monastère.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effets des monastères[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Lorsque les indigènes s'aventurent dans une case où est présente un monastère, le brave peut faire un petit [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]on en or[COLOR_REVERT], il peut également être [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]converti[COLOR_REVERT] et rejoindre votre nation en temps qu'[LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]indigène converti[\LINK], et les braves qui auraient l'intention de faire un raid sur une [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colonie[\LINK] avoisinante pourraient être convaincu de retourner dans leur village.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Augmenter l'efficacité[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les chances que l'un des événements positifs précités arrivent doublent lorsque les [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]missionnaires jésuites[\LINK] ou les [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY_PROT]évangélistes[\LINK] sont employés. Son succès est également dépendant du nombre d'indigènes qui rôdent, donc il faut penser à les construire là où ils se déplacent fréquemement.[NEWLINE]Assigner plusieurs missionnaires sur le même monastère n'apporte aucun bonus additionnel.
TEXT.German: [H1]Klöster[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Bau von Klöstern[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Klöster[COLOR_REVERT] sind Geländefeldverbesserungen, die von [LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]Pionieren[\LINK] erbaut werden und eine Vielzahl von Funktionen erfüllen, die meist in Zusammenhang mit den [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohnern[\LINK] stehen. Das normale [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MONASTERY]Kloster[\LINK] kann über die Zeit zu einem [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_MONASTERY]Grossen Kloster[\LINK] heranwachsen, wenn es in Betrieb gehalten wird.[NEWLINE]Klöster können nur ausserhalb der [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Grenzen[\LINK] anderer Nationen erbaut werden, seien es Ureinwohner oder andere Kolonialmächte.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Nutzung von Klöstern[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Um ein Kloster zu bemannen, muss eine Einheit im Beruf [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionar[\LINK] darin [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]befestigt[COLOR_REVERT] werden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effekte eines Klosters[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Es gibt eine Vielzahl von Effekten von Klöstern, die meist dann ausgelöst werden, wenn ein Ureinwohner dieses passiert oder betritt. Dies kann sich in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Geschenken[COLOR_REVERT] aber auch [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Konvertierung[COLOR_REVERT] des Ureinwohners auswirken, wodurch dieser dann zu einem [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Konvertierten Ureinwohner[\LINK] wird. Auch kann ein Kloster wütende Ureinwohner auf dem Weg zu einem [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ueberfall[COLOR_REVERT] auf eine nahegelegen [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlung[\LINK] besänftigen, wodurch dieser dann wieder seine übliche Wanderschaft aufnimmt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Erhöhung der Effektivität[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die Wahrscheinlichkeit der genannten Effekte lässt sich erhöhen, indem die Spezialisten [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Jesuitenmissionar[\LINK] oder [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY_PROT]Evangelist[\LINK] in den Klöstern eingesetzt werden. Des weiteren hängt der Erfolg natürlich auch von der Lage ab, sprich wie viele Ureinwohner den Standort des Klosters passieren.[NEWLINE]Der Einsatz von mehreren Missionaren gleichzeitig in einer Mission führt nicht zu einer Steigerung der Effektivität.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]MONASTERIES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Constructing Monasteries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Monasteries[COLOR_REVERT] are improvements that can be built by [LINK=UNIT_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK] that serve multiple functions, most of which have to do with [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK]. There are two types of Monasteries: The regular [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MONASTERY]Monastery[\LINK], which is the one that can be constructed by Pioneers, and the [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_MONASTERY]Large Monastery[\LINK], the upgrade of the Monastery which replaces it if the Monastery is worked for a certain period of time.[NEWLINE]Monasteries can be built on any land plot except for Peaks, unless that plot lies inside the [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK] of another Native or European nation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Working Monasteries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Work[COLOR_REVERT] a Monastery, assign a colonist to the [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK] profession (which needs to be done in Europe or one of your colonies), and then move the Missionary to the plot of the Monastery and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fortify[COLOR_REVERT] him on that plot. [NEWLINE]Once a Monastery is being worked, you can hover your mouse over it to view how many turns it will need be worked until it is upgraded to a Large Monastery.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effects of Monasteries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are multiple [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Effects[COLOR_REVERT] that Monasteries can have when Native Braves are wandering by. The Braves can bring small amounts of gold to the Monastery as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gifts[COLOR_REVERT], the Braves can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Converted[COLOR_REVERT] and join your nation as [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Natives[\LINK] and Braves with the intention to raid nearby [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlements[\LINK] can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Appeased[COLOR_REVERT] and return to their villages.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Increasing the Effectiveness[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The chances for any of the positive events listed above to happen will be doubled when [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Jesuit Missionaries[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY_PROT]Evangelists[\LINK] are employed. Its success is also quite dependent on how many Braves walk by, so try to build Monasteries on locations where you often see them wander around.[NEWLINE]Putting multiple Missionaries in a single Monastery provides no additional bonus.

TEXT.English: [H1]RIVAL COLONIES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Rival Colonies[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In addition to [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native Tribes[\LINK], you'll have to compete with other [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Colonial Powers[COLOR_REVERT] as well for land, resources and power.[NEWLINE]There are at most Seven other European nations represented in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]New World[COLOR_REVERT]. Some of them will be cooperative, but others will be hostile, paranoid or greedy, and will see you as a threat to the success of their incumbent nations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Exploration, Resources and Founding Fathers[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In the early game, all European powers send their [LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK] into the newly discovered lands. As [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK] and [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT]Burial Grounds[\LINK] can only be explored once, and Native Chiefs also present gifts only to the first European explorer to visit their villages, this can generate a good deal of rivalry between the various European nations.[NEWLINE]Additionally, other European powers usually will be quite [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Expansionistic[COLOR_REVERT]. This means that you will often come into conflict with them over valuable Resources, such as [LINK=YIELD_GOLD]Gold[\LINK] or [LINK=YIELD_GEMS]Gems[\LINK], as the profit that can be made from such resources can be vital to the success of a colonial nation.[NEWLINE]They will also try to attract [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] to their cause just as you do, and it will often happen that a Founding Father you wanted is snatched by them from right under your nose.[PARAGRAPH:1]While you can claim their resources by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Conquering[COLOR_REVERT] some of their colonies, you cannot draw their [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] away from them until they are completely obliterated from the New World, which can only be accomplished by destroying all their troops, both land and naval units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Borders[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Colonial Powers cannot cross the [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK] of another Colonial Power, unless they have signed an [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders[COLOR_REVERT] treaty with that power. The only units that can cross foreign colonial borders without having to sign such a treaty are [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]Transport Units[\LINK] like [LINK=UNIT_OXCART]Oxcarts[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]Wagon Trains[\LINK], which can be used to trade with other colonies. Other units cannot enter without declaring [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Piracy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]One way of weakening your rivals without engaging them in an all-out war is by employing [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Pirate Ships[\LINK], which can attack units of any rival colony. These vessels can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Capture Goods[COLOR_REVERT], so if you know a [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE_ROUTE]Trade Route[\LINK] along which your opponent transports a lot of valuable materials, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Piracy[COLOR_REVERT] can be a quite lucrative business.[PARAGRAPH:1]Be careful, however: if your opponents lose too many [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK] to your swashbuckling Pirates, then their [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] sometimes sends [LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE]Frigates[\LINK] to protect their Shipping Lanes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]War with other Colonies[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wars[COLOR_REVERT] with other Colonies have a very different character when compared with wars with Natives. While natives will send swarms of weak melee units at your colonies, Europeans will have [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]stronger[COLOR_REVERT] units, albeit in smaller numbers. While Natives usually are strongest when fighting in the Wilderness and weakest when fighting in the open field or in settlements, the [LINK=UNIT_CANNON]Cannon Regiments[\LINK] of rival Colonies can devastate the Defenses of your [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlements[\LINK], while [LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_CANNON]Cannon Garrisons[\LINK] can give your Army quite a hard time when attacking their Settlements.[NEWLINE]Also, because your units cannot use [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT] that lie inside enemy borders, your enemies will have a huge advantage in [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobility[\LINK] if you enter their Territory to conduct campaigns against their settlements.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Capture[COLOR_REVERT] a rival colony, you have the choice either to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raze[COLOR_REVERT] it, or to keep it and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Add[COLOR_REVERT] it to your colonies. If you keep it, it will enter a period of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Disorder[COLOR_REVERT] that lasts for an amount of turns equal to its population. Be careful though; if that colony is located on land that [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Natives[COLOR_REVERT] see as theirs, they might see you as their new oppressor, so take a moment to consider whether or not the new colony is worth the trouble of angering them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cooperating with other colonies[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Maintaining [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Friendly Relationships[\LINK] with your fellow Colonial Powers has certain advantages as well. Sometimes, they can be valuable [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Trading Partners[\LINK], as they desire the same goods that are desired in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. Also, their [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kings[COLOR_REVERT] might occasionally contact you if you are Friendly to their colonies, and he might offer you [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mortars[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards[\LINK], both [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are very hard to come by, and that can be very valuable when you fight your War of Independence.[NEWLINE]Rival colonies are sometimes also willing to trade their [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]World Maps[COLOR_REVERT] with you, which increases your knowledge of the New World, and they may be willing to form [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Alliances[COLOR_REVERT] with you as well.

TEXT.German: [H1]Rivalisierende Kolonialmächte[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Rivalisierende Kolonialmächte[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ausser den [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohnerstämmen[\LINK], muss man in der Neuen Welt auch mit anderen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kolonialmächten[COLOR_REVERT] um Land, Ressourcen und Macht konkurrieren.[NEWLINE]Insgesamt sind bis zu acht Kolonialmächte in der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Neuen Welt[COLOR_REVERT] präsent. Manchmal sind sie kooperativ, manchmal aggressiv, paranoid oder gierig und sehen eure Kolonien als Gefahr für ihre eigenen Pläne. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Erkundung, Ressourcen und Gründerväter[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Im frühen Spiel schicken die Kolonialmächte meist ihre [LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK] in die Wildniss um das neu entdeckte Land zu erkunden. Da [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ruinen[\LINK] und [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT]Grabstätten[\LINK] nur ein einziges Mal ausgebeutet werden können und die Dörfer der Ureinwohner nur beim ersten Besuch Geschenke machen, kann bereits hierdurch ein Konkurrenzkampf zwischen den Europäern entstehen.[NEWLINE]Meist steht auch die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Expansion[COLOR_REVERT] des Siedlungsraumes stark im Fokus. Daher gibt es auch um seltene Ressourcen, wie [LINK=YIELD_GOLD]Gold[\LINK] oder [LINK=YIELD_GEMS]Edelsteine[\LINK] einen Wettstreit, da die daraus resultierenden Profite einen grossen Unterschied bezüglich Erfolg oder Miserfolg einer Kolonialmacht ausmachen können.[NEWLINE]Natürlich versuchen die anderen Kolonien ebenfalls [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Gründerväter[\LINK] für ihre Sache zu gewinnen und oft schnappt eine Kolonialmacht einen solchen Gründervater direkt unter der Nase der anderen weg.[PARAGRAPH:1]Während Ressourcen durch Eroberung wieder zurückgewonnen werden können, sind [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gründerväter[COLOR_REVERT] einer Nation erst wieder für eine andere Nation zugänglich, wenn diese komplett vernichtet wurde.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Grenzen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Kolonialmächte können [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Grenzen[\LINK] der andere Kolonialmächte nur dann friedlich überschreiten, wenn Verträge für [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Offene Grenzen[COLOR_REVERT] geschlossen werden. Die einzige Ausnahme hierfür bilden [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]Transporteinheiten[\LINK] wie [LINK=UNIT_OXCART]Ochsenkarren[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]Wagenzüge[\LINK], die auch zum Handel mit anderen Kolonien genutz werden können. Ansonsten besteht nur noch die Möglichkeit einen [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Krieg[\LINK] zu erklären.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Piraterie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Um eine gegnerische Kolonialmacht zu schwächen, ohne gleich Krieg zu erklären, ist [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Piraterie[\LINK] ein wirksames Werkzeug und kann auch sehr lohnend sein.[PARAGRAPH:1]Es ist jedoch vorsicht geboten, da der König einer anderen Kolonialmacht oft [LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE]Fregatten[\LINK] schickt um die Handelsrouten seiner Kolonien zu schützen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Krieg mit anderen Kolonialmächten[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kriege[COLOR_REVERT] mit anderen Kolonialmächten unterscheiden sich etwas von Kriegen mit Ureinwohneren. Während die Ureinwohner meist in Massen mit schwächeren Einheiten angreifen, sind die Truppen anderer Kolonien oft auf Augenhöhe mit den eigenen Truppen.[NEWLINE]Ausserdem haben verteidigende Truppen meist durch die Möglichkeit der Nutzung der eigenen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Strassen[COLOR_REVERT] einen Vorteil in Bezug auf [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobilität[\LINK], da Strassen in fremden Herrschaftsgebiet nur mit speziellen Beförderungen genutzt werden können.[PARAGRAPH:1]Beim [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Erobern einer fremden Stadt[COLOR_REVERT] hat man die Möglichkeit diese zu [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]vernichten[COLOR_REVERT], oder sie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]einzunehmen[COLOR_REVERT]. Nach der Einnahme ist die Stadt einige Runden in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Unruhe[COLOR_REVERT]. Die Dauer hängt von der Grösse der Stadt ab. Hier ist jedoch auch Vorsicht geboten. Hat die Stadt Land der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ureinwohner[COLOR_REVERT] besetzt, sehen nun diese euch als den Dieb ihres Landes. Man kann ihnen aber auch nach der Eroberung eine Entschädigung zahlen um sie zu besänftigen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Kooperation mit anderen Kolonialmächten[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Gute [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]diplomatische Beziehungen[\LINK] können ebenfalls sehr wertvoll sein. Andere Kolonialmächte können gute [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Handelspartner[\LINK] werden, vorallem da sie die andere Güter wollen, als die Ureinwohner. Meist sind dies Güter, die sie selbst in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] gut verkaufen können. Deren [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]König[COLOR_REVERT] kann bei guten Beziehungen gelegentlichg auch sehr interessante Angebote machen und man kann dadurch an sehr seltene [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Eliteeinheiten[COLOR_REVERT], wie [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mörser[\LINK] oder [LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Kontinentalwachen[\LINK] gelangen.[NEWLINE]Durch den gelegentlichen Verkauf von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Karten[COLOR_REVERT] kann man auch ein kleines Zusatzeinkommen bekommen. Auch [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensivpäkte und Militärische Allianzen[COLOR_REVERT] können sehr hilfreich sein.

These vessels can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Capture Goods[COLOR_REVERT], so if you know a [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE_ROUTE]Trade Route[\LINK] along which your opponent transports a lot of valuable materials, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Piracy[COLOR_REVERT] can be a quite lucrative business.[PARAGRAPH:1]Be careful, however: if your opponents lose too many [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK] to your swashbuckling Pirates, then their [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] sometimes sends [LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE]Frigates[\LINK] to protect their Shipping Lanes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]War with other Colonies[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wars[COLOR_REVERT] with other Colonies have a very different character when compared with wars with Natives. While natives will send swarms of weak melee units at your colonies, Europeans will have [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]stronger[COLOR_REVERT] units, albeit in smaller numbers. While Natives usually are strongest when fighting in the Wilderness and weakest when fighting in the open field or in settlements, the [LINK=UNIT_CANNON]Cannon Regiments[\LINK] of rival Colonies can devastate the Defenses of your [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlements[\LINK], while [LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_CANNON]Cannon Garrisons[\LINK] can give your Army quite a hard time when attacking their Settlements.[NEWLINE]Also, because your units cannot use [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT] that lie inside enemy borders, your enemies will have a huge advantage in [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobility[\LINK] if you enter their Territory to conduct campaigns against their settlements.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Capture[COLOR_REVERT] a rival colony, you have the choice either to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raze[COLOR_REVERT] it, or to keep it and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Add[COLOR_REVERT] it to your colonies. If you keep it, it will enter a period of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Disorder[COLOR_REVERT] that lasts for an amount of turns equal to its population. Be careful though; if that colony is located on land that [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Natives[COLOR_REVERT] see as theirs, they might see you as their new oppressor, so take a moment to consider whether or not the new colony is worth the trouble of angering them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cooperating with other colonies[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Maintaining [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Friendly Relationships[\LINK] with your fellow Colonial Powers has certain advantages as well. Sometimes, they can be valuable [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Trading Partners[\LINK], as they desire the same goods that are desired in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. Also, their [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kings[COLOR_REVERT] might occasionally contact you if you are Friendly to their colonies, and he might offer you [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mortars[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards[\LINK], both [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are very hard to come by, and that can be very valuable when you fight your War of Independence.[NEWLINE]Rival colonies are sometimes also willing to trade their [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]World Maps[COLOR_REVERT] with you, which increases your knowledge of the New World, and they may be willing to form [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Alliances[COLOR_REVERT] with you as well.

Some of them will be cooperative, but others will be hostile, paranoid or greedy, and will see you as a threat to the success of their incumbent nations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Exploration, Resources and Founding Fathers[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In the early game, all European powers send their [LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK] into the newly discovered lands. As [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK] and [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT]Burial Grounds[\LINK] can only be explored once, and Native Chiefs also present gifts only to the first European explorer to visit their villages, this can generate a good deal of rivalry between the various European nations.[NEWLINE]Additionally, other European powers usually will be quite [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Expansionistic[COLOR_REVERT]. The only units that can cross foreign colonial borders without having to sign such a treaty are [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]Transport Units[\LINK] like [LINK=UNIT_OXCART]Oxcarts[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_WAGON_TRAIN]Wagon Trains[\LINK], which can be used to trade with other colonies. These vessels can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Capture Goods[COLOR_REVERT], so if you know a [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE_ROUTE]Trade Route[\LINK] along which your opponent transports a lot of valuable materials, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Piracy[COLOR_REVERT] can be a quite lucrative business.[PARAGRAPH:1]Be careful, however: if your opponents lose too many [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK] to your swashbuckling Pirates, then their [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] sometimes sends [LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE]Frigates[\LINK] to protect their Shipping Lanes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]War with other Colonies[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wars[COLOR_REVERT] with other Colonies have a very different character when compared with wars with Natives. While natives will send swarms of weak melee units at your colonies, Europeans will have [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]stronger[COLOR_REVERT] units, albeit in smaller numbers. While Natives usually are strongest when fighting in the Wilderness and weakest when fighting in the open field or in settlements, the [LINK=UNIT_CANNON]Cannon Regiments[\LINK] of rival Colonies can devastate the Defenses of your [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlements[\LINK], while [LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_CANNON]Cannon Garrisons[\LINK] can give your Army quite a hard time when attacking their Settlements.[NEWLINE]Also, because your units cannot use [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT] that lie inside enemy borders, your enemies will have a huge advantage in [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobility[\LINK] if you enter their Territory to conduct campaigns against their settlements.[PARAGRAPH:1]If you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Capture[COLOR_REVERT] a rival colony, you have the choice either to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raze[COLOR_REVERT] it, or to keep it and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Add[COLOR_REVERT] it to your colonies. If you keep it, it will enter a period of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Disorder[COLOR_REVERT] that lasts for an amount of turns equal to its population. Be careful though; if that colony is located on land that [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Natives[COLOR_REVERT] see as theirs, they might see you as their new oppressor, so take a moment to consider whether or not the new colony is worth the trouble of angering them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Cooperating with other colonies[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Maintaining [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Friendly Relationships[\LINK] with your fellow Colonial Powers has certain advantages as well. Sometimes, they can be valuable [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Trading Partners[\LINK], as they desire the same goods that are desired in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. Also, their [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kings[COLOR_REVERT] might occasionally contact you if you are Friendly to their colonies, and he might offer you [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mortars[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards[\LINK], both [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are very hard to come by, and that can be very valuable when you fight your War of Independence.[NEWLINE]Rival colonies are sometimes also willing to trade their [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]World Maps[COLOR_REVERT] with you, which increases your knowledge of the New World, and they may be willing to form [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Alliances[COLOR_REVERT] with you as well.

TEXT.English: [H1]SERVANTS, CRIMINALS AND SLAVES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Forced Labor[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To build up the [LINK=CONCEPT_ECONOMY]Economy[\LINK] of your colonies, you will need a large amount of [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Colonists[\LINK] to do all the dirty work, but training or recruiting [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]Experts[\LINK] can be expensive or time-consuming. Fortunately, for the enterprising Governor there is a cheaper, faster, but somewhat less ethical option: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forced Labor[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]There are four different types of colonists in this game who do forced labor: [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Indentured Servants[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Petty Criminals[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]African Slaves[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slaves[\LINK]. Each of these groups have different strengths and weaknesses, and each of them is obtained through different means.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Working with Forced Labor Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Forced Labor units all work best in [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlements[\LINK] when assigned to professions that gather raw materials on the fields, like [LINK=PROFESSION_FARMER]Farmers[\LINK] and [LINK=PROFESSION_HUNTER]Hunters[\LINK]. Each of them gets a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Production Penalty[COLOR_REVERT] when set to work inside a building in the colony. Additionally, some professions are not available to forced labor units, and most of them can't be trained in Native Villages either. They can, however, learn a specialism through the [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]Education[\LINK] System, but because they receive a penalty when producing [LINK=YIELD_EDUCATION]Education[\LINK] as well, this may take a very long time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fleeing and Gaining Freedom[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Being unhappy with their situation, Forced Labor Units often attempt to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Flee[COLOR_REVERT]. If they do, they leave the city, cross your borders and wander around aimlessly in the wilderness as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independent[COLOR_REVERT] Units. They will continue to do so until you send a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Unit[COLOR_REVERT] after them, attack them and defeat them with it, at which point they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Captured[COLOR_REVERT] and join your colonies again. Make haste, however, if your [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]European Neighbours[\LINK] happen to be in the vicinity, because if they get to the escaped unit first, they can claim them for their own.[NEWLINE]Forced Labor Units can only flee once they're set to work in a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Settlement[COLOR_REVERT], so one way to keep them from taking flight is by equipping them with [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK] and having them work as [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK], a profession that is available to all four Forced Labor Units.[PARAGRAPH:1]Some of these units can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Freed[COLOR_REVERT] if they've worked a long time. It doesn't matter if they worked in a Settlement or outside as Pioneers; in both cases there is the possibility that they will become Free. If this happens, the unit is changed into a [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Free Colonist[\LINK]. This event happens by random chance, so there is no way of predicting when a particular unit will become free.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Indentured Servants[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Indentured Servants[\LINK] are the only one amongst these four groups that can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. They are the cheapest colonists available there, and they also appear in the docks as [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]Immigrants[\LINK]. Of all these four groups, Indentured Servants are the least likely to run away, and the most likely to earn their freedom at some point. Their production penalty when put to work inside a building is also smaller than the penalty of the other three units.[PARAGRAPH:1]Indentured Servants are also the only Forced Labor Units that can be sent into [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] Villages to be trained as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Experts[COLOR_REVERT], just like Free Colonists and [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Natives[\LINK]. They also can be given military professions, as well as the [LINK=UNIT_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Petty Criminals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Petty Criminals[\LINK] are the lowest members of the societal ladder in Europe, and they are sent by your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] to the New World as a form of punishment for minor crimes. Every once in a while, the King will contact you with the offer to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Buy[COLOR_REVERT] a few of them for a very [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Low Price[COLOR_REVERT], much lower even than Indentured Servants, and once it's paid, they arrive immediately in your colonies, so they don't have to be transported from Europe.[PARAGRAPH:1]However, Petty Criminals are even less eager to work for you than Servants are, which is why they will flee much more often, while it is also much harder for them to gain their freedom.[NEWLINE]Furthermore, they cannot be trained in Native Villages, and their penalty for working inside a building is higher, but they are allowed to take up [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Professions[COLOR_REVERT] or the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Missionary[COLOR_REVERT] profession.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]African Slaves[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]African Slaves[\LINK] can be purchased for particularly low prices in [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK], while the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]King[COLOR_REVERT] als occasionally offers you African Slaves.[PARAGRAPH:1]African Slaves are good workers, and they get a production bonus of +1 for all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raw Materials[COLOR_REVERT]. They do not have much use apart from that, apart from the possibility of being assigned the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pioneer[COLOR_REVERT] profession. They cannot become missionaries or military units, and they often flee. Unlike Criminals and Servants, African Slaves [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cannot earn their freedom[COLOR_REVERT] by hard work.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Slaves[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slaves[\LINK] function in exactly the same way as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]African Slaves[COLOR_REVERT], in terms of production bonuses and penalties, likelihood to flee and inability to be freed. They are obtained in quite different ways, however.[NEWLINE]Sometimes, a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Tribe[COLOR_REVERT] may contact you to sell their prisoners of war to you. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Raids[COLOR_REVERT] can also go horribly wrong for the raiding natives, and if they are captured, they become slaves as well. Finally, if you are at [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK] with a Native Tribe and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raze[COLOR_REVERT] one of their settlements, there is also a chance of obtaining a Slave, in case there are enough survivors to be enslaved.

TEXT.German: [H1]Schuldknechte, Kleinkriminelle und Sklaven[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Zwangsarbeit[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Um die [LINK=CONCEPT_ECONOMY]Wirtschaft[\LINK] der Kolonien aufzubauen, wird eine grosse Menge an Arbeitskraft in Form von [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Kolonisten[\LINK] benötigt um all die schwere Arbeit zu erledigen. Aber Ausbildung oder Rekrutierung von [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]Experten[\LINK] ist teuer und zeitaufwendig. Glücklicherweise gibt es aber auch für den aufstrebenden Gouverneur eine billiger und schnellere Möglichkeit Arbeitskräfte zu beschaffen, auch wenn diese nicht ganz so ethisch korrekt ist: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zwangsarbeit[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]Im Spiel gibt es verschiedene Formen der Zwangsarbeiter: [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Schuldknechte[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Kleinkriminelle[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]Afrikanische Sklaven[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Versklavte Ureinwohner[\LINK]. Jede diese Gruppen hat individuelle Stärken und Schwächen und ist über unterschiedliche Wege erhältlich.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Funktionsweise der Zwangsarbeit[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Zwangsarbeiter werden in [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlungen[\LINK] am Besten zum Sammeln von Rohstoffen eingesetzt. In Berufen wie [LINK=PROFESSION_FARMER]Bauer[\LINK] oder [LINK=PROFESSION_HUNTER]Jäger[\LINK]. In Berufen, die in Gebäuden ausgeführt werden, haben diese Einheiten meist [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Produktionsabzüge[COLOR_REVERT]. Einige Berufe sind für Zwangsarbeiter auch komplett gesperrt. Meistens können sie auch nicht in Ureinwohnerdörfer zu Spezialisten ausgebildet werden. Theoretisch können sie jedoch das [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]Bildungssystem[\LINK] nutzen, produzieren aber aufgrund ihrer Produktionsabzüge sehr wenig [LINK=YIELD_EDUCATION]Bildung[\LINK] und brauchen daher meist sehr lange.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Flucht und Erhalt der Freiheit[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Unzufrieden mit ihrer Situation versuchen Zwangsarbeiter oft die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Flucht[COLOR_REVERT]. Dann verschwinden sie aus der Stadt und wandern ziellos ausserhalb der Grenzen als unabhängige Einheiten herum. Eine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Militäreinheit[COLOR_REVERT] kann dann hinter ihnen her geschickt werden, um sie in einem Kampf zu besiegen und wieder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]einzufangen[COLOR_REVERT]. Dann kann man sie wieder wie zuvor in der Stadt einsetzen. Ein Entflohener kann natürlich auch von einer [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]rivalisierenden Kolonialmacht[\LINK] eingefangen werden.[NEWLINE]Die Flucht geschieht nur, wenn die Einheit innerhalb einer [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siedlung[COLOR_REVERT] eingesetzt wird. Wird ein Zwangsarbeiter beispielsweise als [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionier[\LINK] eingesetzt geschieht dies nicht.[PARAGRAPH:1]Einige Zwangsarbeiter können auch ihre [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Freiheit erlangen[COLOR_REVERT] wenn sie lange und hart arbeiten. Der Beruf, ob innerhalb einer Siedlung oder ausserhalb, spielt dabei keine Rolle. Wenn dies geschieht, verwandelt sich der Zwangsarbeiter in einen [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Freien Kolonisten[\LINK]. Dies geschieht zufällig, aber mit steigender Wahrscheinlichkeit über die Zeit. Der genaue Zeitpunkt kann jedoch nicht vorhergesagt werden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Schuldknechte[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Schuldknechte[\LINK] können in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] rekrutiert werden. Sie sind die günstigsten Kolonisten und erscheinen oft auch als [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]Immigranten[\LINK] am Dock. Von allen Zwangsarbeitern haben sie die geringste Wahrscheinlichkeit zu fliehen und die höchste um zum Freien Kolonisten zu werden. Ihr Produktionsabzug ist auch eher gering.[PARAGRAPH:1]Schuldknechte sind auch die einzigen Zwangsarbeiter, die in Dörfern der [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK] ausgebildet werden können. Sie können auch Militärberufe annehmen oder [LINK=UNIT_MISSIONARY]Missionare[\LINK] werden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Kleinkriminelle[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Kleinkriminelle[\LINK] stehen auf der tiefsten Stufe der gesellschaftlichen Leiter und werden gelegentlich vom [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]König[\LINK] als Bestrafung in die neue Welt geschickt. Von Zeit zu Zeit bietet der König den Kolonien solche Kleinkriminellen zum [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kauf[COLOR_REVERT]. Der Preis ist meist sehr sehr günstig. Sie erscheinen dann direkt in den Kolonien.[PARAGRAPH:1]Kleinkriminelle sind über dieses vorgehen jedoch meist sehr verärgert und tendieren daher recht schnell zur Flucht. Auch ist es bei ihnen deutlich seltener, dass sie zum Freien Kolonisten werden, als bei den Schuldknechten.[NEWLINE]Eine Ausbildung zum Spezialisten in einem Ureinwohnerdorf ist nicht möglich. Ihre Produktionsabzüge bei Berufen in Gebäuden sind sehr deutlich. Sie können jedoch in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Militärberufen[COLOR_REVERT] und sogar als sehr schlechte [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Missionare[COLOR_REVERT] eingesetzte werden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Afrikanische Sklaven[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]Afrikanische Sklaven[\LINK] können sehr günstig in [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Afrika[\LINK] gekauft werden. Gelegentlich bietet auch der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]König[COLOR_REVERT] einige Afrikanische Sklaven zum Kauf an.[PARAGRAPH:1]Afrikanische Sklaven sind sehr gute Feldarbeiter und Minenarbeiter. In fast allen Berufen für [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rohmaterialien[COLOR_REVERT] erhalten sie einen kleinen Bonus. Ansonten gibt es für sie wenige sinnvolle Einsatzzwecke ausser vielleicht noch als [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pionier[COLOR_REVERT]. Sie können keine Militärberuf annehmen und auch nicht als Missionar tätig sein. Aufgrund der sehr schlechten Behandlung, die ihnen durch die Versklavung zu teil wurde, flüchten sie auch oft. Im Gegensatz zu Schuldknechten und Kleinkriminellen, ist es ihnen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]nicht möglich ihre Freiheit durch harte Arbeit zu erlangen[COLOR_REVERT]. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ureinwohnersklaven[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Ureinwohnersklaven[\LINK] verhalten sich fast identische, wie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Afrikanische Sklaven[COLOR_REVERT], was Produktion, Berufe, Flucht oder Fähigkeit zur Erlangung der Freiheit angeht. Man erhählt sie jedoch durch ganz andere Wege.[NEWLINE]Gelegentlich verkauft ein befreundeter [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stamm von Ureinwohnern[COLOR_REVERT] den Kolonien seine Kriegsgefangenen. Bei [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ureinwohnerüberfällen[COLOR_REVERT] kann es auch passieren, dass die Uebeltäter gefangen und zur Strafe versklavt werden. Im [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Krieg[\LINK] mit einem Ureinwohnerstamm werden üblicherweise bei der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Eroberung einses Dorfes[COLOR_REVERT] Gefangen gemacht, die dann zu Sklaven werden.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]SERVANTS, CRIMINALS AND SLAVES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Forced Labor[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To build up the [LINK=CONCEPT_ECONOMY]Economy[\LINK] of your colonies, you will need a large amount of [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Colonists[\LINK] to do all the dirty work, but training or recruiting [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]Experts[\LINK] can be expensive or time-consuming. Fortunately, for the enterprising Governor there is a cheaper, faster, but somewhat less ethical option: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forced Labor[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1]There are four different types of colonists in this game who do forced labor: [LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Indentured Servants[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Petty Criminals[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]African Slaves[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slaves[\LINK]. Each of these groups have different strengths and weaknesses, and each of them is obtained through different means.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Working with Forced Labor Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Forced Labor units all work best in [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlements[\LINK] when assigned to professions that gather raw materials on the fields, like [LINK=PROFESSION_FARMER]Farmers[\LINK] and [LINK=PROFESSION_HUNTER]Hunters[\LINK]. Each of them gets a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Production Penalty[COLOR_REVERT] when set to work inside a building in the colony. Additionally, some professions are not available to forced labor units, and most of them can't be trained in Native Villages either. They can, however, learn a specialism through the [LINK=CONCEPT_TRAINING]Education[\LINK] System, but because they receive a penalty when producing [LINK=YIELD_EDUCATION]Education[\LINK] as well, this may take a very long time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fleeing and Gaining Freedom[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Being unhappy with their situation, Forced Labor Units often attempt to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Flee[COLOR_REVERT]. If they do, they leave the city, cross your borders and wander around aimlessly in the wilderness as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independent[COLOR_REVERT] Units. They will continue to do so until you send a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Unit[COLOR_REVERT] after them, attack them and defeat them with it, at which point they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Captured[COLOR_REVERT] and join your colonies again. Make haste, however, if your [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]European Neighbours[\LINK] happen to be in the vicinity, because if they get to the escaped unit first, they can claim them for their own.[NEWLINE]Forced Labor Units can only flee once they're set to work in a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Settlement[COLOR_REVERT], so one way to keep them from taking flight is by equipping them with [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK] and having them work as [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK], a profession that is available to all four Forced Labor Units.[PARAGRAPH:1]Some of these units can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Freed[COLOR_REVERT] if they've worked a long time. It doesn't matter if they worked in a Settlement or outside as Pioneers; in both cases there is the possibility that they will become Free. If this happens, the unit is changed into a [LINK=UNIT_COLONIST]Free Colonist[\LINK]. This event happens by random chance, so there is no way of predicting when a particular unit will become free.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Indentured Servants[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_INDENTURED_SERVANT]Indentured Servants[\LINK] are the only one amongst these four groups that can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. They are the cheapest colonists available there, and they also appear in the docks as [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]Immigrants[\LINK]. Of all these four groups, Indentured Servants are the least likely to run away, and the most likely to earn their freedom at some point. Their production penalty when put to work inside a building is also smaller than the penalty of the other three units.[PARAGRAPH:1]Indentured Servants are also the only Forced Labor Units that can be sent into [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] Villages to be trained as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Experts[COLOR_REVERT], just like Free Colonists and [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Natives[\LINK]. They also can be given military professions, as well as the [LINK=UNIT_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK] profession.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Petty Criminals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_CRIMINAL]Petty Criminals[\LINK] are the lowest members of the societal ladder in Europe, and they are sent by your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] to the New World as a form of punishment for minor crimes. Every once in a while, the King will contact you with the offer to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Buy[COLOR_REVERT] a few of them for a very [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Low Price[COLOR_REVERT], much lower even than Indentured Servants, and once it's paid, they arrive immediately in your colonies, so they don't have to be transported from Europe.[PARAGRAPH:1]However, Petty Criminals are even less eager to work for you than Servants are, which is why they will flee much more often, while it is also much harder for them to gain their freedom.[NEWLINE]Furthermore, they cannot be trained in Native Villages, and their penalty for working inside a building is higher, but they are allowed to take up [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Professions[COLOR_REVERT] or the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Missionary[COLOR_REVERT] profession.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]African Slaves[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_AFRICAN_SLAVE]African Slaves[\LINK] can be purchased for particularly low prices in [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK], while the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]King[COLOR_REVERT] als occasionally offers you African Slaves.[PARAGRAPH:1]African Slaves are good workers, and they get a production bonus of +1 for all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raw Materials[COLOR_REVERT]. They do not have much use apart from that, apart from the possibility of being assigned the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pioneer[COLOR_REVERT] profession. They cannot become missionaries or military units, and they often flee. Unlike Criminals and Servants, African Slaves [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cannot earn their freedom[COLOR_REVERT] by hard work. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Native Slaves[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slaves[\LINK] function in exactly the same way as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]African Slaves[COLOR_REVERT], in terms of production bonuses and penalties, likelihood to flee and inability to be freed. They are obtained in quite different ways, however.[NEWLINE]Sometimes, a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Tribe[COLOR_REVERT] may contact you to sell their prisoners of war to you. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Raids[COLOR_REVERT] can also go horribly wrong for the raiding natives, and if they are captured, they become slaves as well. Finally, if you are at [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK] with a Native Tribe and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Raze[COLOR_REVERT] one of their settlements, there is also a chance of obtaining a Slave, in case there are enough survivors to be enslaved.

TEXT.English: [H1]THE CHURCH[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The Church[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]The Church[COLOR_REVERT], headed by the [LINK=LEADER_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK], never appears on the new world as a Civilization. Instead, your dealings with the Church will consist solely of [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatic Contacts[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Bishops and Quests[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Archbishop[COLOR_REVERT] occasionally will contact you to offer Units or Quests. He is the man who can send [LINK=UNIT_BISHOP]Bishops[\LINK] to the New World if he is impressed by the religious piety of the colonies. Sometimes, he will also ask you to start [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Wars[\LINK] against [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK] who have angered Christ by not accepting [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]Missionaries[\LINK] anywhere in their Villages, or he will asks you to construct [LINK=CONCEPT_MONASTERIES]Monasteries[\LINK]. Fulfilling his demands will improve your relationship with the Church, and in case you start a war against Natives on behalf of the Church, he will provide you with some [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK] as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Monetary Contributions[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Every once in a while, he asks for a charitable [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Contribution[COLOR_REVERT] to lighten the plight of impoverished Christians in the New World.[NEWLINE]If you agree to do so, this improves your standing in the Religious Community, which may result in increased [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]Immigration[\LINK] from [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] or expert [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionaries[\LINK] spontaneously deciding to join your cause.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Contacting the Archbishop[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You can also take the initiative to contact the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Archbishop[COLOR_REVERT] yourself.[NEWLINE]You can then ask him to speak to a fellow [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]European[\LINK] nation or your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK], to speak in your favor to them to improve their Attitude towards you. This can be useful if you want to strengthen [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Trade Relations[\LINK] with other Colonial Powers, or if you are are concerned that your obstinacy and rebelliousness causes your King to increase your [LINK=CONCEPT_TAX_RATE]Tax Rate[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]The Archbishop requires a small sum of gold, however, to do this. Not to profit from this, of course, as he is a Holy Man who abhors the riches of this world, but Holy Men need to pay for their expenses as well, of course.

TEXT.German: [H1]Die Kirche[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Die Kirche[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Die Kirche[COLOR_REVERT], die vom [LINK=LEADER_CHURCH]Erzbischof[\LINK] vertreten wird, erscheint nie als Zivilisation in der Neuen Welt. Kontakte mit der Kirche finden nur über [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatie[\LINK] statt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Bischöfe, Forderungen und Aufträge[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Erzbischof[COLOR_REVERT] kontaktiert gelegentlich den Gouverneur einer Kolonie um Angebote zu machen, Forderungen zu stellen oder Aufträge zu erteilen. Er kann veranlassen, dass ein [LINK=UNIT_BISHOP]Bischof[\LINK] in die Neue Welt gesendet wird, um dort die Gläubigen anzuleiten. Gelegentlich fordert er sogar [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Kriege[\LINK] gegen [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK] wenn er glaubt, dass diese sich der Erlösung durch Christus verweigern, weil sie keine [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]Missionare[\LINK] in ihre Dörfer liessen. Oder er fordert die Errichtung von [LINK=CONCEPT_MONASTERIES]Klöstern[\LINK]. Die Erfüllung seiner Forderungen verbessert die Beziehungen zur Kirche und kann auch viele andere positive Auswirkungen haben. Fals man beispielsweise einen Krieg auf seinen Befehl hin beginnt, schickt er auch einige [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK] zur Unterstützung.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Spenden[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Gelegntlich fodert die Kirche auch wohltätige [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Spenden[COLOR_REVERT] zum Wohle der Armen und Notleidenden ein.[NEWLINE]Solche Forderungen nachzukommen steigert das Ansehen in der christlichen Welt, wodurch die [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]Immigration[\LINK] in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] gesteigert wird, das Ansehen bei anderen Kolonialmächten steigt oder [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionare[\LINK] spontan entscheiden in die Kolonien zu gehen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Den Erzbischof kontaktieren[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ein Gespräch mit dem [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Erzbischof[COLOR_REVERT] kann auch von den Kolonien selbst initiiert werden.[NEWLINE]Man kann ihn bitten, im eigenen Sinne mit anderen [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Kolonialmächten[\LINK] oder dem eigenen [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]König[\LINK] zu sprechen, um bei diesen das eigene Ansehen zu erhöhen. Dies kann nützlich sein, wenn man andere Mächte zu [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Abkommen[\LINK] überreden will oder beim eigenen König eine eventuell schlechte Stimmung wieder glätten möchte, da die Beziehung zu diesem Einfluss auf viele seiner Handlungen wie beispielseise die Erhöhungen der [LINK=CONCEPT_TAX_RATE]Steuerrate[\LINK] hat.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Erzbischof erwartet für solche Gefälligkeiten aber eine kleine Entschädigung. Natürlich nicht zum eigenen Profit, da er als heiliger Mann, keinerlei niedriger Beweggründe kennt. Aber auch die Kirche muss nun einmal für ihr Auskommen aufkommen.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]THE CHURCH[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The Church[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]The Church[COLOR_REVERT], headed by the [LINK=LEADER_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK], never appears on the new world as a Civilization. Instead, your dealings with the Church will consist solely of [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatic Contacts[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Bishops and Quests[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Archbishop[COLOR_REVERT] occasionally will contact you to offer Units or Quests. He is the man who can send [LINK=UNIT_BISHOP]Bishops[\LINK] to the New World if he is impressed by the religious piety of the colonies. Sometimes, he will also ask you to start [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Wars[\LINK] against [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK] who have angered Christ by not accepting [LINK=CONCEPT_MISSIONARIES]Missionaries[\LINK] anywhere in their Villages, or he will asks you to construct [LINK=CONCEPT_MONASTERIES]Monasteries[\LINK]. Fulfilling his demands will improve your relationship with the Church, and in case you start a war against Natives on behalf of the Church, he will provide you with some [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK] as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Monetary Contributions[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Every once in a while, he asks for a charitable [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Contribution[COLOR_REVERT] to lighten the plight of impoverished Christians in the New World.[NEWLINE]If you agree to do so, this improves your standing in the Religious Community, which may result in increased [LINK=CONCEPT_IMMIGRATION]Immigration[\LINK] from [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] or expert [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionaries[\LINK] spontaneously deciding to join your cause.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Contacting the Archbishop[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You can also take the initiative to contact the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Archbishop[COLOR_REVERT] yourself.[NEWLINE]You can then ask him to speak to a fellow [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]European[\LINK] nation or your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK], to speak in your favor to them to improve their Attitude towards you. This can be useful if you want to strengthen [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Trade Relations[\LINK] with other Colonial Powers, or if you are are concerned that your obstinacy and rebelliousness causes your King to increase your [LINK=CONCEPT_TAX_RATE]Tax Rate[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]The Archbishop requires a small sum of gold, however, to do this. Not to profit from this, of course, as he is a Holy Man who abhors the riches of this world, but Holy Men need to pay for their expenses as well, of course.
