TEXT.English: [H1]TAX RATE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Taxation[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You can make huge profits through the [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Trading[\LINK] of Goods with [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] or [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK], but your success is for a large part determined by the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tax Rate[COLOR_REVERT] your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] has imposed upon you. For everything you sell in either [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Africa[COLOR_REVERT], the King will claim a certain percentage of your profits. This only applies to goods you sell; you still buy everything in Europe for its regular cost, without having to pay any taxes on top of that.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Increases in Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Every once in a while, your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]King[COLOR_REVERT] will contact you with the message that he is going to raise your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Taxes[COLOR_REVERT]. There are two ways to respond to this.[NEWLINE]You can [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Accept[COLOR_REVERT] the tax rise, in which case the Tax Rate rises with the specified amount, but nothing else happens.[NEWLINE]The other option is to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rebel[COLOR_REVERT] by throwing a "goods party." This means that a specific [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Colony[\LINK] destroys everything it has in [LINK=CONCEPT_NEW_STORAGE]Storage[\LINK] of a certain good: usually something that colony specializes in, and of which large amounts are stored. In addition, you receive a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boycott[COLOR_REVERT] of that good, meaning that you cannot trade it with Europe or Africa anymore, and your [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatic Relations[\LINK] with your King will suffer. The rise in taxes, however, is prevented this way.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Maximum Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The height of the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tax Rate[COLOR_REVERT] is influenced by various factors. An important one is the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Maximum Tax Rate[COLOR_REVERT]. This is a level above which the Tax Rate cannot rise, so once you've reached it, you will be relatively safe from your King.[NEWLINE]This maximum is not fixed though: your King occasionally contacts you with the command to hand over a part of your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Treasury[COLOR_REVERT] to him. If you accept, the Maximum Tax Rate falls, but if you refuse, it rises. This can also happen if your Tax Rate already has reached its current maximum.[NEWLINE]There are also some [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK] that can influence your Maximum Tax Rate.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Other influences on the Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are other factors which determine your Tax Rate, your King's tendency to raise it, and your Maximum Tax Rate.[PARAGRAPH:1]Your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatic Relationship[COLOR_REVERT] with your King is one of them; if your King is angered by your insolence, he will try to force you to return to the fold again by raising Taxes.[NEWLINE]Some leaders, like [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]Adriaen van der Donck[\LINK], have the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Charismatic[COLOR_REVERT] ability, which doubles the time between the King's Tax Rises. These factors are also influenced greatly by the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Difficulty Rate[COLOR_REVERT] on which you play.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Boycotts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Refuse[COLOR_REVERT] to accept a Tax raise that is proposed by your King, it will result in one good being [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boycotted[COLOR_REVERT]. Boycotts can be lifted, if you are willing to pay a very large sum of money to soothe your King's anger.[NEWLINE]Both high Tax Rates and Boycotts can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Circumvented[COLOR_REVERT], however. One way to do it, is by selling your goods in [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK]. In Port Royal, there is always a fixed fee you have to pay when selling goods, and the level this fee never rises or falls.[NEWLINE]As [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Port Royal[COLOR_REVERT] can only be reached by [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]Smuggling Ships[\LINK], you will not be able to conduct large scale Trading with it, as none these three units have more than three cargo slots.[PARAGRAPH:1]You can also purchase Smuggling Ships in Port Royal, and have them sell goods in either [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Africa[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT]. Smuggling Ships will release you of the burden to pay taxes, though smugglers do demand a small [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fee[COLOR_REVERT] to be paid for every transaction they arrange.[NEWLINE]Boycotted goods can also be sold to Europe via the [LINK=BUILDING_CUSTOM_HOUSE]Custom House[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Monarchy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]After declaring [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]Independence[\LINK], this usually means that you lose all possibility of trading with Europe and Africa. If you opt for the [LINK=CIVIC_MONARCHY]Monarchy[\LINK] civic when formulating your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT], however, you can continue trading with Europe and Africa, and have a fixed Tax Rate imposed upon you.

TEXT.German: [H1]Steuern[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Besteuerung[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Durch den [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Handel[\LINK] mit Gütern in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK] oder [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Afrika[\LINK] können hohe Profite erwirtschaftet werden. Diese werden aber zu einem wichtiten Teil auch von der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Steuerrate[COLOR_REVERT] bestimmt, die der [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]König[\LINK] den Kolonien auferlegt. Bei jedem Verkauf in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europa[COLOR_REVERT] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Afrika[COLOR_REVERT] schöpft der König einen Prozentsatz über Steuern ab. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Erhöhungen der Steuerrate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Von Zeit zu Zeit, abhängig von der Handelsaktivität, kontaktiert der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]König[COLOR_REVERT] den Gouverneur um ihm mitzuteilen, dass die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Steuern wieder erhöht[COLOR_REVERT] werden sollen. [NEWLINE]Man kann dies [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]akzeptieren[COLOR_REVERT] wodurch eben die Steuerrate um den angegebenen Satz steigt.[NEWLINE]Oder aber man [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]verweigert die Erhöhung[COLOR_REVERT]. Dies führt dazu, dass in einer [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Kolonie[\LINK] die aufgebrachte Bevölkerung waren im [LINK=CONCEPT_NEW_STORAGE]Lagerhaus[\LINK] vernichtet. Es handelt sich meist um die am meisten verfügbare Ware. Der König reagiert darauf indem er einen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boykott[COLOR_REVERT] auf diese Ware verhängt, wordurch diese so lange nicht in Europa oder Afrika gehandelt werden kann, bis man eventuell einsichtig wird und eine Strafzahlung in Kauf nimmt um mit der Ware wieder Handel treiben zu können. Die [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Beziehungen[\LINK] zum König leiden natürlich unter solch einer Handlung.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Maximale Steuerrate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die Höhe der Steuerrate wird durch viele Faktoren beeinflusst. Einer davon ist die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Maximale Steuerrate[COLOR_REVERT]. Diese stellt eine Grenze dar, die der König nicht überschreiten wird. [NEWLINE]Dieses Maximum ist aber nicht für immer festgeschrieben. Sie kann aufgrund unterschiedlicher Handlungen der Kolonien gesenkt oder erhöht werden. Werden beispielsweise Geldforderungen des Königs erfüllt und ein Teil des aktuellen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Goldvorrats[COLOR_REVERT] übergeben, so sinkt sie. [NEWLINE]Es gibt auch einige [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Zufallsereignisse[\LINK] deren Entscheidungen hier Einfluss haben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Andere Faktoren[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beziehungen[COLOR_REVERT] zum König sind ebenfalls entscheidend bezüglich der Häufigkeit von Steuererhöhugen. Ist der König verärgert, ist eine Steuererhöhung deutlich wahrscheinlicher. Ist er erfreut, dementsprechend weniger.[NEWLINE]Eine Führer, wie [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]Adriaen van der Donck[\LINK], haben die Eigenschaft [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Charismatisch[COLOR_REVERT], die den Zeitraum zwischen Steuererhöhungen verdoppelt. Auch der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schwierigkeitsgrad[COLOR_REVERT] ist bestimmend.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hinweis[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Da auch die Menge der in Europa oder Afrika verkauften Waren für die Häufigkeit der Steuererhöhungen ausschlaggeben ist, kann man durch den Verkauf in [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK] oder den Verkauf auf dem eigenen Binnenmarkt oder bei Ureinwohnern, einen Anstieg der Steuerrate verlangsamen.

There are two ways to respond to this.[NEWLINE]You can [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Accept[COLOR_REVERT] the tax rise, in which case the Tax Rate rises with the specified amount, but nothing else happens.[NEWLINE]The other option is to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rebel[COLOR_REVERT] by throwing a "goods party." In addition, you receive a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boycott[COLOR_REVERT] of that good, meaning that you cannot trade it with Europe or Africa anymore, and your [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatic Relations[\LINK] with your King will suffer. The rise in taxes, however, is prevented this way.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Maximum Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The height of the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tax Rate[COLOR_REVERT] is influenced by various factors. An important one is the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Maximum Tax Rate[COLOR_REVERT]. This is a level above which the Tax Rate cannot rise, so once you've reached it, you will be relatively safe from your King.[NEWLINE]This maximum is not fixed though: your King occasionally contacts you with the command to hand over a part of your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Treasury[COLOR_REVERT] to him. If you accept, the Maximum Tax Rate falls, but if you refuse, it rises. This can also happen if your Tax Rate already has reached its current maximum.[NEWLINE]There are also some [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK] that can influence your Maximum Tax Rate.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Other influences on the Tax Rate[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are other factors which determine your Tax Rate, your King's tendency to raise it, and your Maximum Tax Rate.[PARAGRAPH:1]Your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatic Relationship[COLOR_REVERT] with your King is one of them; if your King is angered by your insolence, he will try to force you to return to the fold again by raising Taxes.[NEWLINE]Some leaders, like [LINK=LEADER_DONCK]Adriaen van der Donck[\LINK], have the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Charismatic[COLOR_REVERT] ability, which doubles the time between the King's Tax Rises. These factors are also influenced greatly by the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Difficulty Rate[COLOR_REVERT] on which you play.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Boycotts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Refuse[COLOR_REVERT] to accept a Tax raise that is proposed by your King, it will result in one good being [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boycotted[COLOR_REVERT]. Boycotts can be lifted, if you are willing to pay a very large sum of money to soothe your King's anger.[NEWLINE]Both high Tax Rates and Boycotts can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Circumvented[COLOR_REVERT], however. One way to do it, is by selling your goods in [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK]. In Port Royal, there is always a fixed fee you have to pay when selling goods, and the level this fee never rises or falls.[NEWLINE]As [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Port Royal[COLOR_REVERT] can only be reached by [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP]Smuggling Ships[\LINK], you will not be able to conduct large scale Trading with it, as none these three units have more than three cargo slots.[PARAGRAPH:1]You can also purchase Smuggling Ships in Port Royal, and have them sell goods in either [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Africa[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT]. Smuggling Ships will release you of the burden to pay taxes, though smugglers do demand a small [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fee[COLOR_REVERT] to be paid for every transaction they arrange.[NEWLINE]Boycotted goods can also be sold to Europe via the [LINK=BUILDING_CUSTOM_HOUSE]Custom House[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Monarchy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]After declaring [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]Independence[\LINK], this usually means that you lose all possibility of trading with Europe and Africa. If you opt for the [LINK=CIVIC_MONARCHY]Monarchy[\LINK] civic when formulating your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT], however, you can continue trading with Europe and Africa, and have a fixed Tax Rate imposed upon you.

TEXT.English: [H1]SHIPS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Naval Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A significant part of all action in a Colonization game happens on [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sea[COLOR_REVERT]. You need ships to transport Goods and [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Units[\LINK], seek out [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT3]Shipwrecks[\LINK], discover new islands and continents, gather [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_WHALE_BLUBBER]Whale Fat[\LINK], sink enemy Naval Units and trade with [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK], the [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK] and other [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Colonial Powers[\LINK]. There are eighteen different ships in the game to perform these various tasks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ships' Cargo Capacity[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Many of the ships have one or more [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cargo Slots[COLOR_REVERT]. These [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]Transport[\LINK] Vessels usually can carry both goods and units, though only goods can be sold in Europe, Africa or Port Royal.[NEWLINE]Every transport ship type has a unique cargo capacity. For an overview of all ships, see below.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Movement and Combat Strength[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Besides Cargo Capacity, Naval Units also have a certain [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Combat Strength[\LINK] as well as a certain amount of [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Movement Points[\LINK] (MPs). Some ships have other, special abilities as well. The differences between these factors determine the function of each type of ship.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Building Ships[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are several ways of obtaining ships. Many can be bought in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Port Royal[COLOR_REVERT], and many can be built in your coastal [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlements[\LINK] as well. They can also be captured in Combat by stronger military vessels.[PARAGRAPH:1]To be able to build ships in your settlements, that settlement must fulfill several conditions.[NEWLINE]First of all, a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Harbor Building[COLOR_REVERT] needs to be present. The [LINK=UNIT_FISHING_BOAT]Fishing Boat[\LINK] only needs a [LINK=BUILDING_DOCK]Dock[\LINK], most Merchant Ships, [LINK=UNIT_WHALING_BOAT]Whaling Boats[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SLOOP]Sloops[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK] need a [LINK=BUILDING_DRYDOCK]Drydock[\LINK] to be present, and the warships, the [LINK=UNIT_GALLEON]Galleon[\LINK] and the [LINK=UNIT_WEST_INDIAMAN]West Indiaman[\LINK] require a [LINK=BUILDING_SHIPYARD]Shipyard[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Secondly, many resources are needed to build ships, in addition to [LINK=CONCEPT_PRODUCTION]Production[\LINK]. Which resources and how much of each varies from ship to ship, but the resources that sometimes are required to build them are [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Blades[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Bonuses for Ships[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]TYPES OF SHIPS[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Merchant Ships[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant Ships[COLOR_REVERT] are vessels that are primarily useful for transportation and [LINK=CONCEPT_TRADE]Trade[\LINK]. They often have much Cargo Space, but some of them are quite weak in terms of Combat Strength.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_CARAVEL][BOLD]Caravel[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Caravels are the weakest trade vessels there are, but they are also the cheapest. They have 4 MPs, but only 2 Cargo Space, and they have a Combat Strength of 3. They are primarily useful for early [LINK=CONCEPT_VISIBILITY]Exploration[\LINK] and Trade, but later in the game they are less efficient due to their small Cargo Space, and because they are relatively weak, they often need to be protected against Pirates as well.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_FLUYT][BOLD]Fluyt[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Fluyts are slightly more expensive than Caravels. They have a low combat strength as well and are slower, but they have a Cargo Space of 3. Like Caravels, Fluyts are useful as cheap trade vessels, if you are not in a hurry.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_CARAVELA_REDONDA][BOLD]Caravela Redonda[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Caravela Redondas are more expensive than Fluyts and Caravels. They have 3 Cargo Slots and 4 speed, and a combat strength of 4 as well. In addition to this, they have the ability to attack other vessels, although their relatively low combat strength doesn't make them useful as warships.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_CARRACK][BOLD]Carrack[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Carracks are slow but efficient merchant ships. Though they only have 3 MPs, they have four Cargo Slots. This can be a huge advantage when trading with native villages, who usually offer several interesting goods at once, that need one Cargo Slot each. Like Caravelas Redondas, Carracks can attack other vessels, but they are still relatively weak.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_MERCHANTMAN][BOLD]Merchantman[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Merchantmen are efficient trading vessels that are averagely costed, both when purchased in Europe and when built in a settlement. They have 4 MPs and 4 Cargo Slots, and they often can form the backbone of your merchant fleet. They are not very strong though, and need stronger ships to protect them from pirates or other enemy warships.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_BRIGANTINE][BOLD]Brigantine[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Brigantines have the same amount of MPs and Cargo Slots as Merchantmen, but they are much stronger. They have a strength of 5, and in addition to that, they receive a Defense Bonus against pirates. This makes it a much safer transport vessel than the Merchantman, and if pirates are very active, they are a very good alternative to them.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_WEST_INDIAMAN][BOLD]West Indiaman[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]The West Indiaman is the strongest merchant ship available. It sports 5 Cargo Slots and has 5 MPs, making it a very efficient Transport Unit, and in addition to that, it has a Combat Strength of 6, which makes it quite useful as a warship as well.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_GALLEON][BOLD]Galleon[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]With 6 Cargo Slots, Galleons are the ultimate merchant vessels. They are the only ships that can carry [LINK=CONCEPT_CHANGES_TO_TREASURES]Treasures[\LINK] to Europe. They are relatively strong as well, and can attack and sink weaker ships, and put up a worthy fight against pirates as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Military Vessels[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are several strong military warships available in the game. These can conduct naval battles to establish your supremacy at sea, or they can be used to protect your shipping lines against pirates. Apart from the Sloop and the Man-o-War, none of them have any Cargo Slots, so you can't use them as transport vessels.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_SLOOP][BOLD]Sloop[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]The Sloop is the fastest Naval Unit in the game. It is rather cheap, and primarily useful as a naval scout, as, with a few promotions, it can explore uncharted oceans quite rapidly. In addition to this, it has the ability to attack, but it won't stand much of a chance against pirates or larger warships. It also has 1 Cargo Slot, so it is also useful if you want to quickly transport units from one landmass to another while evading stronger warships.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_CORVETTE][BOLD]Corvette[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Corvettes are fast warships that are specialized in hunting pirates. They receive a large attack bonus against both pirate vessels. They are also stronger and faster than most merchant vessels, and can be a scourge for your enemies' trade routes. They aren't much of a threat against most other warships though.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE][BOLD]Frigate[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Frigates are as fast as Corvettes, but they are slightly stronger. They are very suitable as all-round warships, useful both for pirate hunting and larger naval battles.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE][BOLD]Ship of the Line[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Ships of the Line are the strongest warships you can get your hands on. With a Combat Strength of 9, they are much stronger than Frigates, but they are also slower. If you want to put a dent in the [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK]'s fleet during the [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]War of Independence[\LINK], Ships of the Line are your only option.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_MAN_O_WAR][BOLD]Man-o-War[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Man-o-Wars are the strongest warships in the game, with a combat strength of no less than 14. They are only available to your King, who uses them to carry the Royal Army to your shores, as they also have 4 Cargo Slots. Only experienced Ships of the Line stand a chance against these formidable warships.[NEWLINE]Though you do not have the means to build Man-o-Wars yourself, there are certain [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK] that can provide you with them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Pirates and Smugglers[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]You can also use ships that can ignore the treaties you have made with another nations and your own king. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pirates[COLOR_REVERT] can attack ships of other nations without having to declare [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK] on that nation, and if they are successful, they can capture valuable cargo as well.[NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Smugglers[COLOR_REVERT] are able to sell goods in Africa or Europe without having to pay taxes over them. They do require a small fee though.[NEWLINE]Pirates and smugglers can only carry goods, not units. For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Piracy and Smuggling[\LINK].[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER][BOLD]Privateer[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]The Privateer is a pirate ship that can be built in your settlements or bought in Europe. They have 5 MPs and a Visibility bonus, and are experts in chasing smaller vessels and sinking them, but they will have a hard time going up against the stronger merchant ships such as the West Indiaman. They have 2 Cargo Slots to store their stolen loot.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE][BOLD]Pirate Frigate[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Pirate Frigates are stronger than Privateers, but they have one Cargo Slot less. They can sink any merchant vessel, and even stand a chance against some warships. They can be purchased only in Port Royal.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_SMUGGLING_SHIP][BOLD]Smuggling Ship[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]The Smuggling Ship is the only smuggler in the game. They can be bought only in Port Royal. They are small and do not stand a chance against any naval attack, so you must use stealth and subterfuge to reap the rewards of smuggling.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gathering Boats[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are two [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gathering Boats[COLOR_REVERT] available in the game. These vessels can go to a Bonus Resource on sea and harvest resources from that plot. For information about how this works, see [LINK=CONCEPT_WHALING]Whaling and Fishing[\LINK].[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_FISHING_BOAT][BOLD]Fishing Boat[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Fishing Boats can gather [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] from any Bonus Resource on Sea that increases Food production. They are the weakest ships in the game, but they are cheap to build, and require only a Dock to be present in a settlement.[NEWLINE]Due to their weakness, they are very vulnerable to attack by pirates or Sea Animals.[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_WHALING_BOAT][BOLD]Whaling Boat[\BOLD][\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]Whaling Boats are the only means in the game to obtain [LINK=YIELD_WHALE_BLUBBER]Whale Fat[\LINK]. This can only be harvested from the [LINK=BONUS_WHALE]Sperm Whales[\LINK] resource. Although slightly stronger than Fishing Boats, they are are still quite vulnerable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Sea Animals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]On the Ocean, you can also encounter [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Sea Animals[\LINK] of various kinds. They are very weak, and most ships won't have to fear much from them, but they can be a hazard to Fishing Boats, Whaling Boats, Caravels and Fluyts.
TEXT.French: [H1]SHIPS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravels[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fluyts[COLOR_REVERT] are the most basic merchant ships: Caravels are slightly faster, fluyts can transport more cargo. [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Merchantmen[COLOR_REVERT] are better merchant ships: They can carry more cargo than fluyts while still being as fast as caravels.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]While these merchant ships can only defend themselves when attacked, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Carracks[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galleons[COLOR_REVERT] are real all-purpose ships: They can be used to transport cargo and can attack enemy vessels. While carracks are slow and lacking military strength, they are cheap to build. Galleons on the other hand can carry more cargo than any other ship (including [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Treasure[COLOR_REVERT]) and can survive many naval actions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Frigates[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ships of the Line[COLOR_REVERT] are real warships: While frigates are fast, ships of the line are the most powerful warships of the colonial fleet. The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Man-o-War[COLOR_REVERT], ruler of the seas, is Europe's most powerful ship and only available to the European monarchs and their expeditionary forces. Their design is a closely guarded secret, meaning no colony will ever be able to build one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Merchant ships can be built in any settlement with a drydock. All-purpose ships and warships require a shipyard. The amount of tools required for the construction of ships depends on the cargo space of a ship. The faster a ship type is, the more cloth is required to build it. Powerful ships require more guns to build than less powerful ships.
TEXT.German: [H1]Schiffen[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Seeeinheiten[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ein Grossteil des Spieles geschieht auf dem Meer. Der Transport von Gütern und Einheiten von und nach [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europa[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Afrika[\LINK] und [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK], die Untersuchung von [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT3]Schiffswracks[\LINK], die Entdeckung neuer Kontinente und Inseln, das Sammeln von [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Nahrung[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_WHALE_BLUBBER]Walspeck[\LINK] durch [LINK=UNIT_FISHING_BOAT]Fischerboote[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_WHALING_BOAT]Walfänger[\LINK], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Piraterie[COLOR_REVERT] oder auch der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kampf gegen Piraten[COLOR_REVERT] und vieles mehr. Hierfür stehen dem Spieler [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]achtzehn unterschiedliche Schiffstypen[COLOR_REVERT] zur Verfügung. Natürlich unterscheiden diese sich alle in ihren Fähigkeiten, Stärken und Schwächen, wie auch in ihren Kauf- und Baukosten bzw. Bauvoraussetzungen. Details zu allen findet man im Bereich 'Einheiten' der Colopädie. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Bau von Schiffen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Der Bau von Schiffen benötigt je nach Schiffstyp unterschiedliche Mengen an [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Kannonen[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Eisenwaren[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Seilen[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Segeltuch[\LINK] und manchmal auch [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Klingenwaffen[\LINK]. Je nach Schiffstyp sind auch unterschiedliche [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ausbaustufen des Hafens[COLOR_REVERT] notwendig.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Schiffstypen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karavellen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fluyten[COLOR_REVERT] sind die einfachsten Handelsschiffe: Karavellen sind etwas schneller, Fluyten können etwas mehr Güter transportieren. [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Westindienfahrer[COLOR_REVERT] sind bereits bessere Handelsschiffe: Sie können soviele Güter transportieren, wie eine Fluyt und sind dennoch noch so schnell wie die Karavelle.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Während diese Handelsschiffe nur zur Verteidiung fähig sind, können [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karacken[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galleonen[COLOR_REVERT] auch angreifen und sind somit Allzweckschiffe. Karacken sind zwar langsam und vergleichsweise schwach, dafür aber relativ günstig und einfach zu bauen. Galleonen andererseits können mehr Güter als jedes andere Schiff transportieren und auch [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Schätze[COLOR_REVERT] transportieren.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fregatten[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Linienschiffe[COLOR_REVERT] sind echte Kriegsschiffe. Fregatten sind vergleichsweise schnell, aber Linienschiffe sind die mächtigsten Kriegsschiffe der Kolonien. Das [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Königliche Linienschiff[COLOR_REVERT], Herrscher der See, ist Europas mähctigstes Schiff und steht üblicherweise nur den Königen zur Verfügung. Der Bau in den Kolonien ist nicht möglich, aber es gibt sehr seltene Gelegenheiten, bei denen man vom König ein solches Schiff bekommen kann.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Handelschiffe benötigen zum Bau ein Trockendock, Allzweckschiffe und Kriegsschiffe bereits eine Schiffswerft.

TEXT.English: [H1]WAR OF INDEPENDENCE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The usual way to achieve [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Victory[\LINK] in a Colonization game is by becoming an Independent nation after winning a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]War Of Independence[COLOR_REVERT] against your mother nation. This War is the climax of the Game, and usually it is the most challenging part, as your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] isn't going to let you off the hook easily![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Declaring Independence[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The Independence War starts on the moment you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Declare Independence[COLOR_REVERT]. You can declare Independence when the total [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rebel Sentiment[COLOR_REVERT] of all your colonies put together peaks above 50%. For information on how to achieve that, see [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Rebel Sentiment[\LINK].[NEWLINE]When you declare Independence, you can also write your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT]. You can choose a stance on each of five different issues: Slavery, Religion, Land Security, Natives and Elections. Go to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT] section of the Colopedia to see what every option does.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Preparing for the Independence War[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If you boost your Rebel Sentiment, you can declare [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independence[COLOR_REVERT], but to win the Independence War, you need more than a Rebellious Attitude: you need [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Soldiers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]At any given moment, you can visit the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Revolution Advisor[COLOR_REVERT] (F3) to see what awaits you if you declare Independence. On the left, all your own military units are listed, and the amounts of [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Weaponry[\LINK] you have in storage is displayed as well. On the right, you can see the units your King will send once you declare Independence.[NEWLINE] When your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rebel Sentiment[COLOR_REVERT] rises, your King will [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]add units[COLOR_REVERT] to his army. How many units he adds each time depends on your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Potential[COLOR_REVERT], which means your military [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]units[COLOR_REVERT] plus the amounts of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]weapons[COLOR_REVERT] you have in storage. The goods that counted as "weapons" in this instance are [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Blades[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK]. So be careful when producing these: if you produce more than you can equip units with, your King will still increase his Army because of them, which tips the military balance even more in his favor.[NEWLINE]Sometimes the King will add only a single unit to his army, but sometimes, he adds [LINK=UNIT_MAN_O_WAR]Man-o-Wars[\LINK], which also bring four land units with them.[PARAGRAPH:2]Before declaring Independence, you must build up a large army to defeat your King. It is in this phase of the game, that production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns and Cannons[COLOR_REVERT] is vital, as before this phase, you won't have many uses for large amounts of weapons yet, while after this phase, you will be embroiled in a continent-wide [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], which can severely disrupt your ability to mass-produce weapons and military units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The Royal Army Offensives[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Once you declare [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independence[COLOR_REVERT], your King will start prepraing his punitive expeditions. The army of the King displayed in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Revolution Screen[COLOR_REVERT] will not be send to you int its entirety, but [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Multiple Waves[COLOR_REVERT] of invading forces will strike your colonies. Usually, the colonies that are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]largest[COLOR_REVERT], are the most [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rebellious[COLOR_REVERT], border the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ocean[COLOR_REVERT] or lie furthest in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]East[COLOR_REVERT] bear the brunt of the Royal Army attacks, but expect Man-o-Wars to unload their deadly cargo over the entire New World, so while you are preparing for Independence, it is wise to make sure your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]outlying settlements[COLOR_REVERT] are ready for invasion as well.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Royal Army consists of several types of units. The only [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Naval Units[\LINK] your King uses are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT]. These are formidable warships that are much stronger than your strongest ship, the [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]Ship of the Line[\LINK], and they also have four cargo slots to transport the King's soldiers.[NEWLINE]the land army of your King consists of several different units. The majority of his soldiers are [LINK=UNIT_REGULAR]Regulars[\LINK], very strong elite units who can adopt the [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Musketman[\LINK], the [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Cavalryman[\LINK] or the [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoon[\LINK] professions. These have the same abilities as these profession have when adopted by [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Your Soldiers[\LINK], except that they receive the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK] promotions, as well as a 50% bonus when attacking Settlements. However, they do not receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK] form a large part of your King's Army as well. These [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] receive a 50% Settlement attack bonus, and start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] promotions. These units do not receive Defensive Bonuses either.[NEWLINE]The Royal Army also employs a great number of [LINK=UNIT_ARTILLERY]Artillery Regiments[\LINK] These are the strongest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siege Units[COLOR_REVERT] in the game, capable of obliterating even the best defended cities. When they have captured a city, they receive a 50% City Defense Bonus as well, although they do not receive other defensive bonuses. When these monsters attack a city, you do not want to be found inside![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Strengths and Weaknesses[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Your success in the Independence War depends for a great deal on the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Theater of War[COLOR_REVERT]. The Royal Army is on its strongest when on the offensive, and when they attacck a settlement, these is usually little you can do to withstand them. So if you hole up in your colonies and trust in your [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_BASTION]Fortifications[\LINK] to withstand the onslaught, you are likely to be squashed. Instead, if you manage to draw the Royal Army out into the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], you will stand a much better chance of winning battles, as none of the King's units receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] from terrain features such as Hills or Forests. Additionally, while the Royal Army excels at capturing settlements, it has much more problems keeping them, due to the poor Defensive Capabilities of its units.[PARAGRAPH:1]A very large advantage you have is also that the large majority of the War will take place inside your [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK], which means that you can use all the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT], but the Royal Army can't, which gives you a huge advantage in [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobility[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]On the Ocean, it is very unlikely you stand a chance to sink the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Fleet[COLOR_REVERT], as it usually consists of many dozens of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT] with each wave of Royal Attacks. Your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ships of the Line[COLOR_REVERT] are much weaker than these vessels, but if one Ship of the Line can damage a Man-o-War by attacking it, a second one is usually sufficient to sink it. However, due to the sheer [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]number[COLOR_REVERT] of Man-o-Wars you are facing, it would take a ridiculous amount of Ships of the Line to prevent the Royal Army from landing at all. However, for every Man-o-War you sink, you will have to face [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]four land units[COLOR_REVERT] less, so it definitely can pay off to keep a fleet of Ships of the Line ready.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Winning the Independence War[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Win[COLOR_REVERT] the Independence War, you only have to destroy your King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT], you don't have to sink every Man-o-War. At the moment the last unit of the Royal Army is annihilated, and none of your colonies is under Royal control, you have achieved [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Victory[\LINK].

TEXT.German: [H1]Unabhängigkeitskrieg[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Der übliche Weg zum [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Sieg[\LINK] im Spiel ist die Erreichung der Unabhängigkeit durch den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Unabhängigkeitskrieg[COLOR_REVERT] gegen das eigene Heimatland. Dieser Krieg ist üblicherweise der Höhepunkt des Spiels und auch der herausfordernste Teil, da der [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]König[\LINK] die Kolonien nicht ohne Gegenwehr aufgibt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Unabhängigkeitserklärung[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Der Unabhängigkeitskrieg beginnt in dem Moment da die Kolonien ihre [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Unabhängigkeitserklärung[COLOR_REVERT] abgeben. Dies kann geschehen, wenn die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rebellische Stimmung[COLOR_REVERT] der gesmten Kolonie über 50% erreicht. Siehe hierzu auch [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Rebellische Stimmung[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Wenn die Unabhängigkeit erklärt wird, kann auch eine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Verfassung[COLOR_REVERT] erstellt werden. Man kann die Haltung der neuen Nation zu fünf verschiedenen Sachverhalten festlegen: Sklaverei, Religion, Sicherheit, Ureinwohner und Politik. Im Bereich [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Verfassung[COLOR_REVERT] der Colopedia finden sich hierzu detaillierte Informationen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Vorbereitung auf den Unabhängigkeitskrieg[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Um den Unabhängigkeitskrieg zu gewinnen braucht es mehr als nur rebellische Stimmung. Man braucht vorallem [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Truppen[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]Um einen überblick zu Erhalten kann der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Revolutionsberater[COLOR_REVERT] (F3) aufgerufen werden. Hier sieht man, welche Truppen man selbst in die Schlacht führen kann und welche Truppen der König entsenden wird. Die Menge der gelagerten [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Waffen[\LINK] wird ebenfalls angezeigt.[NEWLINE] Steigt die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rebellische Stimmung[COLOR_REVERT] so bleibt dies vom König nicht unbemerkt und er wird seine Truppen ausbauen. Auch das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]militärische Potential[COLOR_REVERT] (Truppen und gelagerte Waffen) und die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beziehungen[COLOR_REVERT] spielen hierbei eine Rolle. Die Güter, die als Bewaffnung gelten sind [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Schusswaffen[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Kannonen[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Klingenwaffen[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Pferde[\LINK]. Daher sollte man hiervon nicht unnötige grosse Mengen lagern und so den König beunruhigen.[NEWLINE]Die Flotte des Königs besteht aus [LINK=UNIT_MAN_O_WAR]Königlichen Linienschiffen[\LINK], die auch die Truppen transportieren können.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Der königliche Gegenschlag[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Nach der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Unabhängigkeitserklärung[COLOR_REVERT] entsendet der König seine Truppen zur Rückeroberung. Dies geschieht aber nicht auf einen Schlag, sondern [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]in mehrerer Wellen[COLOR_REVERT] von Schiffen. Der genau Anlandeort der königlichen Truppen ist schwer vorhersagbar. Meist geschieht dies in der Nähe der grossen Hafenstädte, kann aber überall im weiteren Umland einer Kolonie geschehen. Daher sollten auch weiter entfernte Siedlungen auf die Invasion der Feinde vorbereitet sein.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die königliche Expeditionsstreitmacht besteht aus unterschiedlichen Truppen. Die [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]Königlichen Linienschiffe[\LINK] die sie beherbergen sind die stärksten Schiffe im Spiel und auch den starken [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]Linienschiffen[\LINK] überlegen.[NEWLINE]Die Mehrheit der Soldaten besteht aus [LINK=UNIT_REGULAR]Regulars[\LINK], starken Elitetruppen, die sowohl in den Berufen [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Soldat[\LINK], wie auch [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Cavalryman[\LINK] oder [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoner[\LINK] auftreten können. [NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessische Söldner[\LINK] sind meist ebenfalls in grösserer Zahl unter den Truppen des Königs zu finden. [NEWLINE]Auch [LINK=UNIT_ARTILLERY]Königliche Artillerie[\LINK], die stärkste [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Belagerungseinheit[COLOR_REVERT] des Spiels ist unter den Truppen. Diese kann auch den besten Verteidigungsanlagen gefährlich werden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Stärken und Schwächen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die königlichen Expeditionsstreitkräfte sind sehr stark im Angriff von Städten und auf dem offene Schlachtfeld. Ein einigeln in den eigenen Städten, selbst wenn diese über starke Verteidigungsanlagen verügen, ist daher nicht immer ratsam. Wenn man es dagegen versteht, die feindlichen Truppen in das Innenland beziehungsweise die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wildnis[COLOR_REVERT] zu locken, verlieren sie einen Grossteil ihrer Gefährlichkeit, da dort die eigenen Truppen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensivbonusse[COLOR_REVERT] im Terrain, wie Hügel und Wälder, ausnutzen können, die für die königlichen Truppen meist nicht gelten. Ansonsten ist zu bemerken, dass die königlichen Truppen in der Eroberung von Städten meist viel besser sind, als in deren Verteidigung, da diese Truppen allgemein eher offesiv als defensiv ausgerichtet sind.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ein weiterer grosser Vorteil der Kolonien ist, dass die Meisten Kämpfe auf dem eigenen Land bzw. innerhalb der eigenen [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Grenzen[\LINK] ausgetragen werden, wodurch das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Strassen- und Schienennetz[COLOR_REVERT] einen Vorteil in Bezug auf [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobilität[\LINK] gewehrt.[PARAGRAPH:2]Auf dem offenen Meer ist es sehr unwahrscheinlich, dass die eigene Flotte gegen die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]riesige Königliche Flotte[COLOR_REVERT] stand hält. Hier kann man höchstens versuchen die erfolgreiche Ankunft der gegnerischen Landtruppen zu verringern oder zu verzögern indem man die königlichen Schiffe soweit eben möglich beschädigt und gelegentlich auch ein mit Truppen beladenes Schiff versenkt. Aber auch dies ist für den Erfolg des Kampfes an Land sehr wichtig.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gewinnen des Unabhängigkeitskrieges[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Um den Krieg zu gewinnen reicht es aus, alle [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]königlichen Landtruppen[COLOR_REVERT] zu zerstören. Eine Vernichtung aller Schiffe ist nicht notwendig. Sobald einem dies gelingt, hat man den [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Sieg[\LINK] errungen.

Usually, the colonies that are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]largest[COLOR_REVERT], are the most [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]rebellious[COLOR_REVERT], border the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ocean[COLOR_REVERT] or lie furthest in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]East[COLOR_REVERT] bear the brunt of the Royal Army attacks, but expect Man-o-Wars to unload their deadly cargo over the entire New World, so while you are preparing for Independence, it is wise to make sure your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]outlying settlements[COLOR_REVERT] are ready for invasion as well.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Royal Army consists of several types of units. The only [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Naval Units[\LINK] your King uses are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT]. These are formidable warships that are much stronger than your strongest ship, the [LINK=UNIT_SHIP_OF_THE_LINE]Ship of the Line[\LINK], and they also have four cargo slots to transport the King's soldiers.[NEWLINE]the land army of your King consists of several different units. The majority of his soldiers are [LINK=UNIT_REGULAR]Regulars[\LINK], very strong elite units who can adopt the [LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Musketman[\LINK], the [LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Cavalryman[\LINK] or the [LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoon[\LINK] professions. These have the same abilities as these profession have when adopted by [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Your Soldiers[\LINK], except that they receive the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK] promotions, as well as a 50% bonus when attacking Settlements. However, they do not receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK] form a large part of your King's Army as well. These [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] receive a 50% Settlement attack bonus, and start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] promotions. These units do not receive Defensive Bonuses either.[NEWLINE]The Royal Army also employs a great number of [LINK=UNIT_ARTILLERY]Artillery Regiments[\LINK] These are the strongest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siege Units[COLOR_REVERT] in the game, capable of obliterating even the best defended cities. When they have captured a city, they receive a 50% City Defense Bonus as well, although they do not receive other defensive bonuses. When these monsters attack a city, you do not want to be found inside![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Strengths and Weaknesses[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Your success in the Independence War depends for a great deal on the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Theater of War[COLOR_REVERT]. The Royal Army is on its strongest when on the offensive, and when they attacck a settlement, these is usually little you can do to withstand them. So if you hole up in your colonies and trust in your [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_BASTION]Fortifications[\LINK] to withstand the onslaught, you are likely to be squashed. Instead, if you manage to draw the Royal Army out into the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], you will stand a much better chance of winning battles, as none of the King's units receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] from terrain features such as Hills or Forests. Additionally, while the Royal Army excels at capturing settlements, it has much more problems keeping them, due to the poor Defensive Capabilities of its units.[PARAGRAPH:1]A very large advantage you have is also that the large majority of the War will take place inside your [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK], which means that you can use all the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT], but the Royal Army can't, which gives you a huge advantage in [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobility[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]On the Ocean, it is very unlikely you stand a chance to sink the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Fleet[COLOR_REVERT], as it usually consists of many dozens of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT] with each wave of Royal Attacks. Your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ships of the Line[COLOR_REVERT] are much weaker than these vessels, but if one Ship of the Line can damage a Man-o-War by attacking it, a second one is usually sufficient to sink it. However, due to the sheer [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]number[COLOR_REVERT] of Man-o-Wars you are facing, it would take a ridiculous amount of Ships of the Line to prevent the Royal Army from landing at all. However, for every Man-o-War you sink, you will have to face [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]four land units[COLOR_REVERT] less, so it definitely can pay off to keep a fleet of Ships of the Line ready.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Winning the Independence War[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Win[COLOR_REVERT] the Independence War, you only have to destroy your King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT], you don't have to sink every Man-o-War. At the moment the last unit of the Royal Army is annihilated, and none of your colonies is under Royal control, you have achieved [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Victory[\LINK].
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]WAR OF INDEPENDENCE[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The usual way to achieve [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Victory[\LINK] in a Colonization game is by becoming an Independent nation after winning a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]War Of Independence[COLOR_REVERT] against your mother nation. This War is the climax of the Game, and usually it is the most challenging part, as your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] isn't going to let you off the hook easily![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Declaring Independence[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The Independence War starts on the moment you [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Declare Independence[COLOR_REVERT]. You can declare Independence when the total [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rebel Sentiment[COLOR_REVERT] of all your colonies put together peaks above 50%. For information on how to achieve that, see [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Rebel Sentiment[\LINK].[NEWLINE]When you declare Independence, you can also write your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT]. You can choose a stance on each of five different issues: Slavery, Religion, Land Security, Natives and Elections. Go to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT] section of the Colopedia to see what every option does.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Preparing for the Independence War[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If you boost your Rebel Sentiment, you can declare [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independence[COLOR_REVERT], but to win the Independence War, you need more than a Rebellious Attitude: you need [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Soldiers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]At any given moment, you can visit the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Revolution Advisor[COLOR_REVERT] (F3) to see what awaits you if you declare Independence. On the left, all your own military units are listed, and the amounts of [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Weaponry[\LINK] you have in storage is displayed as well. On the right, you can see the units your King will send once you declare Independence.[NEWLINE] When your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rebel Sentiment[COLOR_REVERT] rises, your King will [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]add units[COLOR_REVERT] to his army. How many units he adds each time depends on your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Potential[COLOR_REVERT], which means your military [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]units[COLOR_REVERT] plus the amounts of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]weapons[COLOR_REVERT] you have in storage. The goods that counted as "weapons" in this instance are [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Blades[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK]. So be careful when producing these: if you produce more than you can equip units with, your King will still increase his Army because of them, which tips the military balance even more in his favor.[NEWLINE]Sometimes the King will add only a single unit to his army, but sometimes, he adds [LINK=UNIT_MAN_O_WAR]Man-o-Wars[\LINK], which also bring four land units with them.[PARAGRAPH:2]Before declaring Independence, you must build up a large army to defeat your King. It is in this phase of the game, that production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns and Cannons[COLOR_REVERT] is vital, as before this phase, you won't have many uses for large amounts of weapons yet, while after this phase, you will be embroiled in a continent-wide [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], which can severely disrupt your ability to mass-produce weapons and military units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The Royal Army Offensives[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Once you declare [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independence[COLOR_REVERT], your King will start prepraing his punitive expeditions. The only [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Naval Units[\LINK] your King uses are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT]. These have the same abilities as these profession have when adopted by [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Your Soldiers[\LINK], except that they receive the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK] promotions, as well as a 50% bonus when attacking Settlements. However, they do not receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK] form a large part of your King's Army as well. These [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] receive a 50% Settlement attack bonus, and start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] promotions. These units do not receive Defensive Bonuses either.[NEWLINE]The Royal Army also employs a great number of [LINK=UNIT_ARTILLERY]Artillery Regiments[\LINK] These are the strongest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siege Units[COLOR_REVERT] in the game, capable of obliterating even the best defended cities. When they have captured a city, they receive a 50% City Defense Bonus as well, although they do not receive other defensive bonuses. When these monsters attack a city, you do not want to be found inside![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Strengths and Weaknesses[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Your success in the Independence War depends for a great deal on the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Theater of War[COLOR_REVERT]. The Royal Army is on its strongest when on the offensive, and when they attacck a settlement, these is usually little you can do to withstand them. So if you hole up in your colonies and trust in your [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_BASTION]Fortifications[\LINK] to withstand the onslaught, you are likely to be squashed. Instead, if you manage to draw the Royal Army out into the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], you will stand a much better chance of winning battles, as none of the King's units receive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] from terrain features such as Hills or Forests. Additionally, while the Royal Army excels at capturing settlements, it has much more problems keeping them, due to the poor Defensive Capabilities of its units.[PARAGRAPH:1]A very large advantage you have is also that the large majority of the War will take place inside your [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK], which means that you can use all the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT], but the Royal Army can't, which gives you a huge advantage in [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Mobility[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]On the Ocean, it is very unlikely you stand a chance to sink the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Fleet[COLOR_REVERT], as it usually consists of many dozens of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Man-o-Wars[COLOR_REVERT] with each wave of Royal Attacks. Your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ships of the Line[COLOR_REVERT] are much weaker than these vessels, but if one Ship of the Line can damage a Man-o-War by attacking it, a second one is usually sufficient to sink it. However, due to the sheer [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]number[COLOR_REVERT] of Man-o-Wars you are facing, it would take a ridiculous amount of Ships of the Line to prevent the Royal Army from landing at all.
