TEXT.English: [H1]WILD ANIMALS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Wild Animals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Wild Animals are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Independent[COLOR_REVERT] units that roam the map. They exist in two classes: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Animals[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sea Animals[COLOR_REVERT]. Though they are comparitively weak, they can prove to be quite a hazard to your weaker [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Units[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2]Wild Animals cannot cross the [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK] of any nation, whether that nation is [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] or [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]European[\LINK]. They can spawn inside your Borders however, but they will be expelled immediately afterwards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Land Animals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]There are several kinds of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Animals[COLOR_REVERT]. Every few turns, Wild Animals will spawn, which can happen in any plot, but each specific kind of Land Animal is bound to a certain [LINK=CONCEPT_NEW_WORLD]Terrain[\LINK] type on which it can spawn. After that, it is not bound to that Terrain type in any way, and may wander to other climates.[NEWLINE]Land Animals have a strength of 1, the same as [LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIST]Colonists[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_TREASURE]Treasures[\LINK]. However, if such a unit is on a plot that grants a Defensive Bonus, like a plot with a [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Jungle[\LINK], your unit will usually survive a Wild Animal attack. Be on your guard though: occasionally more than one Animal may be in the vicinity, and they often attack consecutively, so that the second one destroys your unit after it has been damaged by the first one.[PARAGRAPH:1]For military Land units, the [LINK=PROMOTION_HUNTER1]Wild Animal Hunter[\LINK] promotions are available, which grants an attack bonus against all Wild Animals. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Sea Animals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sea Animals[COLOR_REVERT] spawn in the same manner as Land Animals, though they are not bound to any terrain. Usually they have 3 or 4 movement points and a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Combat Strength[COLOR_REVERT] of 2.[NEWLINE]This presents no problem to your larger [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK], but to smaller ships they can be dangerous. They are as strong as [LINK=UNIT_FISHING_BOAT]Fishing Boats[\LINK], so they have a good chance of sinking those, and when they gang up, they can also bring down [LINK=UNIT_WHALING_BOAT]Whaling Boats[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_CARAVEL]Caravels[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]Wild Animals can be hunted by military units with the specific purpose of gaining [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Experience[COLOR_REVERT] and acquiring [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Promotions[COLOR_REVERT]. The amount of Experience gained by killing animals is very low though, so this is a rather long-winded and tedious way of training an army.[PARAGRAPH:2]Once killed, the remains of a Wild Animals sometimes can be sold for a small sum of gold.
TEXT.French: [H1]ANIMAUX SAUVAGES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Au début d'une partie, des prédateurs errent dans le monde. Ces animaux attaquent les unités qui passent à leur portée. La menace est particulièrement grande pour les unités désarmées comme les ouvriers ou les colons. Les animaux sauvages peuvent être combattus et détruits comme toute autre unité du jeu. Ils n'apparaissent pas ni ne circulent dans les zones délimitées par une [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Frontière nationale[\LINK]. Ils disparaîtront progressivement au fur et à mesure de l'extension des implantations humaines.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.German: [H1]Wilde Tiere[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Wilde Tiere[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Wilde Tiere sind unabhängige Einheiten, die die Karte durchstreifen. Sie gibt sie in zwei Klassen: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Landtiere[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wassertiere[COLOR_REVERT]. Obwohl sie vergleichsweise schwach sind, stellen sie für ungeschützte Einheiten, die die Sicherheit der Kolonien verlassen, eine Gefahr dar.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wilde Tiere können nich die [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Grenzen[\LINK] eines Stadtgebietes überschreiten, sei es ein Ureinwohnerdorf oder eine europäische Kolonie. Gelegentlich entstehen sie jedoch auch innerhalb der Stadtgrenzen, werden aber bereits in der nächsten Runde das Stadtgebiet verlassen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Land Animals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Es gibt mehrere unterschiedliche Arten von Landtieren, die je nach Gelände auftreten bzw. generiert werden. Jede Runde werden auf der Karte einige wenige Tiere generiert. Nach der Generierung kann ein wildes Tiere in beliebiger Richtung die Karte durchstreifen.[NEWLINE]Landtiere sind von der Stärke her ungefähr auf einer Stufe mit [LINK=UNIT_TREASURE]Schätzen[\LINK] und unbewaffneten Siedler. Sodass auch diese Einheiten eine gewisse Chance haben einen Angriff eines Tieres zu überleben. Zu oft sollte man aber dieses Risiko nicht eingehen und solche schwachen und ungeschützten Einheiten den Tieren möglichst ausweichen lassen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Für Militäreinheiten gibt es auch die Beförderung [LINK=PROMOTION_HUNTER1]Wildtierjäger[\LINK], die speziell gegen Tiere die Kampfkraft erhöht.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Wassertiere[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]ähnlich wie die Tiere an Land, gibt es auch Tiere im Meer, die einem kleinen Schiff, wie einem [LINK=UNIT_FISHING_BOAT]Fischerboot[\LINK] gefährlich werden können. Mit etwas Glück gelingt es einem Wal oder einer Kracke vielleicht sogar eine Karavelle zu versenken.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Jagd auf Tiere[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Stärkere Einheiten, wie Scouts oder Ureinwohnersöldner an Land oder Sloops und Fregatten im Wasser können aber auch gezielt Jagd auf Tiere machen. Dies bringt zum einen Erfahrung und lässt die Einheite dadurch über die Zeit stärker werden. Zusätzlich liefern die Ueberreste getöteter Tiere eine kleine Menge an Gold.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]ANIMALI[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In Civilization IV, all'inizio di una partita si possono trovare animali predatori in giro per il mondo. Questi animali attaccano ogni unità che incontrano: i coloni e i lavoratori disarmati corrono dei seri pericoli. Gli animali possono essere affrontati e sconfitti proprio come qualsiasi altra unità di gioco. Gli animali non appaiono o si muovono in zone all'interno dei [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]confini nazionali[\LINK]; gli animali spariranno lentamente mano a mano che il mondo verrà colonizzato.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]ANIMALES[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Al empezar el juego Civilization IV, se pueden encontrar depredadores pululando por el mundo. Estos animales atacarán a cualquier unidad que encuentren; corren especial peligro los colonos y trabajadores que van desarmados. Se puede combatir a los animales y destruirlos como si fueran cualquier otra unidad del juego. Los animales no aparecerán tras la [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]frontera de una nación[\LINK] ni la cruzarán e irán desapareciendo gradualmente a medida que se conquisten más partes del mundo.[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]MILITARY UNITS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you'll want to wage [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], which you presumably do at some point, you will need some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Units[COLOR_REVERT] to do that for you. This game features many different kinds of military units, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Each unit that has the ability to [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Attack[\LINK] other units is considered to be a military unit.[PARAGRAPH:2]This is meant as a short overview of all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available. For Naval Units, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquiring Military Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In term of availability, military units fall in two categories: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE]The difference between these two groups lies in the fact that Core Units can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]produced[COLOR_REVERT] by a player, while Elite Units can only be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]other means[COLOR_REVERT]. As a result of this, in larger wars your army will for the main part consist of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT], because these can be produced in great numbers once your [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Military Industry[\LINK] gathers stamina.[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game (though not all of them are available to Europeans) are: Town Guards, Scouts, Musketmen, Dragoons, Cavalrymen, Cannon Garrisons, Cannon Regiments, Artillery Regiments, Braves, Armed Braves, Mounted Braves and Armed Mounted Braves.[NEWLINE]Note that most of these units are [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Professions[\LINK] that can be given to colonists (or [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]natives[\LINK]), not units in their own right. For each military profession, units will perform better if they are [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Veteran Soldiers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game (all of which can be acquired by you in some way) are: Rangers, Native Mercenaries, Conquistadores, Mounted Conquistadores, Mortars, Continental Guards, Hessians and Settler Militias.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Combat, Experience and Generals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Individual units gain Combat Experience if they win [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Battles[\LINK], and they can achieve [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Promotions[\LINK] this way. If your units gather enough Combat Experience, [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_GENERALS]Great Generals[\LINK] may be born in your colonies, who give your units Combat Bonuses, extra Experience and access to several promotions that are otherwise unreachable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] - These Elite Units can be acquired through multiple means: exploring [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] and they can be offered by your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] as well as a [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Diplomatic Event[\LINK], as long as you are at war with a Native Tribe. The [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] may provide you with some of these units as well, when he urges you to exterminate a particular Native tribe.[NEWLINE]Conquistadores get a +50% bonus against all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Melee Units[COLOR_REVERT] (including other Conquistadores), and a 50% Combat bonus against [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Mercenaries[COLOR_REVERT] as well. As such, they are primarily useful for waging wars against Natives, who employ mainly Melee units. Other European military units are generally too strong for the Conquistador.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_BRAVE]Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] - These melee warriors are only available to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Natives[COLOR_REVERT]. They are relatively weak, but they get attack bonuses when attacking units in [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FOREST]Forests[\LINK] or [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK]. When native tribes are at war, they usually send swarms of countless braves to the lands of their foes.[PARAGRAPH:2][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wild Animals[COLOR_REVERT] are Melee units as well, just like non-military units like [LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIST]Colonists[\LINK], [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK] and [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionaries[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gunpowder Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gunpowder Units[COLOR_REVERT] are infantry units that are equipped with [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Musketmen[\LINK][\BOLD] - Musketmen are your basic Gunpowder units. Any colonist can adopt this profession, as long as there are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns[COLOR_REVERT] present to equip them. They are stronger than most Melee units, with a Combat Strength of 3. They receive Defensive Bonuses, and as such are primarily useful for [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defending Settlements[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guerrilla Warfare[COLOR_REVERT] in the Hills and the Woods.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Rangers[\LINK][\BOLD] - Rangers are Elite Units that are experts in fighting in the Wilderness. They get a Combat Bonus when fighting in Forests and Jungles, both when attacking and defending. On top of that, they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Invisible[COLOR_REVERT] to nearly all enemy units (except Natives), which makes them particularly useful as Commandoes in hostile territory.[NEWLINE]Rangers can be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatic Events[COLOR_REVERT] in which your King offers you to buy these units, and are also provided by certain [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Native Mercenaries[\LINK][\BOLD] - Native Mercenaries are Elite Units that can fight exceptionally well in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], just like Rangers. The difference between these two is that, while Rangers get a solid [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Combat Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] in Forests both on attack and on defense, while Native Mercenaries only get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attack Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] in the Wilderness, although these are much higher than the bonuses the Ranger gets. These Attack Bonuses are equal to the attack bonuses [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE]Natives[\LINK] have.[NEWLINE]Native Mercenaries can be found in places like [LINK=CONCEPT_GOODY_HUT]Burial Grounds[\LINK], they can be offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Tribes[COLOR_REVERT], and they are provided by some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards[\LINK][\BOLD] - these are Elite Units that can be acquired later in the game, as you prepare for [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]Independence[\LINK]. They are offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Foreign Kings[COLOR_REVERT], who might be inclined to make these offers if your [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatic Relations[\LINK] with their colonies is good.[NEWLINE]Continental Guards have a Combat Strength of 3, but you recruit them with four promotions already present: [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Leadership[\LINK]. Additionally, they receive a 50% Combat Bonus against other [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gunpowder Units[COLOR_REVERT]. These units are very strong, and can be essential to the success of your War of Independence.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK][\BOLD] - Hessians are [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]European[\LINK] Elite Units that appear in great numbers in your King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Expeditionary Force[COLOR_REVERT]. You can get a few of these units as well though, through some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] or as reinforcements sent by your King to conquer other colonies.[NEWLINE]Hessians do not receive Defensive Bonuses, but they get a 50% Combat Bonus when [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]attacking Settlements[COLOR_REVERT], as well as the Veteran I and Bayonet promotions.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_SETTLER_MILITIA]Settler Militias[\LINK][\BOLD] - Though Settler Militias are technically Elite Units, as you cannot build them yourself, they are pretty weak for Gunpowder units, having only a Combat Strength of 2. They are generated when a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Colony[COLOR_REVERT] feels unprotected due to a lack of military units, for which they take [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] from their Food Stores and money from your treasury.[NEWLINE]Though Settler Militias are rather weak, they do get a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defense Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] when defending a settlement, which allows them to successfully fight off weaker attacks such as Native Raids.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_BRAVE]Armed Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] - Only Natives can make Armed Braves. These are strong Gunpowder units with a Combat Strength of 3, just like Musketmen, and they also get the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attack Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] of normal Braves when attacking units in the Wilderness. This can make them perticularly tough foes. They only require half as much [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns[COLOR_REVERT] as Musketmen, which means that Natives can equip several Armed Braves once they get their hands on Guns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mounted Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mounted Units[COLOR_REVERT] are units who wage war while sitting on horseback. They are faster than other units, but they do not get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT], which makes them rather weak when not fighting in the open field.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK][\BOLD] - These units require only [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK] to be equipped, and they give a unit 2 [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Movement Speed[\LINK] instead of 1. Scouts do not get any additional bonuses however, so they usually aren't useful in Combat against units stronger than [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Wild Animals[\LINK]. Their main purpose is [LINK=CONCEPT_VISIBILITY]Exploration[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Cavalrymen[\LINK][\BOLD] - Cavalrymen are the strongest Mounted Units you can make. To make them, equip a colonist with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses, Guns and Blades[COLOR_REVERT]. They have a Combat Strength of 4, but they have a movement of only 1, which makes them slower than other Mounted Units. Due to their high combat strength, Cavalrymen can be useful in all kinds of Warfare, whether in the woods, in the fields, attacking settlements or defending them.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_DRAGOON]Dragoons[\LINK][\BOLD] - You can make Dragoons by equipping colonists with both [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK]. They have 2 movement points and a Combat Strength of 3. This makes them weaker than Cavalrymen, but Dragoons automatically get the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leadership[COLOR_REVERT] Promotion, which doubles the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Experience Points[COLOR_REVERT] they earn by winning Battles. So if you want to thoroughly train your soldiers in Combat, letting them fight as Dragoons is an excellent method.[NEWLINE]In addition to this, Dragoons also receive a 50% bonus when attacking [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mortars[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cannon Regiments[COLOR_REVERT] and the King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Artillery Regiments[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Mounted Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] - These are Elite Units that can be obtained when your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]King[COLOR_REVERT] offers them to help in a War against Natives, while some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] provide some as well.[NEWLINE]Mounted Conquistadores have a Combat Strangth of 3, but they get a 50% Bonus against both [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Melee and Mounted Units[COLOR_REVERT]. This makes them particularly successful when fighting against natives, but they can also be useful against the cavalry of other [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Colonial Powers[\LINK] or your King.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Mounted Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] - Once Natives manage to get some Horses, they can equip warriors with Horses to make [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mounted Braves[COLOR_REVERT]. These have a Combat Strength of 2, just like regular Braves, but they are faster. Mounted Braves require only half as much [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] to be equipped as European Cavalry units.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_MOUNTED_BRAVES]Armed Mounted Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] - These are the strongest units Natives can bring in the field. They require both Guns and Horses, though only half the amounts of them that a Dragoon would require. They have a Combat Strength of 3, and combined with their attack bonuses when attacking units in the Wilderness, they can be a plague to colonial invaders in any terrain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Siege Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Siege Units are units that deploy [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK] to wage war against their enemies. Except for the Cannon Garrison, none of them get any [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_CANNON]Cannon Garrisons[\LINK][\BOLD] - Cannon Garrisons are the cheapest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siege Units[COLOR_REVERT] available, and the only one to receive Defensive Bonuses. They only have a Combat Strength of 2, but they also receive a 50% [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Settlement Defense[COLOR_REVERT] bonus. This makes them able defenders of your settlements, though offensive Siege Units like Cannon Regiments will usually be stronger.[NEWLINE]Cannon Garrisons can be recruited in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT], where they are the cheapest units available, and they can also be produced in Settlements with an [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]Armory[\LINK] or one of its upgrades.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CANNON]Cannon Regiments[\LINK][\BOLD] - Cannon Regiments are your primary units when it comes to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attacking Settlements[COLOR_REVERT]. They have a Combat Strength of 3, but they get an additional 70% bonus when attacking a settlement. In addition to this, they can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombard[COLOR_REVERT] the Defenses of enemy settlements to weaken them, before moving in for the kill.[NEWLINE]Cannon Regiments can be recruited in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT], and they can also be built in Settlements with a [LINK=BUILDING_MAGAZINE]Magazine[\LINK] or one of its upgrades.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mortars[\LINK][\BOLD] - Mortars are Elite Units that can be offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Foreign Kings[COLOR_REVERT] if you have good relations with their colonies, just like [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Continental Guards[COLOR_REVERT]. When attacking settlements, they are even stronger than Cannon Regiments, because they start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_BOMBI]Explosives I[\LINK] promotion, but they truly excel in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombarding[COLOR_REVERT] the Fortifications of enemy settlements, reducing their Defensive Bonuses by 20% each turn.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_ARTILLERY]Artillery Regiments[\LINK][\BOLD] - Artillery Regiments are deployed by your King during your War of Independence. They are exceptionally strong Siege Units, sporting a basic Combat Strength of 4, and receiving a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]150% Attack Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] on top of that when attacking Settlements. They can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombard[COLOR_REVERT] Settlement Defenses slightly better than Cannon Regiments.[NEWLINE]Artillery Regiments are the best units the King has when it comes to defending the colonies he took from you, as they receive a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]50% Settlement Defense[COLOR_REVERT] bonus. Like other Siege Units, they do not receive other Defensive Bonuses.[NEWLINE]Artillery Regiments can be obtained by Colonial Powers as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]reinforcements[COLOR_REVERT] to wage wars against other colonial powers.
TEXT.French: [H1]MILITARY UNITS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you'll want to wage [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], which you presumably do at some point, you will need some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Units[COLOR_REVERT] to do that for you. This game features many different kinds of military units, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Each unit that has the ability to [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Attack[\LINK] other units is considered to be a military unit.[PARAGRAPH:2]This is meant as a short overview of all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available. For Naval Units, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquiring Military Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In term of availability, military units fall in two categories: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE]The difference between these two groups lies in the fact that Core Units can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]produced[COLOR_REVERT] by a player, while Elite Units can only be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]other means[COLOR_REVERT]. As a result of this, in larger wars your army will for the main part consist of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT], because these can be produced in great numbers once your [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Military Industry[\LINK] gathers stamina.[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game (though not all of them are available to Europeans) are: Town Guards, Scouts, Musketmen, Dragoons, Cavalrymen, Cannon Garrisons, Cannon Regiments, Artillery Regiments, Braves, Armed Braves, Mounted Braves and Armed Mounted Braves.[NEWLINE]Note that most of these units are [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Professions[\LINK] that can be given to colonists (or [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]natives[\LINK]), not units in their own right. For each military profession, units will perform better if they are [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Veteran Soldiers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game (all of which can be acquired by you in some way) are: Rangers, Native Mercenaries, Conquistadores, Mounted Conquistadores, Mortars, Continental Guards, Hessians and Settler Militias.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Combat, Experience and Generals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Individual units gain Combat Experience if they win [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Battles[\LINK], and they can achieve [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Promotions[\LINK] this way. If your units gather enough Combat Experience, [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_GENERALS]Great Generals[\LINK] may be born in your colonies, who give your units Combat Bonuses, extra Experience and access to several promotions that are otherwise unreachable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] - These Elite Units can be acquired through multiple means: exploring [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] and they can be offered by your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] as well as a [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Diplomatic Event[\LINK], as long as you are at war with a Native Tribe. The [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] may provide you with some of these units as well, when he urges you to exterminate a particular Native tribe.[NEWLINE]Conquistadores get a +50% bonus against all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Melee Units[COLOR_REVERT] (including other Conquistadores), and a 50% Combat bonus against [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Mercenaries[COLOR_REVERT] as well. As such, they are primarily useful for waging wars against Natives, who employ mainly Melee units. Other European military units are generally too strong for the Conquistador.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_BRAVE]Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] - These melee warriors are only available to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Natives[COLOR_REVERT]. They are relatively weak, but they get attack bonuses when attacking units in [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FOREST]Forests[\LINK] or [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK]. When native tribes are at war, they usually send swarms of countless braves to the lands of their foes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gunpowder Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gunpowder Units[COLOR_REVERT] are infantry units that are equipped with [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Musketmen[\LINK][\BOLD] - Musketmen are your basic Gunpowder units. They can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombard[COLOR_REVERT] Settlement Defenses slightly better than Cannon Regiments.[NEWLINE]Artillery Regiments are the best units the King has when it comes to defending the colonies he took from you, as they receive a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]50% Settlement Defense[COLOR_REVERT] bonus. Like other Siege Units, they do not receive other Defensive Bonuses.[NEWLINE]Artillery Regiments can be obtained by Colonial Powers as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]reinforcements[COLOR_REVERT] to wage wars against other colonial powers.
TEXT.German: [H1]Militäreinheiten[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Wenn man [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Krieg[\LINK] führen will oder seine eigenen Siedlungen zu verteidigen, was irgendwann sicherlich der Fall ist, braucht man [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Militäreinheiten[COLOR_REVERT] um die Kämpfe auszutragen. Davon gibt es im Spiel eine beachtliche Zahl, mit unterschiedlichen Stärken und Schwächen. Jede Einheit die grundsätzlich die Fähigkeit zum [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Angriff[\LINK] hat, wird im weitesten Sinne als Militäreinheit betrachtet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Dieser Eintrag ist als kurzer überblick zu den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Landeinheiten[COLOR_REVERT] gedacht. Für Schiffe lassen sich weitere Informationen im Eintrag [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Schiffe[\LINK] finden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Erhalt von Militäreinheiten[\BOLD]In Bezug auf die Verfügbarkeit lassen sich die Truppen zunächst in zwei Kategorien unterteilen: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Haupttruppen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elitetruppen[COLOR_REVERT].Der Hauptunterschied ist der, dass die Haupttruppen durch grundlegende Mechanismen wie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kauf[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rekrutierung[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ausrüstung[COLOR_REVERT] oder auch [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Produktion (z.B. bei Artillerie) [COLOR_REVERT] erlangt werden können, während Elitetruppen meist nur durch [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]spezielle Ereignisse[COLOR_REVERT] erhalten werden können (z.B. Events mit dem eigenen König oder anderen Staatsoberhäuptern). Dadurch besteht der überwiegende Teil der Armee des Spielers aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Haupttruppen[COLOR_REVERT] und nur ein kleiner Teil aus [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elitetruppen[COLOR_REVERT], wodurch diese noch wertvoller sind und immer auch besondere Fähigkeiten haben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Beispiele für [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Haupttruppen[COLOR_REVERT] des Spielers sind: Scouts, Kolonialmiliz, Linieninfanterie, Dragoner, Kavallerie sowie leichte und schwere Artillerie. Es ist hier auffällig, dass es sich meist um [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Militärberufe[\LINK] handelt. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Jeder dieser Militärberufe hat eine eigene Einheit (im Grunde handelt es sich hierbei um Veteranen), die ihre jeweiligen Berufe am effektivsten beherrschen. Dazu gehören der erfahrene [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Scout[\LINK], der erfahrene [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Milizionär[\LINK], der erfahrene [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_DRAGOON]Dragoner[\LINK] und der erfahrene [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_CAVALRY]Kavallerist[\LINK]. Die [LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Artillerieeinheiten[\LINK] sind Einheiten und keine Berufe. Diese können daher in der Kolonie unter bestimmten Voraussetzungen produziert oder in Europa erworben werden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elitetrupen[COLOR_REVERT] sind: [LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Ranger[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Ureinwohnersöldner[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Berittene Conquistadores[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mörser[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessische Söldner[\LINK] und [LINK=UNIT_MILITIA]Siedler Milizen[\LINK]. Eine Sonderstellung nimmt die Linieninfanterie ein. Die [LINK=UNIT_EUROPEAN_LINE_INFANTRY]Europäische Linieninfanterie [\LINK]zählt zu den Elitetruppen, welche nur in Europa erworben werden kann, während die koloniale [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_LINE_INFANTRY]Linieninfanterie [\LINK]ein militärischer Beruf der Haupttruppen in der neuen Welt ist, die jedoch nur in den Kolonien ausgerüstet und nicht in Europa erworben werden kann. Natürlich kann man einige Einheiten relativ häufig erhalten, während andere sehr selten sind. Meist erhält man die Eiliteeinheiten durch besondere [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Events[\LINK] oder Interaktion mit dem eigenen König oder anderen Staatsoberhäuptern oder indianischen Stammesführern, solange man sich mit diesen nicht im Krieg befindet. Meist sind sie alle sehr stark spezialisiert. Die [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Kirche[\LINK] gewährt bisweilen ebenfalls Truppen, wenn man dafür gegen indianische Ureinwohner in den Krieg zieht. Zudem erhält man auch durch einige [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Gründerväter[\LINK] Truppen, wenn sich diese den eigenen Kolonien anschließen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE[BOLD]Kampf, Erfahrung und Generäle[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Einheiten erhalten durch [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Kampf[\LINK] Erfahrung, und können dadurch auch [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Beförderungen[\LINK] erhalten. Wenn die gesamte Summe der von Einheiten gesammelten Erfahrung gewisse Schwellenwerte übersteigt, entstehen [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_GENERALS]Grosse Generäle[\LINK] in den Kolonien. Diese geben den Einheiten denen sie sich anschliessen zusätzliche Kampfboni, weitere Erfahrungspunkte und Zugang zu besonderen Beförderungen. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Die Militär-Einheiten im Einzelnen[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK][\BOLD] - Scouts zählen nur im weitesten Sinne zu den militärischen Einheiten. Sie haben eine gewisse Stärke, damit sie bei ihren Erkundungsritten durch die Wildnis gegen wilde Tiere und andere Gefahren bestehen können. Sie benötigen [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Pferde[\LINK]. Sie sollten jedoch nicht im Kampf eingesetzt werden, sondern eignen sich am besten zur Erkundung der neuen Welt, allenfalls können sie zur Verteidigung der eigenen Kolonie eingesetzt werden, wenn sich dort keine anderen Militäreinheiten aufhalten. Berittene Scouts haben den Vorteil der Geschwindigkeit, da ihnen zusätzliche Bewegungspunkte zustehen, die durch Beförderungen nochmals erhöht werden können. Nach der Erkundung der neuen Welt eigenen sie sich hervorragend als Dragoner oder Kavalleristen, weil sie dann eine ganz erhebliche Anzahl an [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Beförderungen [\LINK]eingesammelt haben dürften.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] und [LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Berittene Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] - Conquistadores sind Militäreinheiten, die sich für eine frühe Eroberung der neuen Welt eignen. Es handelt sich um wenig disziplinierte und meist schlecht ausgebildete Truppen. Sie können gegen wilde Tiere und Krieger der Indianerstämme bestehen, gegen europäische Truppen sind sie jedoch nur bedingt einsetzbar - allenfalls wenn sie durch entsprechende Beförderungen Stärke und Erfahrung und Kampfboni gewonnen haben, sollte man sie gegen die stärkeren europäischen Truppen einsetzen. Ab und zu stößt man auf Conquistadores, wenn man [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]antike Ruinen[\LINK] durchstöbert. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Ranger[\LINK][\BOLD] - Ranger sind seltene Eliteeinheiten, die man nur durch diplomatische Interaktion mit dem König oder durch einige wenige Gründerväter erhält. Von Zeit zu Zeit fragen die Kolonisten nach militärischer Unterstützung (durch ein Event). Der König wird dann gegen entsprechende Bezahlung Ranger anbieten. Ranger haben besondere Vorteile außerhalb der Kolonie. Aufklärung und der Kampf gegen Indianer sind ihre Aufgaben. Sie sind bestens an die Wildnis gewöhnt, so dass sie auch vor anderen Truppen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]verborgen[COLOR_REVERT] bleiben. Nur andere indianische Kriege, Ranger und indianische Söldner können sie sehen. Mit den entsprechenden Beförderungen können sie natürlich auch die eigene Kolonie verteidigen, hierfür wird ihr Talent aber eigentlich verschwendet. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Indianische Söldner[\LINK][\BOLD] - Diese Einheit entspricht im Wesentlichen den Rangern, lediglich die Angriffs- und Verteidigungsboni unterscheiden sich ein wenig. Indianische Truppen erhalten höhere Angriffsboni in der Wildnis und gegen andere Indianer, wohingegen Ranger auch Defensivboni erhalten, die aber nicht ganz so hoch sind. Durch Beförderungen lässt sich dies ausgleichen. Die indianischen Söldner haben den Vorteil, dass sie häufiger zu erwerben sind. Befreundete Stämme bieten von Zeit zu Zeit diese Einheit zum Kauf an und auch in antiken Ruinen stößt man ab und zu auf sie. Sie eignen sich ebenfalls ganz besonders zur Aufklärung und Erkundung. Gegen europäische Truppen sind sie - wie auch die Ranger - aber etwas zu schwach. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MILITIA]Siedlermilizen[\LINK][\BOLD] - Die Siedlermiliz ist ein schwache Verteidigungseinheit der Kolonien. Sie können weder in Europa erworben noch in den Kolonien ausgerüstet werden. Sie entstehen, wenn der Gouverneur sie zu den Waffen ruft, d.h. im Spiel [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]entstehen[COLOR_REVERT] sie, wenn sich eine Kolonie - ab einer bestimmten Größe von Siedlern - ohne militärischen Schutz [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]unsicher[COLOR_REVERT] fühlt und keine anderen Militäreinheiten in der Kolonie vorhanden sind, die den Schutz gewährleisten kann. Die Chance liegt allerdings nicht bei 100% und da auch eine Miliz Geld kostet, benötigt der Spieler eine gewisse Summe [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Geld[COLOR_REVERT], ansonsten gibt es für einige Runden Aufruhr in der Kolonie (Produktion von Waren wird eingestellt) und es wird keine Miliz rekrutiert. Die Miliz erhält einen starken Verteidigungsbonus, solange sie sich innerhalb der eigenen Koloniegrenzen aufhält, sie sollte daher unbedingt nur als Verteidigungseinheit eingesetzt werden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_COLONIAL_MILITIA]Kolonialmiliz[\LINK][\BOLD] - Die Kolonialmiliz ist die schwächste, zugleich aber auch kostengünstigste richtige Truppengattung. Es handelt sich um ausgebildete Infanterietruppen, die sich sowohl für den Angriff auch andere Kolonien oder Indianerstämme eignen, als auch zur Verteidigung der eigenen Kolonien. Sie ist DIE Basiseinheit der kolonialen Truppen. In der Wildnis sind sie indianischen Kriegern unter Umständen unterlegen, ein Angriff führt daher nicht immer zum Sieg. Durch Beförderungen lassen sich diese Nachteile allerdings mit der Zeit ausgleichen. Es handelt sich hierbei um einen militärischen Beruf, den fast alle Kolonisten ergreifen können. Hierfür ist nur eine gewisse Anzahl von [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS] Feuerwaffen[\LINK] in der Kolonie erforderlich. Kolonialmilizen können außerdem bereits in Europa angeworben werden. Entweder man wirbt gleich den [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]erfahrenen Milizionär[\LINK] an oder stattet einen Siedler am Kai mit den entsprechenden Waffen aus. Hierfür benötigt es allerdings etwas Kleingeld. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_LINE_INFANTRY]Linieninfantrie[\LINK][\BOLD] - Die koloniale Linieninfanterie ist die kampfstärkste Infanterieeinheit der Kolonien. Sie eignet sich besonders für den Angriff. Die koloniale Linieninfanterie kann in den Kolonien angeworben und ausgerüstet werden, wenn entsprechende Waffen, d.h. [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Feuerwaffen[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Klingenwaffen[\LINK] in der Kolonie vorhanden sind. Sie kann nicht in Europa angeworben werden. Hierfür kann man allerdings alternativ die [LINK=UNIT_EUROPEAN_LINE_INFANTRY]europäische Linieninfanterie[\LINK] anwerben. Sie entspricht von Stärke und Ausrüstung der kolonialen Variante, ist aber eine Einheit und kein Beruf. Die koloniale Linieninfanterie, bei der es sich um einen Beruf handelt, kann durch entsprechende Erfahrung im Kampf zur erfahrenen Linieninfanterie werden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_DRAGOON]Dragoner[\LINK][\BOLD] - Die Dragoner sind im Wesentlichen berittene Infanterie. Sie haben daher auch dieselbe Kampfstärke. Sie bewegen sich zu Pferd und kämpfen zu Fuß. Ihr Vorteil ist die Schnelligkeit. In den riesigen Kolonien lassen sie sich daher schnell von A nach B verlegen und bieten so mehreren Kolonien gleichzeitig Schutz gegen Feinde aller Art. Außerdem erhalten Sie Angriffsboni beim Angriff auf feindliche Artillerieeinheiten. In Wäldern oder im Gebirge haben sie allerdings Nachteile. Ihren Vorteil im Kampf spielen sie im offenen Gelände aus. Es handelt sich hierbei um einen Militärberuf, den fast alle Kolonisten ergreifen können. Dragoner können sowohl in Europa angeworben, als auch in den Kolonien ausgerüstet werden. Hierfür sind jedoch [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Musketen[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Pferde[\LINK] erforderlich. Durch Kampferfahrung stehen den Dragonern eine ganze Reihe von Beförderungen zur Verfügung. Dragoner sind unter Berücksichtigung von Kosten und Nutzen eine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]sehr effektive militärische Einheit[COLOR_REVERT], die sich gut zur Ausbildung von Truppen eignet. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Kavallerie[\LINK][\BOLD] - Die Kavallerie ist eine schwere Kampfeinheit. Sie ähnelt den Dragonern, ist dafür kampfstärker, aber nicht so schnell unterwegs. Kavalleristen kämpfen zu Pferd. Einer solchen Kavallerieattacke hält nur wenig stand. Sie eignet sich daher besonders im Angriff gegen feindliche Infanterie und Artillerie im offenen Gelände oder zur Verteidigung der eigenen Kolonien. Wie die Dragoner auch hat die Kavallerie in den Wäldern oder im Gebirge allerdings Nachteile im Kampf. Es handelt sich ebenfalls um einen Militärberuf, der von fast allen Kolonisten ergriffen werden kann - die Ausrüstung ist sowohl in den Kolonien als auch in Europa möglich. Die Ausrüstung ist allerdings recht teuer. Es werden [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Klingenwaffen[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Pferde[\LINK] benötigt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Kontinentalgarde [\LINK][\BOLD]und [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessische Söldner[\LINK][\BOLD] - Diese beiden Elitetruppen sind im Spiel nur sehr selten anzutreffen. Es handelt sich um starke und erfahrene Infanterieeinheiten (keine Berufe), die man nur durch diplomatische Ereignisse oder Gründerväter erhalten kann. Sie starten mit starken Kampfboni. Die hessischen Söldner können zudem nur durch den König zur Verfügung gestellt werden - und zwar auch nur dann, wenn dieser einen zum Krieg gegen einen europäischen Nachbarn in der neuen Welt auffordert. Die Einheiten sind an Stärke mit den königlichen Truppen vergleichbar, so dass sie die Kerntruppe im Kampf um die [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]Unabhängigkeit[\LINK] bilden können und daher nicht sinnlos geopfert werden sollten.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Leichte Artillerie [\LINK][\BOLD] und [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HEAVY_ARTILLERY_VETERAN]Schwere Artillerie[\LINK][\BOLD] - Diese beiden Einheiten bilden die artilleristische Basis in den Kolonien. Während die Leichte Artillerie sich besonders zur Verteidigung der eigenen Kolonien eignet und gute Verteidigungsboni erhält, eignet sich die Schwere Artillerie besonders zum Angriff auf feindliche Forts und Kolonien. Durch die Fähigkeit, feindliche Verteidigung durch Bombardierung niederzukämpfen, eignet sich die Schwere Artillerie besonders dazu, der angreifenden Infanterie und Kavallerie den Weg zu ebnen. Gegen berittene Truppen im offenen Gelände ist die Artillerie sehr verwundbar, so dass sie immer durch Infanterie, Kavallerie oder andere Eliteeinheiten geschützt werden sollte. Leichte und schwere Artillerie können in Europa gegen Entgelt angeworben oder in den Kolonien ausgerüstet und hergestellt werden. Es handelt sich aber nicht um Berufe, so dass hierfür kein Siedler erforderlich ist. Die Produktion dauert allerdings eine Weile. Es hierfür besondere [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]Gebäude[\LINK] erforderlich sowie eine stattliche Anzahl von [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Kanonen[\LINK]. Neben der Leichten und Schweren Artillerie gibt es noch eine weitere sehr starke Artillerieeinheit, den [BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mörser[\LINK][\BOLD]. - Mörser eignen sich besonders zur Bekämpfung feindlicher Verteidigungsanlagen, sind im Gelände aber genauso schwach wie andere Artillerieeinheiten und benötigen daher immer den Schutz anderer Militäreinheiten. Sie können in Europa nicht erworben und auch nicht in den Kolonien hergestellt werden. Sie werden einzig und allein durch diplomatische Beziehungen mit anderen europäischen Nationen erworben. Diese kommen nur selten vor, so dass die Einheiten sehr selten und daher besonders schützenswert sind.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Indianische Krieger[\BOLD] - Die Ureinwohner in der neuen Welt können auf die vorgenannten militärischen Einheiten selbstverständlich nicht zurückgreifen. Ihnen stehen naturgemäß ihre [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_BRAVE]Krieger [\LINK][\BOLD]und [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Berittenen Krieger[\LINK][\BOLD] zur Verfügung. Diese haben Vorteile im Gelände außerhalb der europäischen Kolonien, sind insgesamt aber schwächer als die regulären Truppen der Europäer. Ihren Vorteil haben die Ureinwohner daher in der Anzahl. Gerade zu Beginn der Besiedlung in der Neuen Welt sollten die Europäischen Nationen sich besser zunächst nicht auf einen Krieg einlassen, wenn man noch wenig eigene Truppen besitzt. Die Ureinwohner versuchen von den Europäern Feuerwaffen zu erwerben oder sie stehlen diese bei überfällen. Damit können sie [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_BRAVES]bewaffnete Krieger[\LINK][\BOLD] ausrüsten oder [BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_MOUNTED_BRAVES]Berittene Bewaffnete Krieger[\LINK][\BOLD], die stärkste Kampfeinheit der Ureinwohner, sofern Sie dazu ebenfalls Pferde zur Verfügung haben.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]MILITARY UNITS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you'll want to wage [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], which you presumably do at some point, you will need some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Units[COLOR_REVERT] to do that for you. This game features many different kinds of military units, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Each unit that has the ability to [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Attack[\LINK] other units is considered to be a military unit.[PARAGRAPH:2]This is meant as a short overview of all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available. For Naval Units, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquiring Military Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In term of availability, military units fall in two categories: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE]The difference between these two groups lies in the fact that Core Units can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]produced[COLOR_REVERT] by a player, while Elite Units can only be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]other means[COLOR_REVERT]. As a result of this, in larger wars your army will for the main part consist of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT], because these can be produced in great numbers once your [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Military Industry[\LINK] gathers stamina.[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game (though not all of them are available to Europeans) are: Town Guards, Scouts, Musketmen, Dragoons, Cavalrymen, Cannon Garrisons, Cannon Regiments, Artillery Regiments, Braves, Armed Braves, Mounted Braves and Armed Mounted Braves.[NEWLINE]Note that most of these units are [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Professions[\LINK] that can be given to colonists (or [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]natives[\LINK]), not units in their own right. For each military profession, units will perform better if they are [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Veteran Soldiers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game (all of which can be acquired by you in some way) are: Rangers, Native Mercenaries, Conquistadores, Mounted Conquistadores, Mortars, Continental Guards, Hessians and Settler Militias.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Combat, Experience and Generals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Individual units gain Combat Experience if they win [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Battles[\LINK], and they can achieve [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Promotions[\LINK] this way. If your units gather enough Combat Experience, [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_GENERALS]Great Generals[\LINK] may be born in your colonies, who give your units Combat Bonuses, extra Experience and access to several promotions that are otherwise unreachable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] - These Elite Units can be acquired through multiple means: exploring [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] and they can be offered by your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] as well as a [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Diplomatic Event[\LINK], as long as you are at war with a Native Tribe. The [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] may provide you with some of these units as well, when he urges you to exterminate a particular Native tribe.[NEWLINE]Conquistadores get a +50% bonus against all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Melee Units[COLOR_REVERT] (including other Conquistadores), and a 50% Combat bonus against [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Mercenaries[COLOR_REVERT] as well. As such, they are primarily useful for waging wars against Natives, who employ mainly Melee units. Other European military units are generally too strong for the Conquistador.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_BRAVE]Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] - These melee warriors are only available to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Natives[COLOR_REVERT]. They are relatively weak, but they get attack bonuses when attacking units in [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FOREST]Forests[\LINK] or [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK]. When native tribes are at war, they usually send swarms of countless braves to the lands of their foes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gunpowder Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gunpowder Units[COLOR_REVERT] are infantry units that are equipped with [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Musketmen[\LINK][\BOLD] - Musketmen are your basic Gunpowder units. Any colonist can adopt this profession, as long as there are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns[COLOR_REVERT] present to equip them. They are stronger than most Melee units, with a Combat Strength of 3. They receive Defensive Bonuses, and as such are primarily useful for [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defending Settlements[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guerrilla Warfare[COLOR_REVERT] in the Hills and the Woods.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Rangers[\LINK][\BOLD] - Rangers are Elite Units that are experts in fighting in the Wilderness. They get a Combat Bonus when fighting in Forests and Jungles, both when attacking and defending. On top of that, they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Invisible[COLOR_REVERT] to nearly all enemy units (except Natives), which makes them particularly useful as Commandoes in hostile territory.[NEWLINE]Rangers can be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatic Events[COLOR_REVERT] in which your King offers you to buy these units, and are also provided by certain [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Native Mercenaries[\LINK][\BOLD] - Native Mercenaries are Elite Units that can fight exceptionally well in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], just like Rangers. The difference between these two is that, while Rangers get a solid [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Combat Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] in Forests both on attack and on defense, while Native Mercenaries only get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attack Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] in the Wilderness, although these are much higher than the bonuses the Ranger gets. These Attack Bonuses are equal to the attack bonuses [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE]Natives[\LINK] have.[NEWLINE]Native Mercenaries can be found in places like [LINK=CONCEPT_GOODY_HUT]Burial Grounds[\LINK], they can be offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Tribes[COLOR_REVERT], and they are provided by some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONTINENTAL_GUARD]Continental Guards[\LINK][\BOLD] - these are Elite Units that can be acquired later in the game, as you prepare for [LINK=CONCEPT_INDEPENDENCE_WAR]Independence[\LINK]. They are offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Foreign Kings[COLOR_REVERT], who might be inclined to make these offers if your [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatic Relations[\LINK] with their colonies is good.[NEWLINE]Continental Guards have a Combat Strength of 3, but you recruit them with four promotions already present: [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN1]Veteran I[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_VETERAN2]Veteran II[\LINK], [LINK=PROMOTION_BAYONET]Bayonet[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_LEADERSHIP]Leadership[\LINK]. Additionally, they receive a 50% Combat Bonus against other [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gunpowder Units[COLOR_REVERT]. These units are very strong, and can be essential to the success of your War of Independence.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_HESSIAN]Hessians[\LINK][\BOLD] - Hessians are [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]European[\LINK] Elite Units that appear in great numbers in your King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Royal Expeditionary Force[COLOR_REVERT]. You can get a few of these units as well though, through some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] or as reinforcements sent by your King to conquer other colonies.[NEWLINE]Hessians do not receive Defensive Bonuses, but they get a 50% Combat Bonus when [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]attacking Settlements[COLOR_REVERT], as well as the Veteran I and Bayonet promotions.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_SETTLER_MILITIA]Settler Militias[\LINK][\BOLD] - Though Settler Militias are technically Elite Units, as you cannot build them yourself, they are pretty weak for Gunpowder units, having only a Combat Strength of 2. They are generated when a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Colony[COLOR_REVERT] feels unprotected due to a lack of military units, for which they take [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] from their Food Stores and money from your treasury.[NEWLINE]Though Settler Militias are rather weak, they do get a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defense Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] when defending a settlement, which allows them to successfully fight off weaker attacks such as Native Raids.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_BRAVE]Armed Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] - Only Natives can make Armed Braves. These are strong Gunpowder units with a Combat Strength of 3, just like Musketmen, and they also get the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attack Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] of normal Braves when attacking units in the Wilderness. This can make them perticularly tough foes. They only require half as much [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns[COLOR_REVERT] as Musketmen, which means that Natives can equip several Armed Braves once they get their hands on Guns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mounted Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mounted Units[COLOR_REVERT] are units who wage war while sitting on horseback. They are faster than other units, but they do not get [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT], which makes them rather weak when not fighting in the open field.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_SCOUT]Scouts[\LINK][\BOLD] - These units require only [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK] to be equipped, and they give a unit 2 [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Movement Speed[\LINK] instead of 1. Scouts do not get any additional bonuses however, so they usually aren't useful in Combat against units stronger than [LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Wild Animals[\LINK]. Their main purpose is [LINK=CONCEPT_VISIBILITY]Exploration[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_HEAVY_CAVALRY]Cavalrymen[\LINK][\BOLD] - Cavalrymen are the strongest Mounted Units you can make. To make them, equip a colonist with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses, Guns and Blades[COLOR_REVERT]. They have a Combat Strength of 4, but they have a movement of only 1, which makes them slower than other Mounted Units. Due to their high combat strength, Cavalrymen can be useful in all kinds of Warfare, whether in the woods, in the fields, attacking settlements or defending them.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_DRAGOON]Dragoons[\LINK][\BOLD] - You can make Dragoons by equipping colonists with both [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK]. They have 2 movement points and a Combat Strength of 3. This makes them weaker than Cavalrymen, but Dragoons automatically get the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leadership[COLOR_REVERT] Promotion, which doubles the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Experience Points[COLOR_REVERT] they earn by winning Battles. So if you want to thoroughly train your soldiers in Combat, letting them fight as Dragoons is an excellent method.[NEWLINE]In addition to this, Dragoons also receive a 50% bonus when attacking [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mortars[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cannon Regiments[COLOR_REVERT] and the King's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Artillery Regiments[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MOUNTED_CONQUISTADOR]Mounted Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] - These are Elite Units that can be obtained when your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]King[COLOR_REVERT] offers them to help in a War against Natives, while some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT] provide some as well.[NEWLINE]Mounted Conquistadores have a Combat Strangth of 3, but they get a 50% Bonus against both [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Melee and Mounted Units[COLOR_REVERT]. This makes them particularly successful when fighting against natives, but they can also be useful against the cavalry of other [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Colonial Powers[\LINK] or your King.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_MOUNTED_BRAVE]Mounted Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] - Once Natives manage to get some Horses, they can equip warriors with Horses to make [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mounted Braves[COLOR_REVERT]. These have a Combat Strength of 2, just like regular Braves, but they are faster. Mounted Braves require only half as much [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] to be equipped as European Cavalry units.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_ARMED_MOUNTED_BRAVES]Armed Mounted Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] - These are the strongest units Natives can bring in the field. They require both Guns and Horses, though only half the amounts of them that a Dragoon would require. They have a Combat Strength of 3, and combined with their attack bonuses when attacking units in the Wilderness, they can be a plague to colonial invaders in any terrain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Siege Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Siege Units are units that deploy [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK] to wage war against their enemies. Except for the Cannon Garrison, none of them get any [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_LIGHT_CANNON]Cannon Garrisons[\LINK][\BOLD] - Cannon Garrisons are the cheapest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Siege Units[COLOR_REVERT] available, and the only one to receive Defensive Bonuses. They only have a Combat Strength of 2, but they also receive a 50% [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Settlement Defense[COLOR_REVERT] bonus. This makes them able defenders of your settlements, though offensive Siege Units like Cannon Regiments will usually be stronger.[NEWLINE]Cannon Garrisons can be recruited in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT], where they are the cheapest units available, and they can also be produced in Settlements with an [LINK=BUILDING_ARMORY]Armory[\LINK] or one of its upgrades.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CANNON]Cannon Regiments[\LINK][\BOLD] - Cannon Regiments are your primary units when it comes to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Attacking Settlements[COLOR_REVERT]. They have a Combat Strength of 3, but they get an additional 70% bonus when attacking a settlement. In addition to this, they can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombard[COLOR_REVERT] the Defenses of enemy settlements to weaken them, before moving in for the kill.[NEWLINE]Cannon Regiments can be recruited in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Europe[COLOR_REVERT], and they can also be built in Settlements with a [LINK=BUILDING_MAGAZINE]Magazine[\LINK] or one of its upgrades.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_MORTAR]Mortars[\LINK][\BOLD] - Mortars are Elite Units that can be offered to you by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Foreign Kings[COLOR_REVERT] if you have good relations with their colonies, just like [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Continental Guards[COLOR_REVERT]. When attacking settlements, they are even stronger than Cannon Regiments, because they start with the [LINK=PROMOTION_BOMBI]Explosives I[\LINK] promotion, but they truly excel in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombarding[COLOR_REVERT] the Fortifications of enemy settlements, reducing their Defensive Bonuses by 20% each turn.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_ARTILLERY]Artillery Regiments[\LINK][\BOLD] - Artillery Regiments are deployed by your King during your War of Independence. They are exceptionally strong Siege Units, sporting a basic Combat Strength of 4, and receiving a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]150% Attack Bonus[COLOR_REVERT] on top of that when attacking Settlements. They can also [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombard[COLOR_REVERT] Settlement Defenses slightly better than Cannon Regiments.[NEWLINE]Artillery Regiments are the best units the King has when it comes to defending the colonies he took from you, as they receive a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]50% Settlement Defense[COLOR_REVERT] bonus. Like other Siege Units, they do not receive other Defensive Bonuses.[NEWLINE]Artillery Regiments can be obtained by Colonial Powers as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]reinforcements[COLOR_REVERT] to wage wars against other colonial powers.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]MILITARY UNITS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you'll want to wage [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], which you presumably do at some point, you will need some [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Military Units[COLOR_REVERT] to do that for you. This game features many different kinds of military units, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Each unit that has the ability to [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Attack[\LINK] other units is considered to be a military unit.[PARAGRAPH:2]This is meant as a short overview of all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Land Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available. For Naval Units, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquiring Military Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In term of availability, military units fall in two categories: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE]The difference between these two groups lies in the fact that Core Units can be [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]produced[COLOR_REVERT] by a player, while Elite Units can only be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]other means[COLOR_REVERT]. As a result of this, in larger wars your army will for the main part consist of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT], because these can be produced in great numbers once your [LINK=CONCEPT_GUNS]Military Industry[\LINK] gathers stamina.[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Core Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game (though not all of them are available to Europeans) are: Town Guards, Scouts, Musketmen, Dragoons, Cavalrymen, Cannon Garrisons, Cannon Regiments, Artillery Regiments, Braves, Armed Braves, Mounted Braves and Armed Mounted Braves.[NEWLINE]Note that most of these units are [LINK=CONCEPT_PROFESSIONS]Professions[\LINK] that can be given to colonists (or [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]natives[\LINK]), not units in their own right. For each military profession, units will perform better if they are [LINK=UNIT_VETERAN_INFANTRY]Veteran Soldiers[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are available in this game (all of which can be acquired by you in some way) are: Rangers, Native Mercenaries, Conquistadores, Mounted Conquistadores, Mortars, Continental Guards, Hessians and Settler Militias.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Combat, Experience and Generals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Individual units gain Combat Experience if they win [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Battles[\LINK], and they can achieve [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]Promotions[\LINK] this way. If your units gather enough Combat Experience, [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_GENERALS]Great Generals[\LINK] may be born in your colonies, who give your units Combat Bonuses, extra Experience and access to several promotions that are otherwise unreachable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK][\BOLD] - These Elite Units can be acquired through multiple means: exploring [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] and they can be offered by your [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK] as well as a [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Diplomatic Event[\LINK], as long as you are at war with a Native Tribe. The [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] may provide you with some of these units as well, when he urges you to exterminate a particular Native tribe.[NEWLINE]Conquistadores get a +50% bonus against all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Melee Units[COLOR_REVERT] (including other Conquistadores), and a 50% Combat bonus against [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Native Mercenaries[COLOR_REVERT] as well. As such, they are primarily useful for waging wars against Natives, who employ mainly Melee units. Other European military units are generally too strong for the Conquistador.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_BRAVE]Braves[\LINK][\BOLD] - These melee warriors are only available to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Natives[COLOR_REVERT]. They are relatively weak, but they get attack bonuses when attacking units in [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FOREST]Forests[\LINK] or [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK]. When native tribes are at war, they usually send swarms of countless braves to the lands of their foes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gunpowder Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gunpowder Units[COLOR_REVERT] are infantry units that are equipped with [LINK=YIELD_MUSKETS]Guns[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=PROFESSION_MUSKETMAN]Musketmen[\LINK][\BOLD] - Musketmen are your basic Gunpowder units. Any colonist can adopt this profession, as long as there are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guns[COLOR_REVERT] present to equip them. They are stronger than most Melee units, with a Combat Strength of 3. They receive Defensive Bonuses, and as such are primarily useful for [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defending Settlements[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guerrilla Warfare[COLOR_REVERT] in the Hills and the Woods.[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_RANGER]Rangers[\LINK][\BOLD] - Rangers are Elite Units that are experts in fighting in the Wilderness. They get a Combat Bonus when fighting in Forests and Jungles, both when attacking and defending. On top of that, they are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Invisible[COLOR_REVERT] to nearly all enemy units (except Natives), which makes them particularly useful as Commandoes in hostile territory.[NEWLINE]Rangers can be acquired through [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Diplomatic Events[COLOR_REVERT] in which your King offers you to buy these units, and are also provided by certain [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Founding Fathers[COLOR_REVERT].[PARAGRAPH:1][BOLD][LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Native Mercenaries[\LINK][\BOLD] - Native Mercenaries are Elite Units that can fight exceptionally well in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wilderness[COLOR_REVERT], just like Rangers. TEXT.English: [H1]FORTS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FORT]Forts[\LINK] are improvements that give your [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Military Units[\LINK] a great Defensive Bonus once they're stationed inside.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Constructing Forts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Forts are constructed by [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK]. They can construct Forts on any tile that does not fall inside the [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK] of another nation, whether it is a [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native Tribe[\LINK] or a fellow [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Colonial Power[\LINK].[NEWLINE]They take quite some time to construct, so it is advisable to use multiple Pioneers to build them.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Working Forts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Once a Fort is constructed, it is not necessary claimed by any nation. If it is empty, any unit may enter it and put it into use.[NEWLINE]To [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Work[COLOR_REVERT] a Fort, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fortify[COLOR_REVERT] a Military Unit inside. For a list of Military Units, click [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]here[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Once a Fort is worked, its [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Effects[COLOR_REVERT] spring into action (see below). TEXT.German: [H1]Forts[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FORT]Forts[\LINK] sind Geländefeldverbesserungen, die den darin stationierten [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Militäreinheiten[\LINK] einen starken Verteidigungsbonus geben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Bau von Forts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Forts werden von [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pionieren[\LINK] errichtet. Sie können auf jedem Feld errichtet werden, dass nicht in den [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Grenzen[\LINK] einer anderen Nation liegt, seien es [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK] oder eine [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]rivalisierende Kolonialmacht[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Der Bau dauert eine Weile und man kann sich überlegen gleich mehrere Pioniere dafür einzusetzen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Nutzung von Forts[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Nachdem ein Fort erbaut wurde, muss es bemannt werden. Ein unbesetztes Fort kann von jeder Nation in Besitz genommen werden. Zur Bemannung eines Forts muss eine Militäreinheit darin [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]befestigt[COLOR_REVERT] werden. Eine Uebersicht zu Militäreinheiten findet sich [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]hier[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Sobald ein Fort bemannt wurde, werde auch einige [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Effekte[COLOR_REVERT] aktiviert (siehe weiter unten). Nach einiger Zeit wird dann aus einem normalen Fort auch ein [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LARGE_FORT]Grosses Fort[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Effekte[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Der Bau von Forts bietet viele kleine Vorteile für ihre Kolonie.[PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK] die eine Gegend mit einem Fort durchwandern werden oft eingeschüchtert und wagen weniger [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ueberfälle[COLOR_REVERT] auf die [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlungen[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=CONCEPT_ANIMALS]Wilde Tiere[\LINK] werden meist auch vertrieben oder manchmal direkt getötet.[PARAGRAPH:1]Am wichtigsten ist aber natürlich der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Verteidigungsbonus[COLOR_REVERT] für die darin stationierten Truppen. Wie die Befestigungen einer Kolonie kann auch ein Fort durch [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bomardierung[COLOR_REVERT] mit Belagerungswaffen oder Schiffen geschwächt werden.[PARAGRAPH:1]Forts können auch [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]automatisch auf Gegner in der Nähe feuern[COLOR_REVERT] und diese dadurch schwächen und manchmal sogar vernichten. Forts können aber nur auf Landeinheiten und nicht auf [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Schiffe[\LINK] feuern, wie es die hohen Ausbaustufen der Befestiungsanlagen einer Stadt können.[NEWLINE]Ein Fort kann nur ein einziges Mal pro Runde selbstständig feuern. Der angerichtete Schaden bei den Feinden hängt von der Stärke der stationierten Einheiten und der Verteidigungsstärke der angegriffenen Einheit ab.

TEXT.English: [H1]RIVERS[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The lands of the [LINK=CONCEPT_NEW_WORLD]New World[\LINK] are criss-crossed by numerous [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rivers[COLOR_REVERT]. These Rivers form the lifeblood of the various cultures of the New World, and your [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]colonies[\LINK] will prosper if you make use of them wisely. They sometimes provide a [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Strategic[\LINK] advantage as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Locations of Rivers[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Rivers occur in areas where rainfall is abundant. Generally, you can expect them near the equator and in temperate climates, and there will be more Rivers near the [LINK=TERRAIN_COAST]Coast[\LINK] as well. In effect, this means that you will mainly find them near [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]Marsh[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grass[\LINK] terrain, while [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]Tundra[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_SNOW]Permafrost[\LINK] and especially [LINK=TERRAIN_DESERT]Desert[\LINK] terrain seldom feature Rivers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Production Bonuses[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Rivers provide numerous [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Yield Bonuses[COLOR_REVERT] for [LINK=CONCEPT_ECONOMY]Raw Materials[\LINK].[NEWLINE]For the majority of the yields, a River simply provides a production bonus of +1. There are two Raw Materials whose production is [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]unaffected[COLOR_REVERT] by the presence of a River: [LINK=YIELD_RAW_SALT]Rock Salt[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_STONE]Stone[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Buildings that require Rivers[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If a [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Settlement[\LINK] borders a River, it gains access to several [LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]Buildings[\LINK] that would be unavailable to them otherwise. Usually, these buildings are the highest level [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]upgrades[COLOR_REVERT] of a particular Building chain. These buildings include the [LINK=BUILDING_WATERMILL]Watermill[\LINK] and the [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_TOOL_FACTORY]Great Tool Factory[\LINK], so if you found a colony where you plan to build any of these, make sure you build it on a riverside![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Strategic Importance[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Rivers also play a role in [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Warfare[\LINK]. Crossing a River gives an attacking [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Military Unit[\LINK] a 10% Combat Penalty.[NEWLINE]This can be eliminated, however, by acquiring the [LINK=PROMOTION_AMPHIBIOUS]Keen Swimmer[\LINK] Promotion.

TEXT.German: [H1]Flüsse[\H1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Das Land der [LINK=CONCEPT_NEW_WORLD]Neuen Welt[\LINK] ist durchzogen von einer Vielzahl von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Flüssen[COLOR_REVERT]. Diese Flüsse sind die Lebensadern der vielfältigen Kulturen der Neuen Welt, aber auch eurer [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Kolonien[\LINK], die durch diese besser gedeihen können. Manchmal bieten sie auch strategische Vorteile.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Vorkommen der Flüsse[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Flüsse gibt es vor allem in Gebieten mit viel Regenfall. Im allgemeinen kann man sie verstärkt in der Nähe de Aequators und in mildem Klima erwarten aber auch etwas mehr in der Nähe der [LINK=TERRAIN_COAST]Küste[\LINK]. Effektiv bedeutet dies, dass Geländeformen, wie [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]Sumpf[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savanne[\LINK] oder [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grasland[\LINK] etwas mehr Flüsse aufweisen, während [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]Tundra[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_SNOW]Permafrost[\LINK] und ganz speziell [LINK=TERRAIN_DESERT]Wüste[\LINK] selten Flüsse haben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Produktionsbonusse[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Flüsse geben viele [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ertragsbonusse[COLOR_REVERT] auf [LINK=CONCEPT_ECONOMY]Rohmaterialien[\LINK].[NEWLINE]Für die Mehrzahl der Erträge, generiert ein Fluss eine Ertragssteigerung von +1. Nur zwei Rohmaterialien sind davon [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ausgenommen[COLOR_REVERT]: [LINK=YIELD_RAW_SALT]Steinsalz[\LINK] und [LINK=YIELD_STONE]Stein[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Gebäude, die Flüsse benötigen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Wenn eine [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlung[\LINK] an einem Fluss liegt, ermöglicht diese den Bau einiger [LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]Gebäude[\LINK], die sonst nicht möglich wären. Gewöhnlich handelt es sich dabei um die höchste [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ausbaustufe[COLOR_REVERT] einer Gebäudekette. Zu diesen Gebäuden gehören beispielsweise die [LINK=BUILDING_WATERMILL]Wassermühle[\LINK] oder die [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_TOOL_FACTORY]Grosse Eisenwarenfabrik[\LINK][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Strategische Bedeutung[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Flüsse spielen auch im [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]Krieg[\LINK]eine Bedeutung. über einen Fluss anzugreifen führt zu einem Kampfstärkeabzug von 10% Combat Penalty.[NEWLINE]Dies kann jedoch mit bestimmten Beförderungen umgangen werden.
